loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.en:
Anatoliy is married and has one son. He manufactures wooden objects with his hands. He has been in this business for 8 years already. Anatoliy enjoys making objects out of wood and other people enjoy his craftsmanship, too. They order many different things from Anatoliy. Anatoliy has very few competitors. This allows his business to be unique and very profitable.

Anatoliy would like to receive 6,000 UAH to purchase materials for his work. He needs to buy them in bulk. Anatoliy's work not only gives joy to him and his customers but allows him to take good care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for woodworking

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.ru: Холмуратова Сановбар проживает в районе Шахринау. Возраст 44 года. Уже 10 саммостоятельно работает в сфере бизнеса. Открыла свой магазин и торгует одеждой и другими промышленными товарами. Торговая точка находится в центре района. Планирует получить кредит и использовать его для ввоза нового товара. Это обеспечит ей привлечение новых клиентов , а так же дополнительную прибыль. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sanovbar H. resides in the region of Shahrinau. She is 44 years old, and for the past ten years has had her own business. She opened her own store and trades in clothing and other manufactured goods. Her trade outlet is located in the heart of the district. She plans to take out a loan and use it to bring in new products. This will ensure that she will attract new customers, as well as make additional profit. Sanovbar will be able to repay the loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Abigil

texts.en: Abigil is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She sells goats and rams at Saja market in Ogbomosho, Oyo State, Nigeria. The demand for her goats and rams is high, and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is indeed grateful to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more goats and rams to sell.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Soun S. P., 37, is married with five young children living at home in the Kampong Cham province. She works as a farmer, typically making US$1 a day. Her husband, Moun Soa, is a construction worker who typically makes about US$4 a day. Soun S. P. would like a loan of US$1000 to purchase a trailer and build a stand to sell vegetables at the market. She believes that these purchases will allow her to increase her income and be able to better support her large family.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer and build a vegetable stand

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.ru: Хусейнов Сайфулло житель района Рудаки. Проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 38 лет ,женат и имеет четверых детей. Строитель. Работает по найму .   Параллельно с этим занимается торговлей. Торгует овощами и фруктами. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Saifullo H. is a resident of the Rudaki area. He is 38 years old, is married and has four children. He is a construction worker. Saifullo works for hire. Parallel to this he is a salesman. He sells fruits and vegetables. Saifullo plans to take out a loan in order to increase his inventory. He can pay back the loan over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en: Zumrud Q. is a 38-year-old woman who raises calves in the small village of Agsu. She is married and has five children!  Zumrud is a housewife and her business is the only source of income in her family. She got into this business when she was very young, and thanks to know-how that her parents shared with her, she is very experienced in her business. Financial limits don’t allow her to expand her business enough. Now she has applied for 1500 USD as a loan to purchase three calves and fodder.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Mrs. Thon N. is 46 years old and lives in a small wooden house with her husband in Siem Reap Province. They have a workshop from which they sell electronic tools. Almost all of their clients are neighbors and other people who live near their village. Besides selling tools, N.'s husband also repairs old electronics for additional income.

The couple have no children but plan to birth a child next year. Because the family's business is growing and gaining clients, N. and her husband are applying for a loan to purchase additional spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts.

loans.name: Sadifa

texts.en: Sadifa O. was born in 1963. She is married and has two children. She comes from an entrepreneurial village. Her husband works outside of Bosnia and comes home from time to time. Sadifa has worked in farming for a long time and she has been our client for years. She took three loans from MCF WWI and repaid them successfully. All loans were invested in the poultry business and Sadifa has developed a network for the sale of chicken meat. So, she requested her fourth loan in the amount of 800 KM to purchase poultry. Sadifa`s wish is to build her own poulterer and keep this business running.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph N. runs a provisions store by the roadside in his community. He also deals mainly in bags of sugar. He procures bags of sugar and other groceries from supermarkets in surrounding bigger towns and also from vans that come round to distribute. Joseph has been in business for over thirty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock.

Joseph is 65 years old, married and has eight children: six sons and two daughters. Some of his children are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Others are out of school and working. His wife is a trader. Joseph lives with his wife and children in a family house in Suhum, a town in Ghana. Suhum is a busy business centre in the Eastern Region. The majority of the inhabitants are into one type of business activity or another.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell

loans.name: Komlanvi Gawonou

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur exerce dans la restauration, il a commencé cette activité depuis 2006 dans son propre cafétéria qu’il a appelé « BON GOUT », les jeunes célibataires viennent déjeuner chez lui et il réalise plus de recettes les week-ends. Il veut installer un autre cafétéria dans un autre quartier pour pouvoir gagner plus d’argent, il demande à WAGES un crédit qui lui permettra de réaliser ce projet.
Il est marié, c’est avec le revenu de cette activité qu’il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who has been working in the restaurant business since 2006 in his own cafeteria, which he calls “BON GOUT”. Young unmarried people come to his place for lunch, and he realizes more income on the weekends. He wants to establish another cafeteria in another district in order to earn more money. He is asking WAGES for a loan enabling him to realize this project. He is married. With the revenues from this business, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Setting up a new cafeteria

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Taking care of a special child is really difficult. It requires patience and willpower, but with the case of Mrs. Estela T., she is lucky to be assisted by the Department of Social Welfare and Development (DSWD). She and her husband are blessed with eight children. Their youngest, who is 22 years old, is a special child. But it does not hinder her from engaging in fish vending.

Estela sells different kinds of fish. Aside from that, she also sells cell-phone load credits in their village. With her businesses, she is able to earn an average income of PHP 1,400 weekly that is very helpful to her family. According to her, making her business progressive will surely uplift their lives; thus she seeks a PHP12,000 loan from Kiva.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Randolfo De La Cruz

texts.es:
En el municipio El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Randolfo E. se dedica a su actividad de venta de repuestos de bicicletas las cuales son comercializadas por el mismo en su propio local fijo donde a diario le visitan clientes para la compra de repuestos. También es importante destacar que él tiene muchas habilidades para reparar las bicicletas. 

La razón por la que el señor Randolfo ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los repuestos y de esta manera ofertarlos en su establecimiento con el fin de obtener ingresos para continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Randolfo E. sells bicycle replacement parts in the El Viejo municipality of the city of Chandega. He sells them from his own fixed location. Every day customers come to buy replacement parts. It is important to note that he is very talented at repairing bicycles. The reason that Randolfo has come to Cerodel to ask for a loan is to buy replacement parts. This way he can sell them in his establishment and get the income to continue supporting his nuclear family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bicycle replacement parts

loans.name: Ledis

texts.es:
La señora Ledis, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Barco”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Chucuito Sector Barco, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 21 años D. edad, D. estado civil conviviente, es madre D. 1 hija.  Tiene estudios D. secundaria completa.  Vive Chucuito Sector Barco.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 7 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó como capital para su negocio D. pesca artesanal. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para implementar su negocio D. pesca artesanal, comprará redes, y es  así como va a lograr ampliar más su producción.

Su deseo es formar una empresa D. venta D. pescado en Ilo ya que ahí ya esta comprando sus implementos D. pesca.

A ella le gustan las facilidades del préstamo y las orientaciones que les dan en las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de redes para ampliar su produccion de pesca.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
At the age of 30, Julieta Z. is still single. She lives with her parents in the peaceful village of Alinguigan, Ilagan, Isabela. Julieta dreams of having her own stable business someday. She doesn’t aspire to be married anymore; what she wants now is to have a source of income to provide for herself and to help her parents with their daily expenditures.

Julieta joined ASKI to acquire working capital in order to have a small business. She has used a loan to purchase Avon, MSE, Natasha products, and so on. She has paid off her previous loan already and now she is on her second loan with ASKI.

Julieta is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP from Kiva lenders, and she is hoping that she will again be entrusted with these funds. The loan will be used to expand her direct selling business. She plans to buy more Avon, MSE, Natasha and Boardwalk products so she will have actual products, in addition to the brochures she brings her customers. Julieta has already proven that having actual products with her is an advantage, which is the reason why she’d like to avail of a loan.

loans.use: To expand a direct selling business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a 26-year-old married mother of three children. For the past five years she has been selling local breeds of chicken next to the bus terminus. She plans to buy a large stock of chickens with her next loan of 30,000 KES so as to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a large stock of chickens

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana A. is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Vaiusu. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Ana owns and operates a business venture in the arts sector operating a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling wood handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Ana has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

Ana joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana successfully repaid a previous loan of 2250 WST from SPBD, which she used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. Ana is now requesting a new loan of 2950 WST, which will also be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. The loan will be the fifth loan Ana has taken out from SPBD. Ana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells paper and aluminum to make a living. She has been in the business for a long time. Gloria is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business and her family out of poverty. Gloria hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more paper and aluminum to sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more paper and aluminum to sell

loans.name: Chiabi

texts.en:
C. is married with five children and lives in P.MI Nkwen, a quarter in Bamenda, Cameroon. She will invest her loan in her cosmetics business. She is a very hard working lady, and is literate but unemployed. She lost her father at a tender age which still disturbs her. Being unemployed by the government, she switched to the cosmetics business which has given her some minimal profit to take care of her family. She plans to invest her loan in increasing her cosmetics business.

This is C.'s third loan; she has been a member since 2007. This loan will help her cosmetics business to succeed because she will be able increase her items. She will also be able to purchase original make-up for beauty. With the profits from this loan, C. will save money for future use. She will also pay her children and ensure that they are well prepared for school. Her training in business management that she received from GHAPE will help her to invest this loan in the most efficient and productive manner.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a fifty-five year old, married and a mother of six children, all in school.  She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana.  Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. She is a trader. Esther trades in food items such as vegetables, tin foods, etc. She sells goods on a table top at the market square in her community.  Esther buys the goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for over nineteen years and requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a fish seller. She sells ice fish to make a living in her community in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is a focused, hard worker. She is very determined to lift her business and her family out of poverty. She is married with seven children and she is 56 years old. She has been in this business for a long time.

Mary hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more ice fish to sell. This is the high season for her business, and she hopes to make more profits for her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell kola nuts

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group No. 2

texts.en:
Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is an association of female commercantes (vendors) working in Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar. The association, named after an important marabout (a religious leader in West African Islam), was founded in 2006 by a group of entrepreneurial women from the Cité Lamy neighborhood. The aim was to help the members finance their small businesses through a revolving savings fund called a tontine, in which members contribute a small amount to the pot each month to finance one member's activities.  

Today, the association has evolved to secure group loans for its members through cooperation with UIMCEC, a Kiva partner. Groups of five are financed through 10-month loans in which each member receives an equal amount. On the 20th of each month, the members of the association hold a meeting to collect the repayments.  Currently, there are 14 groups of women financed through UIMCEC. Sope Serigne Babacar Sy is headed by Ms. CoumB. F., the president, and Ms. Oumu Ngom, the treasurer.  

Awa N., the mother of six, is the head of group No. 2. One could say she is an international businesswoman: She travels several times per year to neighboring Mauritania to purchase shoes, fabrics and incense, bringing it back to Thies to sell door-to-door. She makes the journey most often at night, when there is less traffic. The small bus leaves Thies around 2 a.m., arriving just across the border around 8 a.m. Awa then takes the day to find the best deals, returning once again in the evening. The whole excursion typically takes about 24 hours. She says the prices in Mauritania are much lower than in Senegal.

Issane F., another member of the group, agrees. She makes the same trip, often buying mobile phones, which can sell for double the price back in Thies. The other three group members are: Aissatou D., who sells guedia (dried fish); Codou Kairé, who sells fresh fish; and Awa B., whom sells monkey bread (baobab fruit), perfumes and other diverse items.  Each group member receives a 100,000 CFA franc credit to finance their activities.

loans.use: Bolster each member's small business

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Нурова Шахноза проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 22 года. Не замужем. Животноводством занимается 2 года. Нурова Шахноза откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Shahnoza N. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 22 years and single. She has been involved in animal husbandry for 2 years. Shahnoza raises and sells livestock. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Mao N. is 37 years old and lives in Roluos village in Takeo province. She is the mother of three children who all attend the local public school. Mao N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sovana Tom (pictured right), is a duck seller. The family has a problem because their motorbike is too old to drive and they do not have enough money to buy a replacement. Therefore, Mrs. Mao N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new motorbike for selling ducks door to door.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for selling ducks door to door

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sell palm oil

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  Danaya est composé de cinq  femmes mariées majoritairement dans  des grandes familles traditionnelles, avec en moyenne 34ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Téssérèla chef lieu d’une commune rurale de la préfecture de Barouéli (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. 
Elles sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire et vendent des  articles divers et des céréales. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 sacs de riz, 14 sacs de mil, 10 sacs d’arachide en gousse, 1sac de gombo séché, 3 cartons de savons de lessive et ½ de sac savon local « Gabacourouni ». 
Elles s’approvisionnent à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou, sur place à Téssérèla, dans les villages environnants et à la foire hebdomadaire de N’Gassola.  La vente de ces produits se fait à domicile, aux foires hebdomadaires de  N’Gassola et Téssérèla  au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 200FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les prêts de Soro Yiriwaso, acheter des petits ruminants et participer aux évènements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes et funérailles).
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of five women, married for the most part into traditional extended families, and are on average 34 years old with five children. They live in Téssérèla, the head village of a rural community, part of the Barouéli prefecture (4th administrative region of Mali). They got acquainted through marriage and family ties, and as neighbors. They are requesting a first group loan, to retail various items and grain cereals. The loan will be used to buy: five bags of rice, 14 bags of millet, 10 bags of unshelled peanuts, one bag of dried gombo, three cases of laundry detergent and ½ bag of local «Gabacourouni» soap. They get their supplies from the weekly Segou and N’Gassola market fairs, and locally in Téssérèla. They retail their products from their homes, at the weekly market fairs in N’Gassola and Téssérèla, for cash or credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They hope to attain average monthly earnings of 32,200 FCFA each, part of which will be used to reimburse the Soro Yiriwaso loan, and the remainder to buy small livestock and participate in social events (weddings, baptisms and funerals).

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Anna Akinyi

texts.en:
Anna Akinyi O. operates a hotel (term used for a basic restaurant) in Dunga, Kisumu, Kenya. She started this business in the year 2000. Previously, she sold vegetables as a source of income.

She is 31 years-old and married with four children and has been instrumental in supporting her husband in providing for the family. She would like a loan of Ksh.20,000 to be able to increase her stock and expand her business in order to achieve her dream of her family having a house of their own where they no longer pay rent and will therefore be able to save enough for their children’s future education.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Yeredon (Se Connaître) Group

texts.fr:
Yeredon est un regroupement de femmes, toutes mariées, ayant  en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris et enfants dans la quartier Madina Koura de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région de la république du Mali). 
Le groupe Yeredon fait essentiellement l’achat et la vente des chaussures, des habits, des fruits et légumes etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe Yeredon ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur  cinquième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Quant à l’utilisation du prêt, Awa Koné, qui excelle dans l’habillement compte se procurer  de ses marchandises constituées de pagnes wax, d’habits pour femmes et enfants et des draps de lits  à Bobo Dioulaso (Burkina Faso). Elle vend ses articles,  au grand marché de Koutiala, de façon ambulante dans les entreprises et  de porte en porte dans les quartiers, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle diverse et variée. 
Les autres membres du groupe Yeredon espèrent réaliser un bénéfice de 170 000 FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle et quant à Awa Koné, elle envisage  avoir  au cours du cycle un bénéfice de 205 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt et les  dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Awa Koné ambitionne tout comme celles qui sont dans l’habillement  ouvrir une boutique de vêtements à Koutiala.
texts.en:
Yeredon is a group of married women who average age 34. They live in large, traditional families with their husbands and children in the Madina Koura quarter of Koutiala city (third administrative region of Mali). The Yeredon group buys and sells shoes, clothing, fruits, vegetable, etc. To increase the size of their business, the members of the Yeredon group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program three years ago. They are on their fifth group loan; all of their previous loans have been repaid in full. With this loan, Awa Koné - whose excels selling clothing - counts on buying merchandise like waxed fabric, female and children's clothing, and bed sheets in Bobo Dioulaso (in Burkina Faso). She sells this merchandise at the grand market of Koutiala, traveling to businesses, and door-to-door in surrounding quarters. Her sales are made in cash and credit to a diverse clientele. The other members of the Yeredon group hope to make a profit of 170,000 FCFA each. With Awa Koné, they envision making an additional profit of 205,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and pay for household expenses. Awa Koné, like many who trade clothes, aspires to one day open a clothing store in Koutiala

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Six people who live in Trav village in Prey Veng province make up this group loan. Mr. Sary P. is the group leader, selected by all the members. Each member of the group will use their loan for a different purpose.
Mr. Sary P. is a widower with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory while the others are studying in a local public school. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, not to sell but to support his family. He is also a pig breeder. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it. To improve breeding, Mr. Sary P. is seeking a loan to buy some piglets.

loans.use: To buy some piglets

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 43 años, está casada con Rolando de 46 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos y viven en su acogedora vivienda propia, ubicado en una zona comercial de la ciudad de Santa Ana. Su oficio es preparar caldo de gallina (gallina sancochada en trozos con papa, verduras y fideos); panqueques, café y diferentes comidas de la zona que son muy solicitados por sus exigentes comensales.  Por otro lado su esposo trabaja en el transporte público, teniendo como vehículo su moto carro. De esa manera, ambos pueden cubrir con los gastos domiciliarios, la educación de sus hijos y sus necesidades. Ya son 23 años vendiendo comida durante todas las noches en un puesto ambulante, cerca de un paradero de buses, además tiene 3 motocarros que alquila a terceras personas, con todas estas ganancias vive cómodamente, y como ella es una mujer de negocios, quiere instalar un bar en su vivienda. Su mayor anhelo es tener una pollería, en donde lo administraría junto a su esposo e hijos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se muestra muy entusiasmada por pertenecer a un grupo comunal muy bien organizado, además está atenta a las decisiones que acuerdan los integrantes de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará bebidas gasificadas y algunas golosinas.
texts.en:
Hilda, 43, is married to Rolando, 46, and they have 3 children. They live together in a cozy home that they own, located in a commercial neighborhood of the city of Santa Ana. Her occupation is preparing "caldo de gallina" (chicken boiled in pieces with potatoes, vegetables and noodles), pancakes, coffee and various foods of the area that are much sought after by discerning diners. Her husband, on the other hand, works in public transportation using a motocar (light 3-wheeled passenger vehicle) that he owns. In this way, together they can cover the household expenses and pay for the education and basic needs of their children. She has 23 years of experience selling food in the evenings from a food cart that she positions near a bus stop. In addition, she has 3 motocars that they rent to third parties, and with all of these sources of income they live comfortably. As she is a businesswoman, she wants to set up a bar in her home. Her main wish is to have a pollería (chicken restaurant), that she could run along with her husband and sons. This is the first time that she has had a loan from MFP, and she is very enthusiastic about belonging to a communal group that is so well organized. In addition, she pays attention to the decisions made by the members of her group. With the loan requested, she will buy soft drinks and some snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Kweterana Women's Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
This friendly and very hardworking lady, K. Edisa, has been running a fish-catching and selling business for two years. She transports the fish from Ntungamo to Kampala city, earning her a reasonable profit of 400,000 Ugandan shillings monthly.

Edisa’s main challenge has been having a small stock due to the hindrances of low capital input into her business. This loan will help her buy fishing nets and increase her stock to match her customers’ demand.

Edisa thinks of commercializing her business and expanding it which will enable her to earn more revenue and be able to pay school fees for her four children and other dependents, and cater for other family needs.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and increase her stock of fish

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr:
Madame Catherine Dembélé est âgée de 63 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vit chez son feu mari  dans une grande famille au quartier Pelengana Nord de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fait l’école, elle commença très tôt le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à côté de cette dernière, elle finit par embrasser le commerce de  céréales, qu’elle mène maintenant depuis  11 ans. Elle jouit d’une grande notoriété et clientèle. Elle vend au marché château près des vendeurs de condiments. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de ses articles qui sont très prisés sur le marché.
 Afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 54 mois, après  3 prêts solidaires et 3 prêts individuels correctement  remboursés. 
Elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, une tonne de riz. Elle s’approvisionne à Niono et Séribala auprès des producteurs. Madame Catherine Dembélé  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000FCFA. 
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins (Nourriture, habillement) surtout qu’elle est veuve depuis plusieurs années et vit avec ses petits enfants. 
Son ambition est de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Madame Catherine Dembélé is a 63 year-old widowed mother of five. She lived with her late husband in a large household in the North Pelengana quarter of Ségou (the fourth largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). She did not attend school, and so began working with her mother at an early age, selling condiments. After many years learning the trade alongside her mother, she began selling cereals eleven years ago and has established a good reputation for herself. She sells her goods at the chateau market, alongside other condiment stalls. Her booming sales are thanks to the quality of her goods which are held in high regard. In order to generate higher profits, she has approached Soro Yiriwaso. She has been a customer of theirs for 54 months, and has received 3 community and 3 individual loans, all of which have been successfully repaid. This will be her fourth individual loan, and she aims to use it to buy a ton of rice. She sources her goods from suppliers at Niono and Séribala. Madame Catherine Dembélé takes cash and credit sales from a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to use this loan in order to generate an average monthly profit of 80 000 FCFA. This profit will enable her to see to her family's needs (food and housing), especially since losing her husband a few years ago. Her aim is to build a house to live in.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos a la  señora Evangelina. 

Evangelina tiene 48 años, es conviviente, tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la Ciudad de Urubamba.  Su principal actividad económica de Evangelina es la compra y venta de maíz y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. Ya son varios años que se dedica a los negocios y que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz y comestibles.  
     
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
We visited the "Nueva Visión (New Vision) of Rumichaca" community bank and interviewed Mrs. Evangelina.

Evangelina is 48 years old, lives with her common-law husband, has three children, and lives in the Rumichaca community in the city of Urubamba. Evangelina's main economic activity is buying and selling corn, and she also works selling food such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. She has worked in these businesses and has been a part of the community bank for many years. It is going very well for her, and she needs the loan to buy corn and food.

The group member is thankful for the opportunity provided to her by these means and is committed to repaying the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and food

loans.name: Mrs. Mol Heak Village Bank Group

texts.en: In this village this bank loan has fifteE. people who live in Trapeang Chamkar village in Takeo province. Mrs. Mol H. is a village bank president who is 31-year-old, selected by the other members who will use portion of their loan for varied ways to support their businesses. She is a pig breeder and a side this she is also a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Thuch Chea, is a string seller door-to-door. Since her husband’s business is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Mol H. is finding for a loan to buy more string to resale and rest of the loan she buys fertilizer and more piglets. She is a mother of a child who is too yoU. to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more string to resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria M. is from Lopez Jaena. She is 34 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Susa

texts.en: At present, Susa S. is in the business of selling crates of beer at a bar.  She is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and popular wines such as white wine, etc. to sell.  Susa is 36 years-old and is married with a husband who is a police officer. She has three children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits generated through her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: To stock beer.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila A. is from the village of Bago. She is 56 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Cirila owns a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cirila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Cirila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Jesusisa

texts.en:
Jesusisa Sta. A. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Jesusisa is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Jesusisa owns and operates a business venture in the food sector butchering and selling meat in the market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering and selling poultry meat in the market. Jesusisa has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jesusisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesusisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Jesusisa is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jesusisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital.

loans.name: Jazgul's Group

texts.en:
Jazgul M., 27, is the leader of the group. She is married and has three children, the oldest of whom is in school. Her husband works at a building site. The family makes their living by selling cattle Two years ago, they had took out a loan so they could begin their own business. During these years, they have managed to improve their housing conditions. Jazgul’s family hopes to get a loan so they can buy hay for the cattle. In the future, they want to increase cattle stock. 

Ryskul S., 33, is the treasurer of the group. She is married and has four sons: the eldest one is a college student and the rest are schoolboys. The family's main income comes from cattle breeding. In addition, her husband makes 5,000 soms per month as a tractor operator. Out of their profits, they have managed to make house repairs. Ryskul wants a loan to purchase five livestock animals. In the future, they want to open their own shop.

Adilet M., 27, is married and has has three children (two sons and a daughter, all of whom are of preschool age). Adilet’s husband is a taxi-driver who makes 10,000 soms per month. The family also breeds cattle. They will use this loan to buy hay for cattle feeding and to buy car spare parts. 

Medin S., 46, is married and has three children. His wife, makes 4,500 soms a month working in an archival depository. The eldest son raises money by working in “Dordoi” company, the second son is a schoolboy, and the daughter is a seamstress. Ten years ago, they used a loan to purchase seven livestock animals, and they have run this business since then. During the years of working hard, they have managed to make repairs to their house. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
• People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
• Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) 
• Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members receive special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle

loans.name: Unidos Para El Exito Group

texts.es: La unión hace la fuerza, es el lema que lleva siempre presente el grupo comunal Unidos Para El Éxito. Con formado por 10 socios, el cual tiene la única meta de salir siempre adelante. Un caso en particular es el del señor Alex López de 35 años de edad, cada día se levanta muy temprano para abrir su tienda de abarrotes el cual le ha dado muchos ingresos y satisfacciones por más de 4 años, pudiendo ahorra para comprar muebles para su casa y una moto taxi el cual está comenzando a trabajarla. Y más adelante le gustaría terminar de construir algunas habitaciones para poder rentarlas. Con el reciente préstamo los invertirá para comprar una vitrina donde se exhiben los productos de abarrotes y mercadería para la campaña navideña que se acerca pronto. No puedo concluir sin antes dar mención a la iniciativa que tiene cada integrante del grupo  para surgir económicamente por el bienestar de sus familias y sus negocios.
texts.en: "Unity is strength" is the slogan that this group, Unidos Para El Exito, always carries with them. The group is formed by 10 members, whose only goal is to always get ahead. A particular case of this is Mr. Alex L., who is 35 years old. Everyday he wakes up very early to open up his grocery store, which has provided him with good income and a lot of satisfaction in the last 4 years. The store has allowed him to buy furniture for his home and a motorcycle taxi which he is starting to use as another source of income. In the future he would like to be able to build houses to then rent them. He will use this loan to buy a glass cabinet to display his groceries as well as Christmas merchandise given the upcoming holidays. In his interview, he mentioned that each other member of the group has shown initiative to keep improving economically for the well-being of their family and their business.

loans.use: To buy a glass cabinet to display products

loans.name: Rosa Armida

texts.es:
Rosa Armida M. C. tiene 25 años. Es soltera vive con los padres y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar.   Tiene 4 hijos.

Rosa pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura con sus padres siembra maíz y papa, todos los hermanos ayudan en esta actividad,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar maíz y arroz para tener su propio negocio y dar el estudio a los hijos.
Le gusta trabajar, pasar con los hijos ayudar a la familia y festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Rosa Armida M. C. is 25 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents and children.  She lives in Guaranda canton in the province of Bolívar.  She has 4 children.

Rosa belongs to the Guantucoto solidarity group which is located half an hour from Guaranda.  It is a group that works in crop farming and livestock farming, especially the sowing of corn and potatoes in the mountain region and rice in the coastal region.  This solidarity group has 25 members.

Rosa farms with her parents.  She sows corn and potatoes.  All her brothers and sisters help with this activity.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for sowing corn and potatoes.  The support of this loan will help her to fulfil her family's financial needs.  They face challenges such as pests and diseases in their crops.  Her dream is to buy corn and rice, to have her own business and to make sure her children study.

She likes to work, spend time with her children, help her family and celebrate carnaval.

loans.use: To buy supplies for sowing corn and potatoes

loans.name: Gladys Natividad

texts.es:
Gladys vende productos Yambal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes). Vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Para mantener a sus hijas ya que es madre soltera empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal. Poco a poco incremento su cartera de clientes ofreciendo los productos a sus conocidos. Vende perfumes desde $ 15.00 hasta $ 55.00 c/u, cremas muy económicas. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas y ropa para iniciar con las ventas. En el futuro quiere vender otra clase de productos y dirigir sus ventas en otros lugares.
texts.en:
Gladys sells Yambal products (a company that offers entrepreneurial women the chance to become independent sales reps for their products).  She lives in Primavera de Duran (a peri-urban zone outside of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecology).

She started selling Yambal products to support her daughters, because she is a single mother.  Little by little, she increased her customer base, offering the products to her acquaintances.

She sells perfumes from $15.00 to $55.00 c/u, very affordable creams.  She would like to use the loan to buy Yambal products such as perfumes, creams, and clothing to sell.  In the future, she would like to sell other product lines and expand her sales efforts to other areas.

loans.use: Perfumes, cosmetics.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar:
علي طموح يعمل في اكسسوار الدراجات النارية علي يحب عائلته فهو متزوج وينتظر مولود جديد لكنه يحلم بأن يؤمن له
معيشة كريمة علي عمره 34 سنة له في عمله 8 سنوات له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه محبوب يحب عمله ويطمح دائما الى تطوير نفسه وعمله
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له المجموعة شراء دراجات نارية قديمة وبيعها بالمفرق وشراء قطع غيار دراجات نارية له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه
يلقى دعم من عائلته بشكل مميز حيث
texts.en: Ali is a 34-year-old husband and soon-to-be-father who wants to secure a dignified living standard for his growing family. Ali has eight years experience dealing in motorcycle accessories, and he is very popular with his customers who come from the neighborhood and other local communities. Ali loves his work and is always striving to further develop it. In that vein, he is interested in asking for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy motorcycle parts and old motorcycles which he could retail.

loans.use: To purchase used motorcycles for repair and resale

loans.name: Jose Aurelio

texts.es:
Don José Aurelio, tiene 43 años de edad, reside en San Carlos departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la albañilería, construcción y mejoramiento de viviendas, así como también servicio de instalación de energía eléctrica, él vive con su esposa y sus hijos: Estela Patricia de 17 años, Nilson Javier de 15, Tania Maritza de 10 años de edad.
Don José tiene más de 16 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00am a 3:00pm, aprendió esta labor de su padre. Hoy don José solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto para el cual necesita comprar bloques, hierro, lamina, cemento, arena y piedra, con esta ayuda podrá construir y ampliar la casa ya que contaran con una nueva habitación.
Su propósito es cancelar puntualmente el préstamo, dar a sus hijos el estudio necesario para que se superen, y terminar completamente la construcción de la casa.
texts.en:
José Aurelio is 43 years old.  He lives in San Carlos, in Morazán department.  He works as a builder, building and improving houses.  He also installs electricity services.  He lives with his wife and children: 17 year-old Estela Patricia, 15 year-old Nilson Javier and 10 year-old Tania Maritza.

José has been in this business for more than 16 years and learned the trade from his father.  He works from 6.00am to 3.00pm.  José is currently requesting a loan to build a room.  He needs to buy blocks, iron, metal sheeting, cement, sand and stone.  With this help, he will be able to build and expand his house with a new room.  His goal is to pay off his loan on time, provide his children with the education they need to get ahead and to finish building his house.

loans.use: To buy blocks, iron, metal sheeting, cement, sand and stone

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. Mao C. is a villager in Kbal Chrouy in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow and sell crops to support his family. He has problems in his field because it has infertile soil, is located far from an irrigation system, and has a lot of insects. 

Mr. Mao C. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. His wife, Mrs. Cheav Hor Khuy, is a coffee seller in a local village where she is able to earn some money to support the family, too. This couple has five children, two of whom are fruit sellers. The others attend the local public school. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide.

loans.name: Wallan's Group

texts.en:
Wallan resides in Muhallah N. park which is a small housing colony of city Sahiwal. Sahiwal is a city located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She lives there with her family in a 2 room brick house for over 21 years. 
She is 43 years old housewife, prefers to stay at home and does her household responsibilities. She got married to M. A. who is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to the passengers and drops them to their destinations.  
Wallan is the mother of 2 sons. Both are illiterate and do work to financially support the family. Her elder son is also a driver by profession while younger one has a construction supplies selling business. 
Wallan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan he will buy a rickshaw. Currently he drives rickshaw on rent and almost one third of his income goes to the rickshaw owner. By purchasing his own rickshaw he will be able to work without any time restrictions and he will never be bound to share his earn amount with anyone. 
Wallan is hopeful that her husband’s business will grow by purchasing a rickshaw which will be resulted in better financial living standard of her family. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy a rckshaw for driving business

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Antonio de Caacupé.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Rosa Ramona O., ella vive con su marido y sus 4 hijos, trabaja en su copetín, como también sus compañeras. Están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y KIVA, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras están en el primer ciclo con sus 10 integrantes.
texts.en:
The women of this existing committee are from the neighborhood of San Antonio in Caacupé.

The committee president is Sra. Rosa Ramona O.. She lives with her husband and four children. Rosa works at a snack bar, as well as her fellow group members. They are very satisfied with the financial support that Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva have provided. With this capital, the women have grown their small businesses as well as their incomes to achieve a better quality of life.

The women are in their first loan cycle with ten members.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, baked goods, beverages (sodas, beer, bottled juices), sweets, candy, and crackers

loans.name: Minata Soriba

texts.fr:
Minata Soriba C. est une veuve âgée de 59 ans et mère  de 4 enfants, qui vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses enfants, sa coépouse et d’autres parents  au quartier Bougoufiè de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença tôt le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires.  Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses cotés, elle évolue seule pour mener le commerce de poissons frais depuis maintenant 30 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et notoriété. Sa force de vente est due à la qualité de  ses poissons (gros) qui sont trop appréciés des clients.    
Dans  le but de satisfaire sa demande clientèle, elle rentra en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 24 mois. Après 2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 200 kg de poissons. Il s’approvisionne sur place. Madame Minata Soriba C. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA, qui lui sert à rembourser son prêt et à se nourrir car elle est veuve.
texts.en:
Minata Soriba C. is a widow, 59 years old, and mother of 4 children. She lives in a traditional family with her children, co-wife, and other relatives in the Bougoufie district of the city of Segou (4th most populous administrative region in the republic of Mali).

Not having attended school for social reasons, she started a small business early on beside her mother who sold condiments.  After several years of apprenticeship at her side, she went alone to start a business selling fresh fish. It has now been 30 years and she enjoys a great experience and reputation.  The strength of her sales is due to the quality of her fish (large) that is very much appreciated by her customers.

In order to satisfy customer demand, she has been in a relationship with Soro Yiriwaso for the past 24 months.  After two small individual loans, both completely repaid, she is on her third individual loan that she plans to use for the purchase of 200 kg of fish.  She buys locally. Mrs. Minata Soriba C. sells for cash and for credit to male and female customers.

She expects to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and feed herself since she is widowed.

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira T. is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married to a constructor. Together they are bringing up a daughter and a son.  In order to earn money to meet the family needs Gulmira sells convenience goods, fruit, and vegetables. She started this activity seven years ago with the initial investment of 10,000 soms. She earns about 3000 soms per month.  

Gulmira hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to increase the variety of goods. Gulmira wants to purchase mandarins and lemons for resale. In the future she hopes to save money and start building a sauna at home.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase lemons and mandarins

loans.name: Tean's Group

texts.en:
There are ten members making up this village bank loan. Mrs. Tean is the village bank president. She was selected as the village bank president by the other members. Each member of this group will use their money to support their different purpose. 
Tean was born in 1967. She is a widow with one child who attends a local school. Tean is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land which she uses to grow rice and corn for a living. She wants to grow rice and corn in the dry seaS., but she doesn’t have enough money to grow it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to support her farming.

loans.use: to support farming

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 38 años, nacido en el distrito de Santa Rosa; esta casado con Alejandra de 36 años y tienen 02 hijos, René de 22 y Kevin de 06 años de edad y cuentan con su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de Pampa Miraflores Anexo del distrito de Santa Rosa. Juan, es el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, es campesino y cuenta con 06 hectáreas de terreno cultivados con plantas de cacao, café y hojas de coca, plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Viene trabajando 25 años en sus propias tierras, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de la mano de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos. Su dificultad es; no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café ya que cuenta con 01hectarea de terreno no cultivado. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, contratará la mano de obra de los jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en las cosechas de café.
texts.en: Gloria is 31 years old, from the Santa Rosa district, married to Elmer who is 36 years old, and together they have 4 children. They have their own home located in the Pampa Miraflores community enclosed by the Santa Rosa district. Gloria and her partner, Elmer, are the support for their family.  Her parents instilled in her from a very young age to work on a small farm.  Gloria is a countrywoman and depends on 4 hectares consisting of coffee, barbasco, and cocoa crops originating from wild areas of Valle Río Apurimac. She has been working on those crops for 11 years.  During harvest season she counts on her children's and worker's help to finish quickly. What she loves most about her work is seeing the fruition of their months of hard work. She considers their biggest challenge to be the transportation of products from their small farm to warehouses located in San Francisco; the place that offers them the best prices for their products. They also have difficulties in making enough money to pay their workers in advance for having helped during harvesting season. This is why they are requesting MFP a loan. At the same time she will prioritize in growing more coffee beans since she has 1 hectare of land not in use. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she feels that this loan will help her progress greatly with her business. She is a well liked member of her communal bank. With the 1,000 Peruvian Soles loan she will hire workers to help her during harvesting season.

loans.use: to hire day laborers to help with his harvest

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Victoria, es casada y tiene 29 años de edad, ella tiene 1 hijo de 7 años; la socia tiene una tienda club de atención de productos herbalife; la socia es dueña de esta tienda que ellos le denominan club, la socia requiere el crédito para comprar productos de esta línea y abastecer su negocio y estos a su vez venderlos a terceros. Estos productos son conocidos como productos de salud naturales hechos a base de hierbas naturales y medicinales. La socia solicita e préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos para la venta.

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SAN RAFAEL” communal bank; This bank is located in the Huanchac District, in the Cusco province and department.

Victoria is married and is 29 years old, she has a 7 year old son; the member has a club store focusing on herbalife products; the member is the owner of this store that is called a club, the member requires the loan to buy this line of products and to supply her business and then sell to third parties. These products are known as natural health products made from a base of natural herbs and medicines. The member is asking for the loan to buy products to sell.

 The member values and is grateful for the loan granted and promises to fulfill the payment of her debts in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María Ávila una mujer humilde y sencilla se dedica a la venta de tostadas en un pequeño bajareque (choza hecha de ramas de la palma de cocos). Ella solicito el crédito para comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus tostadas como son pollo, lechuga, chile, cebolla, quesos, totopos y también para comprar refrescos. Ella esta casada con el señor Juan Mario Gatica quien se dedica a la cosecha de frijol y maíz tiene 3 hijos los cuales 2 estudian la primaria y 1 la secundaria. 
Ella comenta que este préstamo le ayudara mucho ya que podrá comprar un poco más de productos para elaborar mas tostadas y sobre todo comprar refrescos ya que anteriormente vendía aguas frescas de sabores naturales pero sus clientes le piden refrescos y es por ello que comprara este producto y así tener satisfechos a sus clientes. Esta muy contenta con su negocio ya que le ah ayudado mucho con las gastos de su familia y sobre todo a sus hijos, en comprarles los útiles escolares y cuando se enferman tiene para comprarles sus medicinas. Ella tiene poco tiempo con su negocio que inicio debido a la necesidad de obtener dinero para poder solventar los gastos de su casa y para darles estudio a sus hijos.
Ella seguirá trabajando día con día y echándole todas las ganas para engrandecer su negocio ya que es un gran apoyo para su familia porque obtienen dinero y no sufren muchas necesidades porque siempre tienen para comprar lo indispensable.
texts.en:
Rosa María Ávila is a humble and simple woman who sells tostadas in a small hut made from coconut palm branches.  She requested this loan to buy supplies for making her tostadas such as chicken, lettuce, chilis, onion, cheese and tortilla chips, and also to buy sodas.

Rosa is married to Juan Mario Gatica who grows corn and beans.  She has three children.  Two of her children are in elementary school and one is in high school.  She tells us that this loan will help her a lot since it means she will be able to buy a little more in the way of ingredients and make more  tostadas.  Above all, she will also be able to buy sodas.  Previously she sold fresh water with natural flavors but her customers are asking her for soda  and so she will buy it in order to please her customers.

Rosa is very happy with her business which has helped her a lot in covering her family expenses and, above all, her children's expenses.  She is able to buy her children's school supplies and, when they get sick, she is able to buy them medicine.  Rosa hasn't been in her business for long.  She started the business because she needed to make money to cover her household expenses and provide her children with an education.  She will continue working every day.  She is keen to expand her business since it is a great support for her family as they make money and don't have too many unmet needs because they always have enough to buy the bare essentials.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making tostadas

loans.name: Maritzabel

texts.es: Maritzabel Monge Solís, tiene la edad de 25 años, está en unión libre  y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo. Ella pretende con el crédito comprar los insumos necesarios para su excelente producción. Ella cuenta con la propiedad a su posesión y esta plantada, lo que pretende invertir con los insumos para tener una mejor calidad de cosecho y cantidad. Ella quiere crecer como caficultora de la zona y genera los ingresos de su familia para un bienestar más estable. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Maritzabel Monge Solis is 25 years old.  She has a common-law husband and lives with him and their two children.  With the loan, she plans to purchase the necessary supplies for her excellent harvest.  The land is in her possession and is planted, which is why she plans to invest in supplies to have a better harvest in both quality and quantity.  She wants to grow as a coffee grower in the area and earn income for her family in order to have a more stable well-being.  This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any previous loans with national banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted her the loan more easily and with lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies for coffee growing.

loans.name: Jilañani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JILAÑANI” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Tejada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una directiva y tiene como secretaria a la señora Irene. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa, venta de DVD, venta de ropa, venta de tenis, venta de celulares.
 
La señora Irene,  indica que hace tres años atrás trabajaba con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una señora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de CD que aprendió de su tía que traía esta mercadería del Desaguadero, en la actualidad ella ya tiene 9 años trabajando en este negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (comprar mas películas, programas y juegos play), que compra y venderá en la feria 16 de julio (lugar comercial de la cuidad de El Alto) los días jueves y domingos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que la capacitación.

En la fotografía solo aparese la cabeza de la señora Lidia, ya que ella se esncontraba en mala ubicación.
texts.en:
The communal bank Jilañani will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer through the Centro Villa Tejada office. The group is composed of nine members and is managed by a board of directors. The secretary is Señora Irene. The group members' businesses are varied and include selling cosmetics, selling clothing, selling DVDs, selling sneakers, and selling cellular phones.

Señora Irene tells us that she worked with Pro Mujer three years ago, when she joined at the invitation of another woman. She now has a business selling CDs, which she learned from her aunt, who was bringing merchandise from Desaguadero. She has now been working in this business for 9 years.

The loan that she will take out now will increase her working capital so that she can buy more movies, programs, and games, which she buys and will sell in the 16 de Julio market, a commercial center in the city of El Alto, on Thursdays and Sundays. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as far as possible, since she is in a common-law marriage and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training.

In the photograph, only the head of Señora Lidia appears, since she was in a bad location.

loans.use: to buy movies, programs and games to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 4 1 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  ZERLABA, un des villages de la commune de PIMPERNA dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la tomate et le jakatou avec  DJENEBA 1ère à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter au mieux son espace cultural pour en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The 10 members of this BENKADI 5 group are married women with an average age of 41 and three children on average, who mostly live in polygamous families in ZERLABA, one of the villages of the township of PIMPERNA in the prefecture of SIKASSO, third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, and their preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

The crops they cultivate are tomatoes and "jakatou" (a local vegetable), as for example in the case of DJENEBA, the first standing on the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to pay for plowing expenses, to buy farm inputs, and seeds to farm one hectare of land. Her produce is sold in the village and in the market of SIKASSO after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 145,500 F CFA per season.

This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses. She hopes to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso so as to better manage her land and thus earn more from farming it.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and buy farm inputs and seed.

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is 34 years old, married, and blessed with three children. His spouse is Pamela and she owns a salon.  For the last four years he has been doing dairy farming in an Itigo location and earns a monthly income of 6,000 KES.

He has been given a loan from KADET as his first loan and hopes to purchase a dairy cow.  The anticipated profits will be used to educate his children and improve the farm.

He hopes to improve the welfare of his family and own a large dairy farm.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Martha Mercedes

texts.es:
Martha Mercedes tiene 43 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con un hijo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Martha se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener mas ingresos para darle al hijo todo lo necesario.

Le gusta estar con la familia.
texts.en:
Martha Mercedes is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and one child in the Ventanas Canton in los Ríos Province.

The community bank CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES is located in the Los Angeles area, which is part of the Ventanas Canton. The members of this community bank are engaged in work such as growing corn and rice.

Martha works in agriculture, growing corn and rice. She buys supplies at Procan Commercial, and sells her products in the wholesale market of Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to buy supplies and fertilizers for the crops so she can plant corn and rice. The support of the loan will help her financially to meet her needs.  Her dream is to have greater earnings so as to be able to provide everything necessary for her child.

She likes to spend time with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Fish Sellers United Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Fish Sellers United” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema city, in eastern Sierra Leone.  They are requesting a loan of 800,000 SLL for each to enable them to further improve on the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the left is Bintu, who is the leader of this group. Bintu was born in Kenema city. She is married to a pharmacist and the couple has five children. Three of the children are in primary school and two are in secondary school.

Bintu sells fresh fish.She has been doing this business for seven years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying cartons of fresh fish to add to her business to facilitate more sales.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evangeline has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Evangeline has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Akbari's Group

texts.en:
Akbari is a very active lady who supports her family by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very good at her work and prepares beautiful looking clothes by using laces & ribbons. She earns good profits. Her husband is 45 years old and a janitor in the university. 

Akbari has five children. Her youngest child is in fourth class. The other children left their education in their teen-age years and started work to contribute to the family financially. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who has a business making & selling snacks. He makes snacks using a snack-maker machine and sells to his local area clients. He generates income for the family. His clientele base is children and his snacks are very famous among them.
