With the loan, he will buy required ingredients such as gram flour, cumin seeds and cooking oil in bulk quantity and repair the snack-maker to be able to make a larger number of snacks to sell and increase his profits.
 
Akbari hopes that an investment will be a profitable one for her son's business.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients & repair the snack maker

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with ten children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality and price fluctuations in his business. He dreams of expanding his business and educating his children in the future.

With the loan of Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase bales of clothing for resell. He decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Balyeijukira Kiseke Group

texts.en: Sarah is 40 years old and married. She has 5 children, ages 11 to 21, who live in her house in Hoima, Uganda. She has been operating a bar and shop for 10 years. Sarah's business is now affected by the challenge of people who pay their debts late. Her dream is to have a big bar. Sarah needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 55-years-old and lives in P-4 Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with 4 children.
 
Elma has a motorcycle business and earns approximately PHP 3000.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase one unit of motorcycle. 

Elma has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Elma hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one unit of motorcycle.

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester is 34 years old, married, and has one child. To earn a living, he runs an insurance agency. He started the business six years ago and employs one person to assist him. To make more money, he also conducts educational training in other organizations. Sylvester hopes to expand his business and grow his clientele. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a computer for use in his office.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an order of cosmetics: lotions, lipstick, creams, and make up.

loans.name: Wilfredo Rene

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo, es cliente antiguo de emprender, y también sacó varios créditos "kiva", debido a su actividad que es la reparación de vehículos el saca montos relativamente pequeños, en esta ocasión solicita para compra de material de construcción y especialmente para compra de puertas para construccion de su casa propia, ya que por el momento él vive en el taller del cual paga alquiler, pero en el transcurso de estos años se compro un terreno en el que construye su vivienda, juntamente con su esposa, quien se dedica a la venta de lubricantes y apoya a su esposo, ellos tienen dos hijas quienes se encuentran estudiando en colegio de la zona, el señor Wilfredo es cliente responsable haciendo buen uso de los créditos solicitados, es muy trabajador y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Wilfredo is a former client of emprender and has had loans with Kiva as well, because his activity relates to auto repair he has borrowed relatively small amounts; this time, he needs to buy construction material as well as doors for his house, he is currently living at the repair shop and paying rent, but in the last few years he bought a lot and is building a home with his wife who sells auto lubricants to help her husband, they have two daughters who are in a school of the area, Wilfredo is a responsible client and has made good use of previous loans, he is hard working and grateful for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy doors for his house

loans.name: Ayshen

texts.ru:
Ayshen yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Karbadjar, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona uje 14 kak zamujem i u neyo dve lubimiye dochki. Ayshen rodilas v 1974 qodu.

 Uje bolshe 5 let kak ona zanimayetsya prodajey odejdi. Ayshen prosit 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zimnuyu odejdu novogo sezona dlya pereprodaji. Ona xochet razvit svoy bizness i uvelichet kolichestvo tovarov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas i svoyey podrugi, Ayshen pomogala yey v yeyo rabote no posle chego spusta neskalko let ona otkrila svoy magazin.
texts.en:
Ayshen is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). She was resettled from Karbadjar to the Absheron region where she now lives with her family. She has been married for 14 years and has two beloved daughters. Ayshen was born in 1974. 

Ayshen has been selling clothing for over 5 years. She is requesting 2000 AZN in order to buy the winter clothing to sell for the upcoming season. She would like to expand her business and improve the quality of her goods. Ayshen began in business with a friend, but after a few years of helping her Ayshen left to open her own store.

loans.use: buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Marta Nelly

texts.es: La señora Marta Nelly a sus 43 años de edad es madre de seis hijos de 21, 20, 18, 16, 8 y 4 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar en su tienda la cual tiene hace 6 años. La señora Marta Nelly Trabaja con sus hijos en la tienda y desea comprar surtido como snaks, gaseosas, mantequilla, aceite, entre otros productos que le generen mayores ingresos para aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. A futuro desea tener su propio mini mercado.
texts.en: Marta Nelly, 43, is the mother of six children who are 21, 20, 18, 16, 8 and 4 years old.  She works in her store that she’s had for six years.  Marta Nelly works with her children in the store and wants to buy an assortment of stock items like snacks, soft-drinks, butter and oil among other products that will generate higher income to increase her family’s quality of life.  In the future she’d like to have her own minimarket.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Duo Bethlehem Group

texts.es: Duo Bethlehem. este duo esta integrado por dos señoras las cuales S. dos persona que se han dedicado,a la confeccion D. tejidos.Doña Marleny Nohemi,se dedica a esta actividad desD. hace 2 años ella nos cuenta que esta contenta porque es una forma D. como pueD. ayudar a su familia,y aparte D. eso es una actividad que le a gustado mucho porque le a gustado confeccionarles a diferentes personas,es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos,ya que esta conciente D. que le falta capital para trabajar,al igual que la siguiente socia esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. materia prima para la confeccion D. tejidos.
texts.en: The "Duo Bethlehem" group is comprised of two women who earn a living through her weaving activity.  Doña Marleny Nohemi has been in this business for two years.  She says she is content because this is a way to help her family and she very much enjoys weaving for different people.  She is requesting a loan to buy raw material to make woven fabric since she lacks working capital.  The other member also is requesting a loan to buy raw material to make woven fabric.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa y su hijo de 17 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tiene dos manzanas de terreno sembradas, además del ganado vacuno y de repasto.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado de repasto, ya que por el tiempo de verano le conviene tener de este ganado, ayudándole a mantener sus actividades.
Él quiere mejorar la calidad de ganado, y poder con sus ingresos poder sostener su familia con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and their 17-year-old son. He is a farmer and a livestock breeder. He owns two manzanas (approx. 3.36 acres*) of planted land, as well as dairy and non-dairy cattle.
He is currently requesting a loan to buy non-dairy cattle, as in the summer this makes the most profitable cattle, and this helps him running his activities.
He wants to improve the quality of his cattle, and to be able to provide for his family with all the basic necessities thanks to his income.


<cite>*(one manzana = 1.68 acres)</cite>

loans.use: To buy non-dairy cattle.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El comité San Expedito se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Nueva Germania de la ciudad de Santaní. Está formado por 10 mujeres, quienes actualmente se encuentran en el sexto Ciclo. Es un grupo que se destaca en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor.
Guisela es una de las miembros. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora, nos comenta que todo su esfuerzo es por su familia, ya que quiere retribuirles por medio de su trabajo todo lo que ellos hicieron por ella. Guisela tiene una despensa bien surtida, mediante la cual ayuda con los gastos. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo y ampliar su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder abastecer su negocio con comestibles, bebidas, enlatados y demás, lo cual son los productos que más salida tienen. Agradece a la fundación por esta oportunidad de progreso que les da.
texts.en:
The “San Expedito” committee came together when several neighbors from the community of the city of Nueva Germania in the city of Santaní joined together.  It has 10 women members who are currently in their sixth cycle.  This is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, supportive and responsible.  The members possess a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Guisela is one of the members.  She is a very self-sacrificing, hardworking woman.  She comments that all her efforts are for her family because she wants to pay them back with her work for everything they did for her.  Guisela has a well-stocked store that allows her to help with expenses.  Her dream is to continue growing and expanding the business.

She requested the loan to stock the store with foodstuffs, beverages, canned goods and others which are the products that sell the most.  She thanks the Fundación for this opportunity for progress it gives her.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, beverages, canned goods and others.

loans.name: Hugo Ernesto

texts.es:
Hugo, vive con su esposa y dos hijos los cuales están estudiando, uno tiene 5 años y el otro 7 años de edad, él se dedica a la venta de desinfectante, el cual produce y distribuye en las alcaldías de la zona, este negocio lo aprendió en su familia hace 20 años.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la reparación del vehículo, ya que este le permite trasladar su mercadería a los clientes, por lo mismo necesita comprarse repuestos y pago de mecánico para mantener en buenas condiciones el vehículo. 
Su aspiración es mantener su carro en buenas condiciones y así mejorar la distribución de producto.
texts.en:
Hugo lives with his wife and 2 school-age children who are 5 and 7. He works selling disinfectant, which he produces and distributes to the villages in the area. He learned this business from his family 20 years ago.
He is currently requesting a loan to repair his vehicle, as this enables him to transport his merchandise to his clients. For the same reason, he needs to buy some spare parts and pay the mechanic to keep his vehicle in good condition.
His goal is to keep his car in good condition and so improve the distribution of his product.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Daniel, de 31 años, es un hombre muy veraz y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su hija Ruth de 12 años  quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, Daniel sale a trabajar a su chacra, sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo en hacer más fértil sus tierras, para poder obtener una buena cosecha. Sus productos, como el cacao, los vende a los centros de acopio de su localidad, donde tiene cuantiosos compradores, debido a la buena calidad de sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, ya que siempre corre el riesgo de que los productos químicos le causen alguna enfermedad en lo futuro. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros para que de esa manera tenga mayor avance en cuanto a su trabajo, con el crédito solicitado comprara abono e insecticidas para combatir las plagas que asechan sus cultivos. Con el tiempo desea comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción.
Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto asegura ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles; comprará abono e insecticidas para combatir la plagas que se apoderan de sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Daniel, 31, is a very truthful, hardworking man.  He lives in his own house with his 12-year-old daughter Ruth who is the motivating force behind all his efforts.  Every morning starting very early Daniel leaves home to work his fields.  He knows that he must put all his efforts into making his land more fertile to obtain a good harvest.  His products, like cocoa beans, are sold to local gathering centers where he has numerous buyers due to the good quality of his crops.

What he likes best about his work is planting his land, something he does with much patience.  He’s been in this line of work for 25 years and considers the fumigating to be the most difficult thing because he always runs the risk of the chemicals causing him some illness in the future.  During harvest season, he hires day laborers to advance more quickly with the work.  The requested loan is to buy manure and insecticide to combat the infestations that attack his crops.  In time, he wants to buy new land to increase production.

This is MFP loan #1.  He will be punctual with his payments. He will use the 1000 new soles to buy manure and insecticide to combat the infestations that take over his crops.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Journy

texts.en: Journy is 30 years old, single and lives in Tapican, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Journy owned a sari-sari store for 1 year, earning PHP 5,000 monthly. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. Journy has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Journy hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Nua Ngam 19 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Viet, 28, is Kho Mu ethnic lady who has been married and become the mother of a boy and a girl at the age of 9 and 5. She lives with her husband and her two children in a small house at a remote village. They mainly rely on agricultural production for a living with several activities such as growing rice, cassava, corn and raising chicken. Currently, the sanitation condition of her family is very poor so she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to build a toilet to improve the family's hygiene situation. She will use the income from farming and animal breeding to repay the loan and she hopes that the new toilet will protect her family's health from diseases. Mrs. Viet dreams that her children will grow healthily and will have a bright future. In the picture, she wears a red shirt and stands on the first line, at the first from the right.

loans.use: to build a toilet to improve the family's hygiene situation

loans.name: Elías

texts.en:
Elias owns a small food market in Guayaquil. He started his store with the help of his wife who worked at someone else’s store for several years. They decided to open their store with only fresh fruit and vegetables, but they have been expanding their inventory for several years. They now sell other grocery products and are seeking to introduce office supplies into their product line. The business is run out of their home, and Elias has been modifying a new sector as an expansion of the store for these new products. He and his wife depend on this business to feed and educate their family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in office supplies to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Nancy Muthoni Mwangi intends to buy purchase high quality maize, spinach, carrot and bean seeds.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
"I opened my business one year ago and it is the support of my family as well as all those that I attend to. Although the space I have in my shop is quite small i would like to purchase more merchandise and furniture to accomodate it.

I have many plans for the future, including enlarging my business and selling a bit of everything in order to increase my sales. I am asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase merchandise and furniture.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

"Abri mi negocio desde hace 1 año y es el sustento de mi familia así es que todos lo atendemos, aunque es muy pequeño el espacio que tengo en mi negocio me gustaria comprar más mercancía y un mueble para acomodarla. Tengo muchos planes, en un futuro me gustaría ampliar mi negocio y así vender un poco de todo para aumentar mis ventas". Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar mercancia y un mueble.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise and purchase furniture

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is 43 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband works in a food shop. Rosa makes and sells bread in her house. She is part of the group 10 of April 3. With the loan, she hopes to be able to put a small bread maker for her house, and buy the utensils that will allow her to make more bread and grow her business

ROSA, tiene 43 años, casada con 3 hijos , su esposo es empleado en una tienda de comestibles. Ella hace y vende pan en su casa , pertenece al grupo 10 de Abril 3 , con el préstamo espera poder colocar una pequeña amasandería en su casa y comprar utensilios que le permitan aumentar la producción de pan .

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: sales of bread

loans.name: Jerryson

texts.en:
Jerryson is an enterprising man. He started his own business selling maize to poultry farmers, which they use as feed for raising birds. He has been in this business since 1997. Jerryson is 41 years old and he has one child.

To imrpove his business and get more goods to keep his customers satisfied, Jerryson is requesting a loan of $550, which he plans to repay within eight months.

loans.use: To buy more maize for sale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
When he was little, Juan C. would go to a little family grove, to plant and collect oranges. As he grew up, he grew fond of this fruit and learned how to grow them and sell them. In the beginning, Juan only sold oranges in the season of higher production, but after he had built a clientele, he realized that he had to sell all year round. And so it is that he started his permanent business because of the need to support his wife and two children.

However, Juan believes he has to buy more merchandise so he can have more money moving in his business and can make ends meet during the seasons of low production of oranges. This is why he is requesting a loan of US $250 to be paid in 6 months. With this money, Juan will be able to buy more merchandise to have more variety in his business. With your help you can make Juan's family succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Cuando era pequeño Juan C., se iba a una pequeña huerta familiar, a sembrar y cosechar naranjas, cuando fue creciendo le agarró un cariño a estos frutos, y aprendió cómo cosecharlos y venderlos. En un principio Juan sólo vendía las naranjas en la temporada en que se producía más, pero después de empezar a hacer clientes, se dio cuenta que los tenía que vender durante todo el año, y es así como comenzó el negocio. Que en un inicio fue esporádico y por la necesidad de tener con qué mantener a su esposa y a sus dos hijos inició.

Sin embargo Juan considera que tiene que comprar más mercancía, para poder tener movimiento de dinero en su negocio y así solventarse en temporadas bajas de la naranja. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $ 250 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Juan podrá comprar más mercancía para tener variedad en su negocio. Con tu ayuda lograrás que la familia de Juan pueda salir adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchanidise to have more variety in his business.

loans.name: Zenón

texts.es:
The prairie and the forage have traditionally been the main food sources for the cows of Zenón and thanks to the love and care that he gives to each one of his prolific cows, they have been able to reproduce fast and they give him a considerable amount of milk, which he sells for the production of cheese and butter.

Since Don Zenón was little, he felt a special affection and a vocation to become a livestock farmer. Now, it is thanks to this noble profession, in which he would like to further develop, that he can offer his wife and son economic stability.

To materialize his projects, he would like to get a loan and buy another cow in order to genetically improve his cattle and produce more milk.

Zenón thanks you in advance for your generosity; your help will certainly allow him to achieve his project.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La pradera y el forraje han sido tradicionalmente el recurso alimenticio principal para las vaquitas de don Zenón, quien gracias al cariño y cuidado que brinda a cada una de sus generosas vaquitas van reproduciéndose rápidamente y le brindan a diario una considerable cantidad de leche, que comercializa para la elaboración de quesos y mantequillas.

Don Zenón, desde pequeño siempre sintió especial cariño y vocación por el trabajo ganadero, gracias a esta noble labor con la que pretende seguir prosperando, le ofrece a su esposa e hijo estabilidad económica.

Para concretar sus planes desea obtener un préstamo que tiene planeado utilizarlo en la compra de otra vaca y así mejorar genéticamente sus ganados para la producción de más leche.

Zenón agradece anticipadamente tu generosidad para llevar acabo su proyecto.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a LAPO member. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She is from Edo State .She has been in business since 2002. She needs the loan of $525 to buy more poultry birds to sell. She learned the business from her sister for 8 months and started hers in 2002.

loans.use: To buy more poultry to sell

loans.name: Lucía

texts.es:
Lucía is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her children. She is dedicated to raising lambs and hamsters. While she is exerting herself in this, her husband, Francisco, leaves very early in the morning and travels great distances to proviD. veterinary services to peasants in need of care for their animals. The hope of these responsible parents of two small children is to purchase an artificial inseminator for animals. With this instrument and Francisco's knowledge they would be able to help improve the breeding of their clients’ animals. To reach this goal they are requesting a loan, which they plan to repay in six months. Lucía and Francisco are asking for your support in helping them fulfill their dreams soon.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Lucía, es una madre muy responsable, amorosa y preocupada por el bienestar y seguridad D. sus hijos, se dedica a la crianza D. corderos y cuyes, y mientras se esfuerza en el desempeño D. este oficio su esposo, Francisco, desD. muy temprano sale D. su hogar y recorre largos tramos para brindar sus servicios D. veterinario a todos aquellos pobladores que requieren D. su ayuda para la atención y mejoramiento D. sus animalitos.El deseo D. estos responsables padres D. dos pequeños niños es comprar un equipo D. inseminación artificial para animales, con este instrumento y los conocimientos D. don Francisco podrán ayudar a mejorar la raza D. los animales D. sus vecinos.Para concretar sus anhelos requieren obtener un préstamo que se comprometen a retornarlo en un lapso D. seis meses. Doña Lucía y Don Francisco solicitan tu colaboración para concretar pronto sus planes.

loans.use: Purchase an artificial inseminator to improve the breeding of their clients' animals. / Compra de una herramienta de inseminación artificial para mejorar la raza de los animales de sus clientes.

loans.name: Lwaba East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nusula N.. She is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan to add more equipment. Nusula is 42 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 11 to 22 and her children go to school. Each week, Nusula makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy cattle. Nusula has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Nusula is joined in her small group by Zaituni N., Aisha N., Samusa N., and Fatuma N.. Zaituni N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to boost business. Aisha N. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to add more stock. Samusa N. operates a business selling maize and wants to purchase more maize in bulk. Fatuma N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase another fridge.

loans.use: To add more capital to restaurant business

loans.name: Harriet Nansubuga`s Group

texts.en:
Harriet is the leader of a group of five members. She is 49 years of age, and a single mother with five children. They are ages 30, 28, 23, 18 and 20 years old. Three are in school and 2 are working. The community she lives in is semi-urban.

Her main challenges are the high prices of the vegetables especially in times of scarcity.  Her commodity is a perishable and she has to be in the market as early as 4.00am to buy produce from the farmers. However, there is ready market for her vegetables.

She used to sell cold drinks and tea in the taxi park before switching to selling vegetables. The benefits include being able to take her children to school, fending for her family, being able to acquire household assets.

She plans to use her loan to expand business by opening a hardware shop and building a house.

She has successfully paid back more than 10 MCDT loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of vegetables and open a hardware shop

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luís works as a construction contractor and he has a small grocery store in his home. His wife is a housewife and has three children, one grown and two who are studying at the state university. His home is located in the Llojeta area on the western side of La Paz.

This is the first time he is seeking a loan from Impro. The loan will be used for the installation and operation of a larger neighborhood grocery store by purchasing merchandise to sell such as rice, noodles, canned goods, candy, cookies, and soda pop.

His work and desire to succeed enable him to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Luís trabaja como contratista de construcciones y tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, su esposa realiza labores de casa y tiene tres hijos uno es independiente y dos estudian en la Universidad estatal. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Llojeta sector los claveles de la Ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para la instalación y funcionamiento de una tienda de barrio más completa con la compra de mercadería como ser Arroz, fideo, conservas, dulces, galletas y refrescos.

Su trabajo y las ganas de superación le permiten acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise in order to expand his grocery store

loans.name: Marisol Del Rosario

texts.es:
Marisol is 28 years old, she is married and lives in the Laureles Norte, she has three kids of 2, 3 and 7 years old, her husband sells beans and other variety of products in the wholesale market and helps with the home expenses.

Marisol’s business is a grocery store with eight years of experience, she started it with her own savings, the loan she is requesting will be invested in buying basic grains and satisfy her clients with new variety of products.

As any other small business, her plans are to expand her business and build a store to provide better attention to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Marisol tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte, tiene tres hijos de 2 ,3 y 7 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante de frijol y otra variedad de productos en el Mercado mayoreo y aporta para los gastos del hogar. El negocio de Marisol es una pulpería, con ochos años de experiencia e inició on fondos propios, con el préstamo que le otorguen espera invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de granos básicos y así satisfacer a sus clientes con nueva variedad de productos. Como todo pequeño comerciante sus planes son llegar a expnadir su negocio y así poner una tienda para dar mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy basic grains/beans and products to stock her business / Comprar granos básicos y productos perecederos para surtir el negocio

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael started his business after having been employed with various companies and was never able to accumulate tenure to count towards his retirement. He felt a need to find another way to support himself.

He started his business in May of 2002 when he acquired a license for a Taxi cab. He had previously worked as a bus driver in his spare time but when his bus route was cancelled the government supported them by providing the workers with Taxi licenses. He got himself a car and it has all gone very well, so much so that he is looking into buying a mini-bus to increase his business.

He requires a loan in the amount of $300 US that will be repaid in a term of 3 months to invest in the repair of his car door and the trunk of the car, to present a better image and better service to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva volunteer.

Ismael inició el negocio ya que trabajó como empleado en muchas empresas y nunca pudo lograr una antigüedad para pensionarse por lo que fue necesario buscar otro medio de vida para sostenerse. Comenzó su negocio en Mayo de 2002 cuando le dieron una concesión para Taxi ya que anteriormente en sus tiempos libres trabajaba en un transporte de ruta fija, pero como esta ruta desapareció el gobierno los apoyó dándonos concesiones de Taxi pero el tenia que adquirir el Taxi, con el cual le ha ido muy bien y ya esta pensando inclusive en comprar un microbús usado un poquito mas adelante para seguir creciendo.

El necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para invertir en la reparación de una puerta y el cofre de su Taxi y dar una mejor imagen y servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To invest in the repair of the car.

loans.name: 16 De Nobiembre Group

texts.es:
The "November 16th" group is a new group that was formed with people from two different existing groups. The 12 people who are in the group are partners who want to better themselves through their own businesses. The largest subset of the group's members sell sweets outsiD. of the graD. school "La Floresta". The loan will allow them to stock more products and a wider variety of products. The president of the group is Elena, who has a business in her home. In the photo, only 10 members appear because the other two members were working and didn't arrive in time for the photo. Petrona is an employee in a local business , Marelene sells prepared food, Aida sells clothing, Ignacio does bodywork on cars, Rolando is a painter, Rosa sells empanadas, Adrian sells American clothing, Roberto sells vegetables, Eldy and Victoria sells sweets and finally, Alberto is also currently employed by a local business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Grupo 16 D. noviembre es un grupo nuevo que se formo con 2 personas D. diferentes grupos. Las 12 personas que estan en el grupo son socios y socias que quieren superarse en su negocio. La mayor parte D. los integrantes venden dulces fuera del colegio la floresta en los tres turnos y el credito le servira para surtir y ampliar con nuevos productos para su venta. El grupo esta con la presidencia D. la sra. Elena quien cuenta con un negocio y casa propia. En la foto solo aparecen 10 personas por lo que dos estaban trabajando y no llegaron a tiempo para la foto. Petrona es empleada, Marelene venD. comida, Aida venD. ropa, Ignacio hace chapería, Rolando es pintor, Rosa venD. empanadas, Adrian venD. ropa americana, Roberto venD. verduras, Eldy y Victoria venden pastillas y por último Alberto es empleado.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chickens for a small poultry shop

loans.name: Soam

texts.en:
Soam B., 27, of Phnom Penh is an expert in using beads and other materials to make flower decorations on womens dresses. She has been working at it since 2005 and typically makes US $2.50 each day. Such decorated dresses are a kind of Khmer traditional dress that people wear during the Water Festival, P'chum Ben or Khmer New Year. Each dress is expensive because it takes around 7-10 days to complete one, but most people prefer the handmade over those made by machines. She learned how to decorate from her mother and she has been doing that business since she is not married yet.

Soam B. would like to set up another business selling groceries in order to increase her daily income. This loan of US $400 would allow her to set up a grocery business.

loans.use: To set up a business selling groceries

loans.name: Rony

texts.en:
Mr. Rony S., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Sajaros El, 29, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1994 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of their children study in the local school, and the fourth is at home, too young to yet begin school.

Rony, a fisherman since his youth, fishes from the Mekong River and the lake near their village to sell to the middleman who then resells the fish in Phnom Penh City. He has also been a boat builder for almost ten years, while his wife raises fish to sell. Rony is now requesting a loan of $1000 to repair his fishing materials.

loans.use: To repair his fishing materials.

loans.name: Binaba

texts.fr:
Née le 15 février 1982 à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, madame G. Binaba s’est mariée à un commerçant et elle est mère de deux (2) enfants. En 2004 elle a ouvert son magasin ou elle vend des boissons dans le quartier Agoè au nord de Lomé.  Avec ce travail, elle aide beaucoup son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour refaire son stock avec 50 casiers de bière et 30 casiers de sucreries. Ce nouveau stock lui permettra de bien vendre durant la période des fêtes en décembre.
texts.en:
Born on February 15, 1982 in Lomé, the capital of Togo, Ms. Binaba G. is the mother of two and married to a shopkeeper. In 2004, she opened her store where she sells beverages in the Agoè district, north of Lomé. Through her work, she is assisting her husband greatly in covering family expenses. She is requesting this initial loan to replenish her inventory with 40 cases of beer and 30 cases of candy. This new stock will enable her to do well in her sales during the December holiday season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and candy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand clothing business

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en: Mihail T., a carpenter,  is 23 years old, and he lives in Carabetovca village, Basarabeasca district in the south-east of the country. The main goal of this client is manufacturing wooden articles. After graduating from the village school, Mihail (English equivalent: Michael) started to work with his father who’s very experienced in working wood. Both father and son process wood and work on demand, making doors, windows, kitchen furniture, etc. To improve and increase their production capacities, they need a lathe, which they decided to buy with the help of this loan from MicroInvest. Their business was launched in 2008, so this is their first loan.

loans.use: to buy a lathe

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Anteriormente María trabajaba de empleada en un centro comercial, donde se dedicaba armar carteras. Este fue su trabajo durante tres años, pero decidió dejarlo para poder cuidar a su única hija aún menor de edad.  María es separada de su esposo, entonces no pudo dejar un trabajo sin empezar otro, así que comenzó con un negocio de frutas muy pequeño.
Ahora son 5 años que María se dedica a su negocio y, gracias a los préstamos de EDAPROSPO, pudo agrandar su negocio alquilando un puesto en el mercado e incrementando la variedad de productos que vende.
A parte de su negocio, desde hace seis años ella realiza cortes de cabellos eventualmente los fines de semana.
A sus 32 años María sueña en un futuro agrandar su negocio y darle más seguridad a su hijita.
texts.en:
María used to work as an employee in a shopping center, where she assembled wallets. This was her job for three years, but she decided to quit so she could take care of her only child, who was still young. María is separated from her husband and could not quit one job without starting another, which is why she started up a small fruit business. It has now been 5 years since María has worked at this and, thanks to loans from EDAPROSPO, she was able to grow her business and rent out a space in the market and increase the variety of products she sells. In addition to her business, for the past six years she has been cutting men´s hair on the weekends. At her 32 years, María dreams of expanding her business in the future and giving more security to her small daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin S., 55, is a widow who lives with her seven children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She sells meatballs and typically makes USD $3 every day. Three of her daughters are garment factory workers and each makes USD $2 per day. The rest of her children are in school. Mrs. Yin S. would like a loan to purchase more meatballs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase meatballs

loans.name: Savina

texts.en:
Savina T. sells food supplies like gari (a fried cassava dish) and maize at Elmina. Savina has received no formal education. She is married with two children and her husband is a fisherman. Savina has been selling food supplies such as gari and maize for a while. She is responsible for helping support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Savina will use her loan to buy additional supplies in order to help her increase the sale of her primary products: gari and maize. This will help her to further meet the increase in demand by her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in her business and expand her trade.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies to increase her sales of gari and maize

loans.name: Rosario Group

texts.es: El grupo Rosario está conformado en su mayoría por mujeres con la presencia de un solo hombre que se dedica a la venta de periodicos y revistas y es el socio que demuestra mayor responsabilidad, pero en general las socias se dedican a la venta de diferentes productos pero por la misma actividad que realizan necesitan a menudo mayor capital de trabajo por esta razón estas socias quieren seguir trabajando con Agrocaptal pues consideran que con nosotros tienen alguna ventaja. por lo mismo la presidenta en alguna ocación realiza charlas de reflexión a las socias.
texts.en:
The Rosario group is made up of primarily women and only one man. He sells newspapers and magazines, and he is the most responsible member. In general, the members sell different products. They frequently need more working capital. The group wants to keep working with Agrocapital. Agrocapital sees the advantage in working with them, and occasionally its president conducts business conferences with them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Abdoulaye Traoré N. a 40 ans, marié et père de cinq  enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants au quartier Hamdallaye de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Traoré après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans succès, s’initia au commerce de produits céréaliers et dispose d’une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente  des céréales ,maïs, mil, sorgho et pois sucré  il y a plus de 10 ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant   deux ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt il est à son deuxième. 
 Il compte  acheter, 1 tonne de pois sucré, 4 sacs de maïs, 1 tonne de mil et 5 sacs de sorgho.
 Il s’approvisionne à Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Kadiana, Fourou, Bougouni, etc. Les marchandises (pois sucré, mais, mil et sorgho) sont  ramenées pour  être  vendues à (Abidjan, Dakar et Bamako) en gros au comptant. Le pois sucré  est vendu aux usines qui en font des jus.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye Traoré N., 40, is married and the father of 5 children. He lives with his spouse and their children in the Hamdallaye district of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Traoré tried out several businesses without success, then began to sell cereals. He has a shop in front of their family home where he has been buying and selling cereals, maize, millet, sorghum, and sugar peas, for the past 10 years. He is much in demand due to the quality of his merchandise.

In order to satisfy his ever-growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriaso two years ago. After having correctly reimbursed his first loan, he is on his second. He intends to buy 1 ton of sugar peas, 4 sacks of maize, 1 ton of millet and 5 sacks or sorghum. He buys his merchandise in Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Kadiana, Fourou, Bougouni, etc. The merchandise (sugar peas, maize, millet and sorghum) are taken to be sold in Abidjan, Dakar and Bamako, wholesale and for cash. The sugar peas are sold to factories that make juice out of them.

He expects to use this loan to make a monthly profit of 200,000 F CFA which will be used to increase his working capital, contribute to family expenses, pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing cereals (maize, millet, sorghum and sugar peas)

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES DANS LA ZONE DE CAMBERENE BINETA M. S'ACTIVE DANS LA PETITE RESTAURATION DEPUIS CINQ ANS.ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET POUR DIVERSIFIER SON ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
A member for a number of years in the Camberene zone, Bineta M. has been working at selling cooked food on a small scale for 5 years. She is requesting this loan to diversify her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling cooked food

loans.name: Primavera Ii Group

texts.es: Hace mas de cinco años, dieciséis mujeres conforman la asociación “Primavera II”, están convencidas que con una actividad propia pueden mejorar su calidad de vida. La mayoría de ellas viven en la zona Villa Tejada, de la ciudad de El Alto. Diversas son las actividades de este grupo, venden; CDs, verduras, frutas, material de escritorio, cosméticos, otras también realizan confección de polleras (Una pollera es una falda larga usada como vestimenta femenina, típica en algunas regiones de Bolivia). La asociación Primavera II, afirman que la constante elevación de precios en artículos de primera necesidad causo desequilibrio económico en sus hogares, por lo que necesitan créditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, para ampliar sus  negocios y poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Five years ago 16 women formed the group "Primavera II" and they were convinced that working for themselves could help them to improve their quality of life. The majority of the women live in the Villa Tejada neighborhood in the city of El Altos. They make livings by doing a variety of activities which include, selling CD's, vegetables, fruits, writing materials, cosmetics. Others make a living by making "polleras" (these are a long skirt worn by the women in some areas of Bolivia). The Primavera II say that the constant increase of the prices of basic needs items causes hardship in their homes. Therefore, they need loans to buy products in bulk and at wholesale prices so that they can help to grow their business and increase their profits.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products in bulk and at wholesale prices so that they can help to grow their business and increase their profits

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget sells "akamu" ("akamu" also called "pap" is produced from corn).The demand for her "akamu" is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Bridget is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more bags of corn to produce more "akamu" to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of corn to produce more akamu to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Wanting to make her general store more productive, Rowena decided to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP17,000 as her additional capital. She patiently manages her store in order to generate a daily income for the education of her two children and to assist her husband in providing for their agricultural needs. 

Rowena is now 39 years old, and married to Raymundo L. who is a farmer. They have two children: Roxanne Grace - 20 years old, who is a college senior student; and Rochie Mae - 15 years old, who is currently enrolled in third year high school. Her family is living in a simple village where farming is the main activity of most residents.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en: Josephine N. is the leader of her subgroup of Suubilyamukama. She is a married lady with a business of selling both new and used clothes. Before, she dealt in only new clothes but diversified to make more profits.  She earns about 150,000 UGX at the moment. Josephine says that her main challenge in the business is the competition but because she always has enough stock and delivers good customer care, her customers keep coming back to her. She hopes to one day start a wholesale clothing selling business as well as buy her own house. Apart from her business, the loans have always helped in paying school fees for her children and dependents. She is a mother of 5 children and she cares for other orphaned children also in school.

loans.use: Restocking her clothing business.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Ana B. se dedica a su actividad de venta de bebidas las que son comercializadas por ella misma para llevar el sustento a sus pequeños hijos ya que es madre soltera y siempre hace el papel de padre y madre en el hogar.

Ella ha solicitado el crédito en Ceprodel con el fin de invertirlo directamente en la compra de bebidas como lo son las gaseosas y jugos y es por esto que espera que el crédito sea otorgado sin ningún inconveniente y así suplir su establecimiento con las bebidas.
texts.en:
In the Department of Leon, Nicaragua, Ana sells bottled drinks from her commercial establishment in order to maintain her small children. She is a single mother and always plays the role of father and mother in the home.

She has requested a loan from CEPRODEL to invest directly in buying drinks, including soda water and juices. She hopes that the loan will be granted without difficulty and, thus, supply her establishment with drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Herwin

texts.en:
“Make a plan and work hard to become successful in life,” shared Herwin E., who is a farmer living at Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is married to Angela E. and they are blessed with three children. Due to the economic crisis, the family strives hard to earn a living for their survival and to support the studies of their children. They want them to be alleviated from poverty.

Herwin drives his family to become diligent and determined in their endeavors by giving importance to whatever livelihood they have in their village. His wife sells vegetables and fruit in their village to help him generate income.

Herwin needs additional capital for their farm maintenance to buy needed farm inputs for their main livelihood project which is farming and to provide his wife with enough capital for her rice-retailing business in their village. He requests additional capital of PHP 14,000.

They hope that they will be able to produce a bigger harvest and earn a higher income through this financial support.

loans.use: To use as additional business capital

loans.name: Maranatha Group

texts.es: Trece miembros deciden formar la asociación “Maranatha”, la mayoría tiene familias numerosas, así que se vieron en la necesidad de tener un negocio propio que les permita obtener ingresos para solventar la economía de sus hogares. Este grupo trabaja hace tres años aproximadamente junto a la institución, se reúne en el centro focal V. Exaltación, actualmente su presidenta es Natividad Q. ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de dulces artesanales,  otras de las socias tienen distintos negocios, por ejemplo, Olga vende cosméticos, Maria vende medias, Panfila  ofrece servicio de llamadas  locales y a larga distancia, Teresa tiene una tienda y Juan José  ofrece servicio de transporte publico. La asociación Maranatha necesita comprar insumos, y  mercadería para reactivar sus negocios, esto les permitirá obtener ingresos para ofrecer mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
Thirteen members decided to form the Maranatha Association. The majority have large families and they saw the necessity of having their own businesses, permitting them to obtain incomes to meet the financial needs of home. The group has worked with their micro-finance institution for 3 years, and they meet in the bank's center in V. Exaltation.

Presently, their president is Natividad, who makes and sells artisan sweets. Other members have distinct businesses; for example, Olga sells cosmetics, Maria sells hosiery, Panfila offers local and long distance phone services, Teresa has a store, and Juan Jose offers public transportation services.

The Maranatha Association needs to buy supplies, and merchandise to reactivate their businesses. This will permit them to obtain better incomes and offer a higher standard of living for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES OR MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Sa

texts.en: Sa M., age 49, is a local cloth vender. She sells in retail a piece of cloth to passer-by from the village to village around her community. almost of her buyers who need her cloth to apply for their uniform and their other decorating tool. She also gets a profit of approximately of $3 per day from her investment and provides her income to contribute her family’s daily foods. Her husband assists her in selling cloth. Sa M. is applying for a loan to increase her successful business capital. Sa M. has four children: two are married and two are students and also helps selling her product when they are not studying. Note: Sa M. was not available at that time so her husband is shown instead of the picture.

loans.use: To increase her successful business capital

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: D. Emilienne est née en 1984 à Azowlissè, village situé aux environs de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Emilienne réside depuis huit ans à Takon Aïdjèdo à Porto-Novo et est mariée à ZANMENOU Marcellin, un menuisier. Emilienne est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et vit avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par les deux conjoints. Emilienne mène depuis cinq ans comme activité, la vente de bouillie (faite à base de maïs) accompagnée d'arachide. Emilienne s'approvisionne à Takon, à proximité de Porto-Novo et vend sa marchandise de façon ambulante. Emilienne est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. En vue d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'augmenter la quantité de bouillie préparée par jour pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Emilienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
D. Emilienne is born in 1984 in Azowlisse, a village located around Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Emelienne has been living in Takon Aidjedo in Porto-Novo for eight years. She is married to ZANMENOU Marcellin, a carpenter. Emelienne is the mother of two children, all in school and she lives with her children and husband.The couple supports each other with the family expenses.Emelienne has been in this business of selling porridge( made of corn) with peanuts for five years. She gets her supplies at Takon near Porto-Novo and sells her products from door to door. Emelienne is an old customer of ALIDe having obtained two loans from ALIDe and repaid correctly. In view of expanding her working capital and increasing the quantity of porridge made daily to better satisfy her clientele, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn, sugar and coco

loans.name: Patricial

texts.en:
Patricial has a grocery stall at the front of her house where she sells groceries at retail prices to her customers in Asaba, Delta State. Her greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She has been in this business for a long time.

Patricial is married with four children and she is 48 years old. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en: Emilia is a thirty-seven-year-old married mother of four children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the Western Region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. She is a trader. Emilia trades in food items such as rice, vegetables, tinned foods, etc. She sells on a tabletop at the market square in her community. She buys the goods from nearby towns. Emilia has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 44 años de edad, está separado y tiene un hijo de dos años de edad a su cargo. Vive junto a su padre en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de veinte años brinda servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de artefactos eléctricos. Aprendió el trabajo de forma empírica y poco a poco, gracias a sus ahorros, pudo adquirir un local cerca al mercado donde atiende a sus clientes. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que mantiene a su familia.

El nos cuenta que también compra artefactos de uso doméstico ya usados, a los que brinda mantenimiento y reparación para luego volver a venderlos a las personas que no cuentan con recursos suficientes para comprarse un artefacto nuevo. 

El poco capital con el que cuenta para la compra de repuestos no es suficiente y tiene que viajar continuamente a la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirirlos, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es contruir su casa de material noble para así poder brindarle a sus familiares una mejor calidad de vida. El es una persona muy trabajadora y que gusta mucho del oficio que realiza.
texts.en:
Segundo is 44, separated, with one two-year old son that he cares for. He lives with his father in the Cayalti district, about one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For the last twenty years he has worked servicing and maintaining electrical products. He learned the trade through experience, and little by little, thanks to his savings, has been able to open up a business near the market and this is where he serves his customers. This business is the only income source for his family. He tells us that he also buys used household products, and repairs them so they can be resold to people who don’t have the money to purchase new ones. The little capital that he has to buy the replacement parts isn’t enough and he has to continually travel to Chiclayo to purchase them. That is why he is asking for a loan of 1000 new sols ($350.00) for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. His greatest dream is to build a house out of good materials so that he can offer his family a better quality of life. He is very hard-working and is happy with his trade.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts to repair electrical products

loans.name: Shamsiddin

texts.en:
Shamsiddin is 25 years of age. He lives with his wife and two children. Shamsiddin is a sheep breeder and has been doing this for five years. Thanks to this activity, he can cover the expenses of his family. For this reason, he goes out every morning to graze his animals so they can eat. He enjoys caring for his animals, because thanks to this business he can take a meal to his children. Shamsiddin’s family is his greatest love and they are the biggest motivators in his life. The loan he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of young sheep, which will help to improve his business and help him become the best breeder in his area. With your help, this will be possible.

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Aychi

texts.en: Aychi is a 44-year-old single woman living with her parents. Since 2007, she has been working as a saleswoman, though she specializes in selling cosmetics and beauty products. Notably, she already received a prior loan, which she was very thankful for.  Now, Aychi is seeking to borrow a second loan in the amount of $1,200 to buy more products so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional products

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Description 	Madame  Bintou Traoré  est âgée de 49 ans, mariée  et mère  de 5 enfants.  Elle  vit chez son mari dans une grande famille traditionnelle au 2ème quartier de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle a abandonné l’école en classe de 3 ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour  mener plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus telles la coiffure, la teinture etc. Finalement elle opte pour les activités de fabrication traditionnelle de savon. Ce métier, elle l’a appris auprès d’une de ses connaissances. Après des semaines d’apprentissage, elle finit par maîtriser la technique de fabrication et ainsi alla s’installer à son propre compte. Elle mène cette activité depuis 4 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation car elle produit des savons traditionnels de bonnes qualités.
Pour faire du savon traditionnel, elle brûle 50litres d’huiles de karités dans une marmité ou dans une barrique ensuite elle met 5 bidons de 20litres d’eaux, 5 kg de farines  et 4kgs de soudes caustiques dans cette marmite. Puis elle procède au remuage à l’aide d’une grande louche jusqu’avoir la pâte servant de savon.   
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 48 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 30 barriques de soude caustique. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Madame  Bintou Traoré  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle constituée de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari et de participer aux événements sociaux (baptême, mariage etc.…).
texts.en:
Mrs. Bintou Traoré is 49-years-old, married and mother of five children. She lives with her husband in a large traditional family in the second area of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She stopped going to school in the third primary grade (Mali education system) to begin several revenue-generating activities such as hairdressing, dying clothes, etc. She finally opted for traditional soap-making. She learned this trade from one of her acquaintances. After weeks of apprenticeship, she finally mastered the production technique and started her own business. She has been pursuing this activity for the past four years and has acquired a high reputation due to the quality of her traditional soaps. To make traditional soap she heats 50 litres of Shea oil in a large pot or in a barrel. She then adds five 20-litre containers of water, five kilos of flour and four kilos of caustic soda. She then stirs with a large ladle until she obtains a paste-like consistency from which she will make the soap. To increase the size of her business and to generate more revenue, she approached Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. Folllowing four group and two individual loans, all of which were fully reimbursed, she is now requesting a third individual loan. She will use this loan to purchase 30 barrels of caustic soda. She gets her supplies locally. Mrs. Binton Traoré sells cash and on credit to a customer base of women. With this loan, she hopes to reach a monthly revenue of 100,000 FCFA. This will enable her to assist her husband and participate in the funding of social events (baptisms, weddings, etc.).

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy caustic soda

loans.name: Adaku

texts.en:
Adaku is 28 years old. She is married to Mr. I. who runs his own business and they live in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells articles like flashlights, poly bags, pens, calculators and more. She manages the business with the support of her husband. Adaku's dream is to have a big business that will enable her to save and reinvest money into the business. She left school due to financial constraints and her prayer is to support her husband in giving their children quality educations.

She hopes to expand and improve her business in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more articles to sell. She says thank you to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more articles like flashlights, poly bags, pens and calculators to sell

loans.name: Francia Nelia

texts.es:
la sra. Francia Nelia R. Lara se dedica desde hace ocho años a la elaboración y venta de rosquillas, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación y las distribuye a dueños de pulpería de la comunidad donde ella reside.
Doña Francia actualmente esta elaborando su producto tres veces por semana, ya que su clientela va creciendo dia a dia, y la demanda de su producto es mas grande.
Francia nos comento que cuando inicio solo lo hacia una vez por semana y en cantidades pequeñas.
Los clientes prefieren su producto por la higiene con que son elaboradas y por el tamaño que les da y sobre todo el buen sabor que tienen.
Francia necesita el credito para poder salir adelante y tener una mejor calidad de vida ya que esta es su unica fuente de ingresos que tiene para ganarse la vida.
texts.en:
Señora Francia Nelia R. Lara has been dedicated to making and selling doughnuts for eight years, an activity that she carries out in her house. She distributes the doughnuts to owners of stores in the community where she resides. Señora Francia currently makes her products three times a week, since her clientele is growing day to day, and the demand for her products is greater. Francia teslls us that; when she started she only made doughnuts in small quantities once a week. The clients prefer her product because of the cleanliness with with she makes her doughnuts, their size and above all the good flavor that they have. Francia needs the loan to be able to do well and to have a better quality of life since this is the only source of income that she has to earn a living.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flour, cheese, lard, firewood, and water for making doughnuts.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad Baji is a mature, 27-year-old married lady. She has two sons who are not of school-going age yet. Her husband's name is L. A. and he is one year older than his wife. He fulfills the duties of a mason. He has been in this profession for the past 10 years. He gets orders from builders and earns income. 

Shamshad Baji is a lady who values hard-working people. She believes that her husband is one of them. So to share his financial burden she makes artificial flowers and decoration pieces on order. Her husband appreciates her and respects her for her kind thoughts. Shamshad is applying for a loan to buy mason's tools for her husband so that he can efficiently perform his work and doesn't have to borrow tools from others.

Shamshad has in her group two other women. Zubaida baji and Kalsoom baji each want a loan to buy mason's tools for their husbands.


Note: Shamshad Baji is seated in the middle of the two women.

loans.use: To buy mason's tools

loans.name: Marie Anne

texts.fr: H. Marie Anne est née le 02 Juillet 1966 à Allada dans le département de l'Atlantique. Marie Anne vit depuis 40 ans à Sékou à Allada. C'est une veuve qui est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et vivant encore à sa charge. Marie Anne n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Marie Anne vend depuis 21 ans environs, des ustensiles de cuisine en plastiques et des bassines à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Marie Anne vend également du maïs. Marie Anne s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et dans le Nord du Bénin. Marie Anne a déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé, deux crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Marie Anne voudrait renforcer son activité et par conséquent se faire plus de revenus. C'est pour cette raison que Marie Anne sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Marie Anne H. was born on July 2 1966 in Allada in the Atlantique department of Benin. For the last 40 years she has been living in Sékou in Allada. She is a widow and a mother of three children, all of whom went to school and are still under her care. Marie Anne never attended school. In order to support her family, she has spent the last 21 years selling plastic cooking utensils and bowls from her home. On the side, Marie Anne also sells corn. She gets her supplies form Cotonou (the economic capital of Benin) and in the North of Benin. Marie Anne already obtained two loans through ALIDé which she reimbursed. Faced with growing demands from clients, Marie Anne would like to augment her sales and in the process, increase her revenues. For this reasons, Marie Anne is asking for a third loan.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plastic cooking utensils

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 50 years old and married with five children. For five years, he has earned a living as a greengrocer.   He also earns extra income from renting his residential houses. 

Since joining Faulu Kenya's St. Nicholas group, Francis has saved his profits to support the needs of his family, especially for his children's education until college.  

Francis has requested a loan of KES 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to purchase Irish potatoes and cabbages for resale. He hopes to expand his business and improve his standard of living in the future.

loans.use: To purchase Irish potatoes and cabbages for resale

loans.name: Helen's Group

texts.en:
Helen B., 60, is from the village of Mabini. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of the other group member if one is delinquent or defaults.

Helen is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, she owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting crops. The main source of income for the business comes from the cassava and vegetables she plants and then sells in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Helen is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This will be Helen’s 6th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s living standard. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: House repair

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su décimo  ciclo es un comité ejemplar por la unidad y responsabilidad que demuestran las señoras con cada tarea que ejecutan.
Entre las integrante se encuentra la  Sra. Nidia Cabañas tiene  50 año, tiene 3  hijos, su actividad principal es la confección de todo tipo de ropas.
Ella recibe los pedido de confección de sus cliente y trabaja sobre ella entre las labores de la casa, ella comenta que los ingresos de su trabajo ayuda para ayudarle a  su marido con los gastos.
Actualmente con el comité recibió mucho asesoramiento para mejorar su actividad y desea implementarla, para ello solicita un préstamo con lo quiere compra un maquina overlock con los mejoría las terminaciones de sus confecciones.
Ella es una señora muy  dedicada a sus hijos  y muy trabajador, y tiene mucha esperanza  en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia
texts.en:
The present committee is in its 10th cycle and is an exemplary group because each member demonstrates unity and responsibility in every task that they carry out. Within this group, you will find Señora Nidia Cabañas, who is 50 years old and has three children. Her main occupation is the tailoring of various types of clothes. She receives her orders from clients and works on them in between her household chores. She states that her income goes towards helping her husband with their living costs. Currently, with her committee, she has received a lot of advice to help improve the effectiveness of her business and hopes that it will continue to grow. As such, she is seeking a loan in order to purchase an overlock machine that would improve the final touches on her clothes. She is a very dedicated mother and hard working woman with a great desire to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an overlock machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dried meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To supply her store with food products

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Al visitar al banco comunal “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” entrevistamos al socio Paulino. Las reunionés del banco comunal se hacen cada treinta días en la comunidad de Rumichaca en su casa de Paulino. La ciudad de Rumichaca se encuentra ubicada a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco, como quien va hacia las ruinas Incas de Ollantaytambo.
    
El socio Paulino, tiene 46 años, es divorciado, tiene cinco hijos y vive en la comunidad de Rumichaca de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Su actividad económica de Paulino es la fabricación de muebles de madera como por ejemplo sillas, puertas, ventanas y muchas cosas más, el requiere el préstamo para mejorar su carpintería. 
  
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
During a visit with the Communal Bank “Nueva Visión de Rumichaca” (New Vision of Rumichaca), staff members from Asociación Arariwa had the chance to interview Paulino, one of its members. The Communal Bank meetings are held every thirty days in the community of Rumichaca and the members gather at Paulino’s house. The city of Rumichaca is located an hour and ten minutes away from the city of Cusco, which is where one can find the Incan ruins of Ollantaytambo.

Paulino is 46 years old, divorced, and has five children. He lives in the community of Rumichaca in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco. Paulino manufactures furniture pieces made of wood such as chairs, doors, window frames, and many other items. He needs a loan to make improvements to his carpentry shop.

Paulino is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to his carpentry shop

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo A. Sr. is from the village of Burgos. He is 35 years old. Arnulfo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arnulfo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Arnulfo is just starting this business.

In 2010, Arnulfo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Arnulfo is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Arnulfo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Silas Oyucho

texts.en:
Silas Oyucho is a Kenyan small-scale trader from Sondu in Kisumu town. He is married to Rosemary Anyango, who is a housewife. Silas has six children who all depend on him.

To make a living, Silas operates a retail business where he sells household goods like soaps, detergents and many more items in his neighborhood in Sondu town. He makes a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings (about $87), which goes to meet his family’s daily expenses. He has operated this business for the last 18 years and he believes that if he had  gotten access to loans earlier, then he could have grown his business. However, he is determined and has taken a second loan to buy more household stock for sale.

His desire is to always meet the expectations of his clients by stocking what they usually want. The sky is the limit and he is looking for Kiva lenders to help him meet his target.

loans.use: To buy stock of household products for sale

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut N., 38, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for high quality rice products. She sells Chinese noodle for an income of USD 5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband so he can operate his business efficiently.
