In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. N.'s husband appears in the photograph because N. was not available.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike for her husband

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn R. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Evelyn is separated from her spouse and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina A. is a 40-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  Fish vending and clothes retailing businesses. She lives in Prk. Cordova, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending and clothes sales businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 30000. 

Gina is now borrowing PHP 20000 to add to her operating capital of her fish vending business. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 17000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Stanley Kipkurui

texts.en:
Stanley is a 30 year-old farmer from Isampin Village which is located in the agricultural town of Kilgoris, south of the Great Rift Valley. Stanley is married to Mary Soi and they have a one year-old daughter, Naresho Naanyu.

Stanley is an industrious farmer who specializes in planting maize. This is the main cash crop grown in this town which has rich soil and an excellent climate for maize growing. Stanley joined Kiva partner KADET Limited to gain access to micro credit and has applied for a loan of Kshs 20,000 (aprx. $250). He intends to use this loan to buy farm materials such as planting seeds and fertilizer, and also to pay labour for the people he will temporarily employ during this planting season. 

Stanley hopes to expand his farming business and therefore maximize his profit. He desires to make enough income to be able to educate his daughter. He hopes to achieve his dreams through this loan. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy farm materials such as fertilizer and planting seeds, and to pay labour.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela tiene 56 años y  es casada y  fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo. Actualmente, Manuela vive en la ciudad Andahuaylillas provincia de Quispicanchis de Departamento de Cusco. Manuela se dedica a la venta de maíz y también se dedica a la  crianza de animales menores comopor ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. 

Manuela desde hace mucho tiempo participa en el banco comunal “La Triunfadoras”. Con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir de S/. 2000 soles, ella invertirá en comprar maíz y animales menores como cuyes.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Manuela is 56-years-old.  She is married and has one child who is the fruit of this union.  Currently, Manuela lives in the city of Andahuaylillas in the province of Quispicanchis in the Cusco region.  Manuala works selling corn and also raises small animals like guinea pigs and hens.  

Manuala has participated in the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners) for a long time.  With her next loan she hopes to receive 2000 soles.  She will invest the money in the purchase of corn and small animals like guinea pigs.

This member is very thankful for the opportunity offered to her and promises to follow through with the payments in the time-frame of the loan.

loans.use: To buy corn and small animals like guinea pigs.

loans.name: La Union Es Progreso Group

texts.es:
Ofelia Margarita P. M.,con 55 años D. edad, madre soltera en estado D. abandono, con 9 hijos.
Mujer emprendedora y con ganas D. salir adelante. Comenzò vendiendo condimentos, y los repartìa D. casa en casa. Luego vendiendo comida cerca D. la plaza San Agustìn D. Cajas en Huancayo. La envidia D. algunos vecinos hicieron que la desalojaran del lugar, como tenia que responder y llevarles el alimento a sus hijos, alquilò un pequeño espacio D. un terreno cerca al lugar donD. vivìa, en el cual contruyò un kiosko D. forma artesanal donD. venD. abarrotes; actualmente es una bodeguita. Ella tiene la perspectiva D. que en el futuro sea una gran bodega.
Con el prèstamo abastecerà D. mercaderia su negocio para la campaña naviD.ña.
texts.en: Ofelia Margarita P. M. is 55 years old. She is a single abandoned mother with nine children. An entrepreneurial woman, she has a desire to succeed. She began selling condiments door-to-door. She later sold food close to the plaza San Agustín D. Cajas in Huancayo. Some disagreeable neighbors forced her to vacate the place. In response, in order to bring food to her children, she rented a small space close to the where she lived. Here she constructed a kiosk by hand where she now sells groceries. It is currently a small shop but she has a vision to make this into a large store. With the loan she will supply merchandise to her business for the Christmas season.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Blanca Rosibel

texts.es:
la sra. Blanca Rosibel C. L. esta soltera y es comerciante, tiene una tienda en la cual vende ropa nueva y carteras, no tiene hijos y esta cursando sus estudios universitarios. Blanca viene de una familia luchadora, viaja por las noches a la universidad en donde se esta graduando este año de ingenieria agroindustrial, su meta es crecer como profesional.
gracias a su hermano tiene este negocio, el le dio un puesto para que trabajara y estudiara a la vez logrando sus objetivos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio ya que sus clientes le estan pidiendo pantalones de moda actual.
 
su sueño es tener una familia y seguir luchando con su negocio y al encontrar una oportunidad de trabajo en su carrera trabajar y ahorrar para abrir otro nuevo negocio.
con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio cubre sus gastos personales y sus estudios.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosibel C. L. is single and a saleswoman.  She has a store in which she sells new clothes and purses.  She doesn't have any children and is studying at university.  Blanca is from a determined family.  In the evenings she travels to the university, from which she will be graduating this year in agroindustrial engineering.  Her goal is to grow as a professional.

Blanca has this business thanks to her brother.  He gave her a stall so that she could work and study at the same time, in order to achieve her goals.

She will use her loan to buy merchandise for her business since her customers are asking for fashionable pants.

Her dream is to have a family, to continue working in her business and, when she finds a job in her chosen career, to work and save so that she can open a new business.

Blanca uses the profits which she makes in her business to cover her personal expenses and to pay for her studies.

loans.use: To buy shirts, t-shirts, blouses, pants, swimsuits, dresses and purses

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred W. is a man of twenty-seven years, married to Carolyne, and is blessed with two beautiful children. They live in Kapomboi in Kitale Town. Fred has a transpotation business as his primary business but also does dairy business. He has been in this businesses for one year now and gets a monthly income of nine thousand shillings. 

This will be Fred's second loan from KADET, and he paid his previous loans well. He plans to repair his motorcycle so that he can serve his customers better. He wants to buy new tires for the motorcycle, plus buy dairy feed worth ten thousand shillings.

In future, Fred wants to buy another motorcycle so that he can expand his transport business. He also wants to start a taxi business and educate his children so that they can have a better life.

loans.use: To service the motorcycle and buy animal feeds

loans.name: Ma Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ma del Socorro Rosa Rodríguez es una mujer que trabaja en una comedor para el bienestar y salud de la comunidad, el gobierno puso comedores en el cual ella ofrece sus servicios recibiendo su salario. Ahora ella requiere el apoyo para comprar el cableado de su casa y sea instalado, el que tiene ya esta muy deteriorado; para poder conectar algún aparato electrónico tiene que conectar varios cables  lo puede perjudicar una descarga eléctrica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ma. del Socorro Rosa Rodríguez is a woman who works at a community kitchen.  The government set up eateries.  She works in one of them and earns a salary doing so.

She needs the loan to buy and install electrical wiring in her house.  What she has now is much deteriorated and in order to plug in an electrical device she has to connect several cables and this could lead to an electrical discharge.

loans.use: To rewire her house.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian B. is from the city of BACOLOD OZAMIZ CITY. She is 53 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Vivian owns & operates an agricultural business, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Vivian joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizer for garden maintenance. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.es:
El señor Emmanuel Marques esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual podo poner la protecciones a su casa. 
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para poder construir la barda alrededor de su vivienda, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su empleo como medico de una clínica particular.
Desea la seguridad y la protección de su familia cuando el no este en casa. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Sandra Luz Quezada quien es la esposa del señor Emmanuel, ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita y fue imposible que nos atendiera.
texts.en:
Emmanuel Marques is grateful for your help with his previous loan, which which he was able to use to install security measures in his home.

He is now requesting a loan to build a fence around his property, at the moment he does not have the money necessary to make that improvement.

He plans to pay back the loan with his earnings from his job as a medic at a clinic.

He wants to give his family security and protection when he is not at home.

The person in the photo is Sandra Luz Quezada, who is Emmanuel's wife, since he was at work the day of the visit and it was impossible for him to meet with us.

loans.use: Construction on the fence around the house

loans.name: Wilson Gustavo

texts.es:
El joven Wilson es de la  compañía Ndavarú de Carapeguá, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la  venta ambulante hace mas de 5 años.
Anteriormente trabajaba en Argentina como albañil, pero a causa de la enfermedad de su mamá tuvo que volver al Paraguay y buscó una alternativa de ingreso económico para poder sobrevivir.
Solicita el crédito ya que tiene muchos pedidos de uniformes y artesanía.
texts.en:
Wilson is a young man from the Ndavarú de Carapeguá company.  He is 26 years old, single and has been working as a door-to-door salesman for over five years.  He used to work in Argentina as a bricklayer but when his mother became ill he had to return to Paraguay and look for another way to make an income.

He is requesting the loan because he has received a lot of orders for uniforms and crafts.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads and crafts

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a married woman with five children. Three of her children attend school, while two are still young for school. Samira owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Samira has operated a cashew nut selling business for the past five years, selling at the market to town dwellers. Samira faces a major challenge of high competition from other cashew nut sellers and seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business and sell as wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Makhira

texts.ru: Makhira K. 28 let. Ona ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Makhira jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Ona soderjit sebya i mamu i poeotmu uje 7 ket kak nachala rabotat i prodovat jenskuyu odejdu. Makhira seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit jenskuyu odejdu po sezonu dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Makhira K. is 28 years old.  She is single and does not have children.  Makhira lives in Baku with her mother.  She supports herself and her mother and has been selling women’s clothing for seven years.  Makhira currently needs 2300 AZN to buy seasonal women’s clothing for resale to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying clothing for resale

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan, a married woman born in 1985, is the village bank president selected by its ten members. The members of this village hope to increaS. their income to improve their family's living conditions by theS. loans. 

Chan and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land which they uS. to grow rice to support their family. Her husband is also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support the family. This couple has two children: one is attending a local school while the youngest one is 2 years old. They do not have enough money to grow their crops. Thus, Chan would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline for growing rice.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and gasoline for growing rice.

loans.name: Elizabeth María

texts.es:
La Señora Elizabeth Y. es socia del banco comunal Damas del Futuro, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene hermosos paisajes para disfrutar, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Elizabeth tiene 25 años, vive en unión libre y tiene  2 hijos de 6 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros pero independientes.

La Señora Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad  la realiza hace 8 años y su mercadería la vende en su propio sector a sus amigas y conocidas. Así tiene tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una tía, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  blusas, pantalones, camisetas, ropa interior, etc. para incrementar su mercadería.
 
Su meta es tener una casita propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth Yuqilema is a member of the "Damas del Futuro" communal bank.  She lives in the Miraflores sector of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and beautiful scenery.  Its historic center has been designated a World Heritage site and its people maintain the culture and traditions.

Elizabeth is 25 years old and lives with her common-law husband and two children, ages six and one.  Her eldest son studies at the local school.  Her husband works for a private company.  They do not have their own home so they live with her parents-in-law, but independently. 
 
For eight years Elizabeth has been selling all kinds of clothing to friends and acquaintances who live nearby.  This gives her time to care for her children.

This is her third loan through the communal bank to which she was invited by her aunt.  She plans to use the loan to buy blouses, trousers, t-shirts, lingerie, etc. to increase her stock of merchandise.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy blouses, trousers, t-shirts, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús M. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 6 años comenzó con unos ahorros vendiendo chiverías y poco a poco gracia a su ardua labor y los prestamos su negocio ha ido creciendo. 
Ella es madre y padre de dos niños de 13 y 10 años los cuales son su razón de ser y su meta es tener una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Jesús M. is a hard working, dedicated and enterprising woman who is the owner of a grocery store she has had for 6 years. She started with some savings selling chips and little by little, thanks to her hard work and the loans, her business has grown. 
 
She is both mother and father to the children, aged 13 and 10, who are her reason for being. Her goal is to have a variety store.

loans.use: She will invest im basic grains, meat, chips, soft drinks, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Ninoska Cecilia

texts.es: Ninoska Cecilia tiene la actividad como es venta de calzado. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Inicio este medio de vida, Es una gran ama de casa que siempre está interesada en otorgarles a sus hijos y su familia el alimento diario. Trabaja todos los días de la semana a visitar a sus clientes que esperan los encargos que realizan. Tiene más de 7 años con su negocio 7 años y que le ha ido muy bien ya en su mayoria las sandalias que ofrece es lo que mas demandan sus clientes, los jovenes siempre le realizan encargos de zapatos deportivos, zapatillas, botas, sandalias con tacones finos entre otros estilos de moda. Este crédito es para comprar sandalias, zapatos deportivos, zapatillas de vestir, chinelas, botas, botines y calzado para niños.
texts.en: Ninoska Cecilia works selling footwear. She has two minor children in her care. She started this way of life because she is a great homemaker who is always interested in earning the daily bread for her children and family. She works every day, visiting her customers who await the orders they place. She has spent more than 7 years in this business and it has gone very well. The sandals that she sells are the product she has that are in the greatest demand, as well as young people who are always looking for athletic schools, boots, and high heels, among other styles. This loan is to buy sandals, athletic shoes, dress shoes, slippers, boots and shoes for children.

loans.use: to buy sandals, athletic shoes, dress shoes, slippers, boots and shoes for children.

loans.name: Juana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Juana tiene su propio negocio, el cual inicio hace trece años, una pulpería que ha venido creciendo tras estos últimos años, comenzando con pequeñas venta de leña y nacatamales. 
Al proyectarse con financiamiento en Afodenic, logra poner una pulpería la cual ha venido trabajando, durante once ciclos de los cuales han sido para el desarrollo de su negocio al comprar más productos para ofertar a sus clientes.
Con este nuevo préstamo, comprara granos básicos como: tres quintales de arroz, cuatro quintales de azúcar, seis cajas de jabón marfil, tres bidón de aceite, gaseosas, golosinas que ayuden a mantener el equilibrio de las ventas como  mejores ganancias que ayude a pagar sus gastos básicos entre otros gastos.
texts.en:
Juana has her own business which she started three years ago, a general store that has been growing for the last few years, which she started by selling firewood and nacaramales (steamed corn cakes).
With planning and financing from Afodenic, she was able to open a general store at which she has been working through twelve cycles, developing her business through the purchase of more products to offer to her customers.
With this new loan she will buy basic grains such as three hundredweights of rice, four hundredweights of sugar, six cases of soap, three drums of oil, sodas, candies, that will help to maintain the balance of the sales through better profits that will help to pay her basic and other expenses.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of basic grain products to achieve better sales.

loans.name: Gladys Birmania

texts.es:
Gladys Birmania tiene 39 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y dos hijos de 18 años y de 11 años en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL RECREO se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol y soya.

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y soya en terrenos de los padres, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar seguir en el negocio de la familia.

Le gusta escuchar musica y pasar tiempo con la familia.
texts.en:
Gladys Birmania is 39 years old, married and lives with her husband and 2 children, ages 18 and 11,  in the canton Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  

The members of the communal bank El Recreo live in the canton Ventanas in the rural area of San Vincente de las Lomas.  The members work in agriculture growing short cycle crops such as corn, rice, beans and soy.  Gladys grows corn and soy in her parent's fields.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas and sells in the markets every day, especially in the Sunday markets.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and compost.  The loan will help to supply her with the things she needs.   The challenges that she faces are competition and weather variations.  

Her dream is to continue working in the family business.  She likes to listen to music and spend time with her family.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Adégan Edem

texts.fr: Agée de 29ans, Mme Adégan est mariée à un coiffeur. Elle désire venir au secours des personnes en difficultés (femme enceinte, malade) c’est pour cela elle a ouvert en 2008 sa clinique nommée « EL SHADDAI » pour venir en aide aux couches vulnérables. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des matériels d’accouchement (bassin de table, pince, table d’accouchement)
texts.en: Mme Adégan, 29, is married to a hairdresser. She wants to help women in need (pregnant or ill women) and for that reason she opened her clinic in 2008, calling it « EL SHADDAI » to help with difficult deliveries. This loan will be used to buy supplies for delivering babies (a standing sink, forceps, and a birthing table).

loans.use: to buy supplies used for birthing babies.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  is married and has five children.  All her children go to school. Annet has a business selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for five years. 

Annet has requested a loan of 200000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second-hand clothes and shoes. She works at the market and sells on a retail basis. She works six days a week and sells to all categories of people.   Her business challenges include transporting bales of clothes from Owino market to her stall in Kawala, defaulters, and the rainy season as she works from an open place. 

Annet is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she can start selling wholesale only, and to buy a plot of land. Annet lives in a home that she owns.  Her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, paying utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Leonardo José

texts.es:
Leonardo, un joven de 30 años, se casó a muy corta edad teniendo tan solo 17 años, lo cual dentro de su matrimonio procreo dos hijos. De profesión Agricultor, inicia hace 10 años, originario de La Quinta - Isiqui/ Estelí. Pudo impulsar su producción y conocimientos adquiridos con la ayuda de su padre. 

Solicitó el financiamiento del crédito para la siembra de frijoles, compra de insumos y pago de mano de obra. En un futuro desea comprar su propia tierra para seguir cultivando frijoles y obtener un buen capital de trabajo para estar limpio y no tener deudas pendientes.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a young man of 30.  He got married at a very young age (when he was only 17) and has two children from his marriage.  Leonardo is a farmer by profession.  He started out 10 years ago and is originally from La Quinta - Isiqui/Estelí.  He has been able to boost his production and knowledge with the help of his father.

Leonardo requested this loan to grow beans, buy supplies and pay workers.  In the future he would like to buy his own land where he will continue growing beans.  He would also like to have good working capital so that he can be free of debts.

loans.use: to maintain two 'manzanas' (approx. 3.4 acres) of beans.

loans.name: Gladys Yoni

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladys Yoni; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, ella tiene un triciclo donde vende caramelos, galletas, chupetes y gaseosas, ella trabaja en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja de lunes a domingo, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como caramelos, galletas y gaseosas para implementar su triciclo.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Gladys Yoni, a member of “MAMA SIMONA”, a Communal Bank located in districts, province and department of Cusco.

Gladys Yoni is 30 years old, she lives with her life partner and has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with her retail activity: she sells sweets. She owns a three-wheeled vehicle she uses to sell candies, biscuits, lollipops and fizzy drinks. She is a street vendor, and she works Mondays to Fridays. Thanks to this activity she is Abel to provide for her children. She would like to improve and increase her sweet selling activity. She is requesting a loan to buy sweets such as candies, biscuits and fizzy drinks to stock up her vehicle.

She is happy about the loan and she commits to complying with the repayment of his dues.

loans.use: To buy candies, biscuits and fizzy drinks to stock up her vehicle.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has one child.

Amer has been an owner of a food market since 2005 selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and other dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $1500 loan in order to renovate and fix his market’s ceiling, doors, and floor. He is aiming to earn more profit so as to have the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to renovate and repair his market’s ceiling, doors, and floor.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 22 years old and married with one child who is in school. She has a business selling beans, sorghum and cooking oil in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sorghum and beans to sell

loans.name: Neetu

texts.en:
Neetu is 29 years-old .  She is married and has one child, aged seven.  In 2004, she established  her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Kiva partner Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy store inventory.  In the future, Neetu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support

As a borrower extra training is needed in order to improve living standards. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop.

loans.name: Kudus

texts.ru:
Кудус честный, добросовестный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и у них 5 детей. 
У него очень большая семья и много расходов. Для содержания своей семьи он начал заниматься скотоводством вот уже более 31 лет и у него очень богатый опыт в этом бизнесе. Кроме этого Кудус выращивает картошку и пшеницу для продажи. Он содержит скот в количестве 3 голов коров и 24 голов овца.  За полученный прибыль, он хочет построит дом для младшего сына. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки скота для того, чтобы откармливать и продавать их. Таким образом, он хочет получить побольше дохода.
texts.en: Kudus is an honest, conscientious and goal-oriented person.  He is married and has five children.  He has a large family and a lot of expenses.  Kudus became involved in animal husbandry in order to support his family and has now been in this business for over 31 years.  He has a rich experience in this business.  Besides this, Kudus grows potatoes and wheat for sale.  He owns three cows and 24 sheep.  He wants to use his profit to build a house for his youngest son.  Kudus is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock in order to fatten it up and sell it.  He plans to earn more money by doing that.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Tasrin

texts.en:
Tasrin is a 37-year-old fisherman, married to Narni, a 35-year-old lady. From their marriage, they are blessed with three children: Razak, 13; Rahayu, 12; and Farzan, 4. Both Razak and Rahayu are still at school.

Tasrin and his family live in a coastal area. He usually fishes from 5 pm to 3 am. But if the weather is bad, then he will be home earlier. Tasrin has a boat to support his work, but sometimes he faces difficulty fishing as the machine is stuck so he cannot catch fish. Therefore, he is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM. Tasrin plans to repair the machine and trawl because without these two things he won’t be able to work. He is expecting that TLM will assist him by providing the loan in order to implement his plan.

loans.use: to repair the machine and trawl

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used his previous loan to add stock of electronic goods.  He witnessed a lot of growth in his business. He was able to pay school fees for his children comfortably.  He hopes to have a well-established business and employ people. John has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to use as capital to start a business of selling plastic containers.

loans.use: To open a business of selling plastic containers

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  est une jeune mariée de 31 ans qui habite dans une des localités du Sénégal. Elle est spécialisée  dans le commerce de couscous et  de tissus voile. Elle capitalise une expérience de 12 ans dans son activité. Elle a choisi cette activité pour se faire un métier .Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2010. Elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des céréales afin de lutter contre l’inflation et la raréfaction  des produits au niveau local. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son activité de commerce de couscous.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou is a young married woman, 31 years of age, who lives in a town in Senegal. She specializes in the sale of couscous and fabric for headscarves. She makes the most of her 12 years of experience in her business. She chose this business in order to establish a profession for herself.

Mrs. Fatou has been a member of one of the UIMCEC offices since April 2010 and has already repaid a previous loan. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 francs with the goal of purchasing grains in order to combat local inflation and reduction in availability of these products. This loan will allow her to make a better profit in her business selling couscous.

loans.use: to purchase grains.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Dolores, tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 3 hijos (2 niños y una niña), ellos  están dedicados al estudio, viven en una comunidad urbano marginal de San Pedro Sula.
La actividad económica a que se dedica Doña Dolores es una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios (arroz,  frijoles, papas, pan, medicinas) y productos de limpieza.
Inicio su negocio con dinero que le presto una hermana, posteriormente con las ganancias logro aumentar su inventario.Ella cuenta en la actualidad con una clientela fija, lo que le permite un aumento en sus ventas y además la demanda de mayor oferta de productos.
Actualmente ha solicitado su segundo préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimentos, medicinas, productos de limpieza y un exhibidor de productos (vitrina).
Su sueño es aumentar las ventas y con las ganancias crecer económicamente para apoyar a sus hijos en la educación y lograr un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Dolores, age 36, is single because she is a widow.  She has three children (two boys and a girl) who are in school.  They live in a marginally urban community of San Pedro Sula.

Her business is a grocery store where she sells food products (rice, beans, potatoes, bread, and medicine) and cleaning products.  Dolores started her business with money that her sister lent her.  Later, she managed to increase her inventory with her earnings.  She says that she now has fixed customers.  This allows her to have an increase in sales.  Also, there is increased demand for more products. 

She has currently requested her second loan in order to buy food, medicine, cleaning products, and a display case.

Her dream is to increase sales.  She wants to grow financially in order to support her children’s education and to attain a stable business.

loans.use: to stock more products and to buy a display case.

loans.name: Rubylin

texts.en: Rubylin is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop where she sells detergent, shampoo & beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more detergent, shampoo & beverages to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rubylin hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more detergent, shampoo & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Mriuxi Aracely

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen Del Rosario se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. En este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a la fabricación de botones de tagua, artesanía y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora Mariuxi, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 16 y 12 años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio. El marido es chofer.

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días.  Lo que más vende son los cosméticos. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y cumplidas. 

Su sueño es tener un carro propio para su esposo.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Rosario” communal bank meets every two weeks in Colorado, Montecristi Canton (Portoviejo), known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  Most of the residents of this place manufacture tagua [nuts known as vegetable ivory] buttons, are craftspeople or in general commerce.

Mariuxi, 33, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children who are 16 and 12 years old; the youngest is going to secondary school.  Her husband’s a driver.


She is a housewife who in order to obtain her own resources sells L’Bel products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week going door to door; most of her sales take place at home.  She sells on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  What she most sells is cosmetics.  She’s been in business two years and does very well.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.  This is the third cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because her fellow members are very united and responsible.  Her dream is to have a car of her own for her husband.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Paolo Cesar

texts.es: El sr. Paolo vive en la zona del plan 3000 en casa propia tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. El sr. Paolo se dedica a la venta de bebidas refrescos, jugos y gaseosas por el cuarto anillo. Es cliente antiguo en la institución ya esta en su tercer ciclo, anteriormente estaba en un banco de emprendimiento, luego se le dio un crédito individual, en el cual demostró un buen comportamiento de pago. El crédito que esta solicitando es para aumentar capital de trabajo con la compra de refrescos por mayor, ya que tiene mucha demanda por esta época de calor. El sr. Paolo es una persona responsable, trabajador ya que esta es su única fuente de trabajo y con esta actividad mantiene a su familia solo ya que su esposa se dedica solo al cuidado de sus hijos, trabaja mucho ya que su meta es darles un futuro mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Paolo live in the Plan 3000 zone in his own house.  He has three school age children.

Paolo sells soft drinks, juices, and carbonated beverages along the Cuarto Anillo.  He is a longtime client of the Institución, and this is his third cycle.  He previously was in a communal bank, and then he was given an individual loan.  He demonstrated good payment behavior with that loan.  

The loan he is requesting is to buy wholesale soft drinks.  There is a lot of demand during this hot season.

Paolo is a responsible and hard-working person.  This is his only source of work, and it is how he supports his family by himself.  His wife devotes herself only to taking care of their children.  He works a lot because his goal is to give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy wholesale soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Albertina es casada, tiene 30 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la artesanía, específicamente en la tejeduría de cortes típicos, inició este trabajo gracias al apoyo de su hermana, y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia.

solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de hilo y poder producir mas, espera en el futuro mejoras su negocio y que sea prospero.
texts.en:
Maria Albertina is 30 years old, married, and has one child.  She has a sixth-grade education and she makes handicrafts for a living.  Specifically, she weaves traditional fabrics.  She started this work thanks to the help of her sister, and she currently has eight years of experience.

She is asking for a loan to buy thread to be able to produce more.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business and make it profitable.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Janko Pankara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JANKO PANKARA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosalía es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de detergente, tejido de mantas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de medicina natural, venta de wallaque, venta de cordero.

La señora Esperanza,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de víveres) que adquiere de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.
texts.en:
The “Janko Pankara” communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana focal center.  It has seven members headed by a governing board presided by Rosalía.  The communal bank members operate a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: detergent sales, blanket weaving, food sales, neighborhood store, natural medicines sales, ‘wallaque’ [type of fish stew] sales and sheep sales.

Esperanza indicates that this is the first time she’s worked in Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution thanks to an invitation from the promotion.  She has a business selling food currently that she's had for years having learned it from her mother.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase her capital.  She will buy foodstuffs in La Ceja and once she makes her food she’ll sell it in her stand.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family since she’s married and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: Zulma  de 43 años  vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y se dedica al comercio de mercancía variada como ropa, calzado, perfumes y accesorios para damas y caballeros. Ella inició su negocio para lograr independencia económica y sacar adelante a su familia, inicialmente utilizó un capital pequeño, pero gradualmente fue reinvirtiendo y poco a poco fue ganando nuevos clientes  con los que amplió su mercado y así mismo diversificó sus productos y vender todo lo que sus compradores le encargan. En la actualidad tiene 2 años de estar vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha desarrollado su microempresa y ha conseguido fortalecer su clientela,  porque con sus créditos  logra exhibir un surtido, tal como ellos  lo requiere y de manera oportuna. Su mayor desafío es tener el capital suficiente para complacer a su clientela que cada día crece; esta es justamente la razón por la que acude a su credikiva, tercer financiamiento que hace a esta organización y con el cual comprará ropa para damas y caballeros , para que estos vistan elegantes para recibir el nuevo 2012 y todo con la mercancia que les consigue Zulma a un muy buen precio.
texts.en: Zulma is 43 years old, lives in the city of Cartagena, and sells items such as clothes, shoes, perfumes, and men's and women's accessories. She began her business to gain economic independence and maintain her family. In the beginning, she had a small amount of resources, but little by little she reinvested in her business and gained new customers. This allowed her to expand her market, offer a large array of products, and sell everything her clients ordered. At the moment, she has been a part of the Mario Santo Domindo Foundation for two years. With this organization, she developed her small business and has solidified her clientele. With her loans she is able to exhibit an assortment of products as is required and in a favorable manner. Her biggest obstacle is having enough merchandise to please her clientele which grows daily. This is why she is requesting Kiva for her third loan, through this organization, to buy men's and women's clothing so her clients can dress elegantly to welcome 2012 at Zulma's reasonable prices.

loans.use: women and men's clothing.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto tiene 39 años, es un hombre muy alegre y luchador, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Alberto, es un hombre de mucho lucro, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y siembra plantas de de café. Tiene más de 20 años ejerciendo ésta actividad, asimismo contrata peones para que lo ayuden en la cosecha, de esa manera extrae rápido los frutos. Su productos son comercializados a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de cada producto que vende. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de San Francisco. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Para así darle una buena estabilidad económica a su  familia. Este es el crédito número 01 con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, contratará peones para que le apoyen en el desmonte de maleza que aquejan sus plantas.
texts.en:
Alberto, 39, is a cheerful, tenacious man living in his own house with his four beloved children that he wants to provide a better quality of life for.  Alberto is a very productive man; he is very dedicated to the work he does.  His work consists in tilling the soil; he’s a coffee farmer.  He’s been in this line of work for more than 20 years and hires day laborers to help him with harvesting so that he can extract the fruit more quickly.  He sells his production to gathering firms who pay well for each kilogram of product that he sells.  He considers the most difficult part of the job having to transport his products from his fields to the gathering centers located in the city of San Francisco.  For now, his main priority is to buy new land to expand his fields and increase production to provide his family with good economic stability.

This is his first MFI loan and he’s willing prepared to make all his installment payments punctually because he’d like to access a future loan later on.  He will use the 1500 new soles to hire day workers to help him remove weeds that are encroaching on his plants.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Allohagbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALLOHAGBE est composé de trois personnes qui fréquentent la même église.  Honorine, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 31 ans est mariée à un électricien du nom de Junior. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Honorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Honorine et son mari. Honorine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face aux charges de la maison depuis huit ans, Honorine vend divers produits de coiffure (mèches, produits défrisant etc.) dans sa région. Honorine vend aussi du gari (farine de manioc) de façon secondaire. Honorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Honorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALLOHAGBE un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches, des produits défrisant et du gari.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: joseline is 39 years old married with seven children. She deals in retail business for now five years. She has a responsibility of paying her children school fees, paying medical bills, food and all the necessary medical bills. Her husband does not have a permanent job which makes her sacrifice all her time for the betterment of her family's welfare. She has a desire to expand her business into wholesale, but has a challenge of debtors who put her dreams down. She is requesting for a loan to buy more soap and other general merchandise items for selling this festive season.

loans.use: to buy more soap and other general merchandise items  for selling this festive season..

loans.name: Martha Gladis

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Martha Gladis, I have a Pulpería (grocery store) located in the center of my neighborhood, I have a very good clientele and several years of experience in this type of activity, which produces income to support my family expenses and commitments. I need to increase my inventory because we are on Christmas season and the sales are larger.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Hola Mi nombre Martha Gladis, cuento con una Pulperia ( venta de de productos de Consumo Humano) ubicado en el centro de mi colonia, cuento con buena clientela y tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, necesito surtir mas mi negocia ya que estamos en epoca de navidad y el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To buy eggs, cooking fat in kilos and pounds, sugar, rice, corn, beans, soap, cheese, poultry, dairy, coffee.

loans.name: Alma Nelly

texts.en:
Alma Nelly has been selling electronics for 11 years. She has two children who help her in her business, which has been her only income and the only way to support and educate her children. She has the advantage of being able to travel to the United States and buy products there that she can then offer to her customers. Lately the demand for video games has increased and her customers have put in many orders.

In order to cover the demand from her customers, Alma Nelly requires a loan in the amount of $650.00. She plans to return the loan over a period of 4 to 8 months, because she trusts that the products she sells are of good quality and that her clients like them. Alma and her family need your generosity and support. They are sincerely grateful for any help you can provide them.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Alma Nelly se dedica a la venta de aparatos electrónicos desde hace once años, ella tiene dos hijos que le ayudan con su negocio, éste ha representado para ella su único ingreso y la posibilidad de poder mantener y darles educación a sus hijos. Ella tiene la facilidad para viajar a Estados Unidos y allá compra los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, últimamente la demanda de video juegos se ha incrementado y sus clientes le han levantado muchos pedidos.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, Alma Nelly requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 dólares. Ella está dispuesta a devolver el préstamo en un plazo de 4 a 8 meses, porque confía que los productos que vende son de buena calidad y de agrado a sus clientes. Alma y su familia necesitan de tu generosidad y apoyo, y agradecen sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas darle.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Anna Aya

texts.en:
Anna is a 29 year old mother of two—a boy of 9 and a girl of 6. For 13 years she has operated her business as a tailor in Myanga market in the Bungoma District of Western Kenya. With 5 sewing machines and one employee, her business is comprised of a diversity of activities. They include buying clothes second hand, repairing them and then reselling; tailoring dresses and suits for individual clients; selling pre-made uniforms to primary schools; as well as training young women how to be tailors.

Anna is currently training 5 young women in the skill of tailoring. Charging her students 7,000 Kenyan Schillings per year, they work at the 3 extra sewing machines not being used by Anna or her employee. This is of great benefit to the community, as Anna is able to provide young women with the skills they will need to attain employment and open their own tailoring centers. Anna herself was trained at Naitiri Youth Polytechnic, but not all women have the opportunity to attend established institutions.

Anna gives the clothes that she repairs to her husband to sell at the market. The clothing includes Vitenge dresses and Kaunda suits, the traditional clothing in the area. Her greatest specialty that separates her from other tailors, however, is her production of ready made uniforms for primary schools. Whereas other tailors lack the ability to prepare ready made school uniforms, Anna has already established relationships with multiple primary schools that she sells to. Along with being another example of how Anna provides for her community, it also represents a consistent and stable demand for her products.

According to Anna, the greatest challenge to her business has been a lack of capital to meet demand. With her new loan, she will purchase the necessary cloths and threads to expand the capacity of her tailoring shop. With this increased capacity, she hopes to grow profits and continue to pay for her family's basic necessities, including food and children’s school fees.

While primary education is supposedly free in Kenya, there are still many other expenses that families face, including uniforms, books, tests, school upkeep, etc. Moreover, the steep costs of high school education must be completely paid by families—which makes secondary education a product of tremendous sacrifice, and in some cases an impossibility. Anna hopes that her business will ensure that her children can attain an education that will help them in the future.

loans.use: To purchase material and thread to increase production

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Mr. M. owns a brickworks located in a densely populated district of Managua called Mirna Ugarte. He is married and has two children. He would use the loan to buy raw materials used in the manufacture of bricks so that he can fill a large order placed by one his best clients. The loan would let him take advantage of this excellent business opportunity and thereby increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio and Sarah Padial, Kiva Volunteers

El Sr. M. es propietario de una bloquera situadad en un populoso barrio de managua llamado Mirna Ugarte, es casado y padre de 2 hijos. En la actualidad está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima para elaborar más productos y cubrir con un pedido grande que le está haciendo uno de sus mejores clientes. El crédito le permitirá provechar esta gran oportunidad de negocio y le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos, mejorando así las condiciones de vida de sus familiares.

loans.use: To buy raw materials used in the manufacture of bricks.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a mechanic living in Bourj Barajneh, in the suburbs of Beirut. Ali is 54 years old and married with five children. He relies on the modest income from his garage to cover the basic needs of his family members. Nevertheless, Ali is a hardworking person who has already borrowed four times from Majmoua and always repaid on time. This time, again, Ali needs an amount of USD $1,200 to purchase engine oil and car tires for his business.

loans.use: Buy a stock of new tires and engine oil

loans.name: Soulaimane

texts.en: Soulaimane A. is a dynamic and strong 26 year old man. He lives with his partner and their children in Attecoube, where he has a butcher shop in the local market. A. inherited the business from his retired father. His first daughter entered her last year of primary school last October. Soulaimane's partner is a crop seller and  helps to pay for family's household expenses. Soulaimane benefitted from his first loan from AE&I in September 2006 and has been able to reimburse all his loans in good time. He has a sense of initiative and is self motivated. He loves his job and performs very well

loans.use: Soulaimane Alabi will use the loan to purchase some cows

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta is a cheerful and responsible young woman of 20 years of age. Ever since she was young, she has been interested in handcraft and artwork. With the help of Adelida, her 48 year old mother, Violeta has help and performed a wide variety of jobs and currently works to create flower arrangements for livestock fair prizes. She fulfills this job with the utmost care and dedication. Thanks to these characteristics, Violeta has a large demand for her goods. Violeta’s wish is to have a shop for handcraft and small manual jobs. In order to fulfill these plans, she is asking for a loan. Let us help this enthusiastic young woman to get ahead and prosper.

Translated from Spanish by David Hou, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Violeta es una alegre y responsable muchachita de 20 años de edad, desde pequeña se interesó por el trabajo artesanal y manual, ella con apoyo de su madre Adelida de 48 años de edad, realiza una inmensa variedad de trabajos y por esta temporada está confeccionando escarapelas para las premiaciones de las ferias ganaderas, oficio que desempeña con sumo cuidado y dedicación y gracias a estas características tiene gran cantidad de solicitudes.El deseo de Violeta y su madre es tener una tienda de trabajos manuales y para concretar sus planes solicita obtener un préstamo.“Apoyemos a esta entusiasta muchacha a salir adelante y prosperar ”

loans.use: Increase of capital to quickly open her handcraft shop.

loans.name: Fatuma's Muamko Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, age 40, is married with 4 children (ages 20, 18, 14, and 13). She has a business of selling clothes, which she started in 2007. She works from 7am to 5pm daily, and now makes a monthly profit of about $68.

Fatuma hopes for a loan to increase her clothing inventory. She will share this loan with Mwamini, another member of her loan group. Mwamini has a soap and ice cream business.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda and her husband, Nemesio, have huge inspirations to one day see all their children with a good career and a very bright future. This is why Yolanda and Nemesio work hard each day. Señora Yolanda buys and sells used electronics. She started this business because her husband's salary as a chaufer didn't cover all the family's expenses such as paying for school tuition for all 5 children.

Both jobs have become critical in supporting the well-being and education of their children. Señora Yolanda wishes to have more money to purchase more inventory in the city of Arequipa. She's sure that by increasing her inventory, she will be able to make more of a profit. This is why she's requesting your help.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Las innumerables ganas de ver a sus hijos profesionales y con un futuro promisorio son las razones que tiene Yolanda y su esposo, Nemesio, para esforzarse día a día en sus respectivas actividades. La señora Yolanda está dedicada a la compra y venta de artefactos eléctricos de segundo uso, emprendió este negocio porque el sueldo que su esposo percibe como chofer no cubría sus gastos familiares y la educación de sus 5 queridos hijos.Actualmente ambos trabajos se convirtieron en indispensables para esta familia, gracias a estas actividades y su esfuerzo están logrando brindarles educación y bienestar a sus retoños.El deseo de doña Yolanda es aumentar el monto del capital de su negocio con la compra de mayor cantidad de artículos de la ciudad de Arequipa. Está segura que aumentando su inversión logrará mayores beneficios económicos, con este propósito recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu importante ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory such as used electronics

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.ru:
Vidadi X. was born in 1975.  He was born and lives in the Agsu region.  Vidadi has been raising livestock for over 8 years.  Every year he expands his business.  This year he decided to apply for a Normicro loan and will use the loan to purchase several cows.

 Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer. 

Халилов Видади 1975 года рождения. Родился и проживает в Ахсуниском районе. Более восемь лет подряд занимается скотоводством. Каждый год он расширяет свое дело. В этом году он написал заявление в Нормикро Ахсуниский филиал. Получив кредит будет покупать еще несколько коров.

loans.use: Purchase several cows

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah has been selling gari (milled and roasted cassava), salt, maize and earthenware bowls in Mankessim for the past eight years. She is thirty-four years and a mother of three children.  Her children are all currently in school.
Hannah wants to use her loan to purchase more maize, gari and earthenware bowls for the lean season.  This would enable her to avoid price hikes which affect the other products she sells.
She is a member of the group called Lamb of God. Group members agree to take responsibility for the loans of their peers, which serves as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more gari, salt and earthenware bowls

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is 47 years and married with six children.  He has been teaching for 23 years with very meager salary.  With the meager salary, Alfred could not save enough to build a house for the family, pay school fees and other family expenses.  Alfred said that he is getting old but still living in a rented house which is very dangerous for his family.  With the little savings, Alfred started construction of the family house but could not finish due to lack money.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $350 to purchase doors, windows and cement to complete construction of the family house.  He will repay his loan from his monthly salary.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to complete the construction of his family house.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Click this link to view Marina's first loan

Marina is a member of the Village Bank Tu Angel Lucy.

Marina is married, 50 years old and has four children. Marina makes various kinds of breads in an oven that she rents. She sells her breads by walking from store to store as well as in the April 12 Market in the afternoons. Marina also makes gelatine that she sells in the April 12 Market with the help of some children.

Marina needs a loan of 1200 soles ($US425), money which will be invested in the purchase of shortening, firewood, and flour.

Marina's dreams are to have a car with which she can transport her breads, to make her business better and to offer the best life to her children that she can.

loans.use: To buy shortening, firewood, and flour.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba Y. sells both fresh and smoked fish.

She is married, but her and her husband's combined incomes is not sufficient for Aba and their two children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: Capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Thlong

texts.en:
Mr. Thlong B., 36, is the Deputy Director of Chhuok Khsach Public Primary School, earning about $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Tuon Sovan, also 36, earns about $2 per day selling cooked rice and food. They live in Baray Commune, Kampong Thom Province.

In order to increase the family's income, Mr. B. is requesting a loan of $700 to dig a pond to raise fish for sale, with the remainder of the money being used to purchase small pigs to be raised for sale by Mrs. Sovan. The loan will help them to improve their living conditions.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To dig a pond to raise fish for sale and to purchase small pigs to raise for profit

loans.name: Maikel Steward

texts.es:
El Sr. Maikel tiene 30 años de edad, habita en el barrio el Riguero, es casado y le tienen dos hijos de 11 y 12 años de edad, los cuales están cursando la secundaria, su esposa es maestra da clase en un instituto de alumnos de primaria. El negocio de don Maikel es electricista automotriz tiene doce años de tener su negocio independiente, el inició con capital propio y con sus ahorros ha ido comprando sus herramientas de trabajo  para dar a sus clientes el servicio que se merecen. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar activo para su negocio en una planta eléctrica y alambre embobinado para trabajos.
A futuro es captar más clientes, ofreciendo su servicio domiciliar, poder dar estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Maikel is thirty-years-old and lives in the Riguero neighborhood. He is married and has two children who are eleven and twelve-years-old. His children are in secondary school and his wife is an elementary school teacher. Mr. Maikel is an electrician working in the automotive sector, and for twelve years, he has had his own business that he started with his own money. With his savings, he has been buying tools for his work so that he can give his clients the service they deserve. He would use the requested loan to purchase assets for his business in an electric plant and barbed wire for his daily operations. In the future, he would like to get more clients, offer his services at client’s home addressees, and be able to give his children an education.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electrical machinery and barbed wire

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Kraasibea is 49 years old, divorced and a mother with two children. Her children are grown and currently working. Comfort sells frozen foods in the local market to support her business growth. With her six years' experience, she says demand for fish is high but she does not meet the capital requirement to meet such demands. She wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of frozen foods to enable her raised enough income to expand her business operation as she is recognized as the number one cold store operator in her community. She is a member of the group called "Biako Ye". Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Her picture was captured at her business premises.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc

loans.name: Pom

texts.en: Mrs. Pom S. lives in the Poek village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is 29 years old, and the mother of a child who attends the local school. She is a laborer in off-farm. Her husband, Mr. Seng San (pictured on the right), is a farmer and owns a plot of land and grows rice. The soil is poor and the farm is not producing crops well. Thus, Mrs. Pom S. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil and make the fields produce more crops.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to improve the soil in the field to produce more crops

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Née en 1960 au Ghana,  pays situé au coté ouest du Togo, Madame D. Rose est mariée et mère d’une grande famille de six (6) enfants. Elle exerce le commerce des produits médicamenteux, d’ustensiles et divers dans son quartier, au nord de Lomé. Avec presque dix ans d’expérience dans ce commerce, elle n’a jamais reçu un crédit au près de WAGES.  
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter des médicaments, des ustensiles, et de divers pour reconstituer son stock afin de pouvoir bien vendre.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Ghana, a country situated on the west side of Togo, Mrs. Rose D. is married and the mother of a big family of 6 children. She sells medicines, utensils, and various other items in her neighborhood north of Lomé. With almost 10 years of experience in this business, she has never received a loan from WAGES.

She is requesting this first loan to buy medicines, utensils, and various other items to bolster her inventory so that she can make more sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of medicines, utensils and various other items for re-sale

loans.name: Diana Paola

texts.es:
La señora Diana Paola tiene 21 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió el primer ciclo de Educación Inicial, pero al tener su hijita y convertirse en madre soltera tuvo que dejar de estudiar para poder trabajar. Su niña aún tiene 11 meses.
Su negocio consiste en vender productos de belleza de manera ambulante y en su propia casa.
El primer crédito fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invirtió para iniciar su negocio.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas,  invertirá en stock para la Navidad.
Diana sueña con tener su negocio propio y habilitar su casa para poder poner un negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Diana Paola is 21-years-old and belongs to the communal bank "Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II" (United for a Better Future II), located in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad in Peru. She studied through the first cycle of early childhood education, but upon having her little girl and becoming a single mother, she had to stop studying to be able to work. Her daughter is 11-months-old. Her business consists of selling beauty products as a street vendor and in her own home. Her first credit of 300 nuevos soles was paid off in 4 months, which she invested in starting her business. With this credit of 1,200 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in products for the Christmas season. Diana dreams about having her own business and fixing up her house to be able to accommodate her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in beauty products

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.fr: Dame H. Genevieve, agée de 28, est mère de 03 enfants dont deux jumelles. Elle s'est marié à monsieur Jonas TOSSOU. Dame Geneviève est couturière de formation et a ouvert un atelier. Parallélement à sa formation, elle a crée à coté de son atelier la vente de la farine de manioc, du mais, de l'haricot et des biscuits. Elle a trouvé actuellement une opportunuité d'achat de mais à PARAKOU au nord du Benin; et etant à cour de liquidité elle a sollicité un pret.
texts.en:
Ms. Genevieve H., age 28, is a mother with three children, including twins. She is married to Mr. Jonas TOSSOU. A dressmaker by training, she has opened a workshop. During her training, she generated sales of cassava flour, corn, beans, and cookies alongside her workshop. She has for the moment found an opportunity to buy some corn in PARAKOU in northern Benin; and being short of funds, she has requested a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sacks of corn, 1 sack of peanuts, 4 sacks of cassava flour, and more

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita empezó con su negocio, una tiendA de abarrotes, para tener un comercio de donde podía sacar comida incluso si no tenía muchos ingresos algunos días. Siempre ha estado vendiendo poquito, pero desde que empezó a adquirir préstamos de EDAPROSPO, hace cuatro años, pudo incrementar la cantidad y la variedad de sus productos.
A sus cincuenta y seis años Felicita vive con su única hija y su nieto. Su hija tiene otro trabajo y con las ganancias la apoya en la economía de la casa. Entre las dos logran cubrir todos los gastos del hogar.
Felicita siente que estos son tiempos precarios y de violencia, y por esta razón una de sus prioridades para el futuro es de ponerle seguridad a su tienda, para prevenir algún robo – que han sido frecuentes en los últimos tiempos en la zona.
texts.en:
Felicita started her business, a grocery store, so that no matter how much or how little she earned, she would always be able to pick up food for her family. She's always made a living selling here and there but since she started getting loans from EDAPROSPO four years ago, she's been able to increase the quantity and variety of her products. At fifty-six, Felicita lives with her only daughter and her grandson. Her daughter has another job and she contributes to paying the costs of the household. Between the two of them, they manage to cover all the household expenses. Felicita feels these are precarious, violent times and, consequently, one of her priorities for the future is to make her store safe from robbery, a frequent problem in the neighborhood recently.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy goods for resale.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent A. is a 33-year-old mother of 4 children. She is requesting a loan so that she can add more stock to her clothing shop, where she currently averages selling 8 shirts a day. She would like to purchase more stock so that she can increase her sales.

She wanted people to know that all her kids are doing well in school and that Kiva loans help people like her grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali A. is 60 years old and is married with four children. He is a market vendor, selling cosmetics and bath goods from his own market stall. Ali is already retired and his business, which he has been running for the last ten years, is his only source of income. However, it is successful enough to allow Ali to support his family and parents. Now Ali is planning to increase stock by purchasing more products.  Ali thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr:
A. Véronique est née vers 1974. Véronique est mariée à AYIDOTE Augustin et est mère de trois (3) enfants tous scolarisés. Véronique vend de produits cosmétiques et des colliers. Véronique achète ses articles à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin; plus précisément au marché international du Bénin. Véronique a pour projet de développer son activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients. C'est pourquoi Véronique sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Véronique was born around 1974. She is married to AYIDOTE Augustin and is the mother of three children, all in school. She sells cosmetics and necklaces. The merchandise is purchased in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, at the international marketplace of Benin to be exact. Véronique’s plan is to develop her business in order to respond better to the demands of her customers. This is why she’s requesting a loan from Alidé.
