Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and necklaces

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon T., 40, has been a rice farmer for years. Besides her farm work, she always sells all kinds of fruits in the local market and earns an income of $4 per day. To help meet the family's daily expenses, her husband works as an internal staff member for an organization and gets a specific salary of $180 a month. All four of T.'s children are still single and attend school. Mrs. T. needs to expand her business by borrowing money lent from Kiva. She will use the loan to order fruits and rice to stock and resell to gain additional income.

loans.use: To order fruits and rice to stock and resell

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor has been away from the farm for a number of years and he would like to get back into a cattle operation. He has inherited the family farm and has decided to invest some of his hard-earned dollars into farming and ranching property and would subsequently like to start running a few cows. Victor wanted to share a few thoughts on how he might go about starting from scratch. Victor has been a rancher all his life so Microinvest trusts him and wants to help him undertake this endeavor. He is honest with himself.

Victor wants to increase his ranch equipment to diversify his income, but only own as much equipment as is necessary. He might get into livestock hauling, brush removal, firewood sales, fence building and hunting guides. Microinvest granted him a loan of 30,000 lei to purchase all the necessities.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Elsy Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elsy Elizabeth G. A.  tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió primaria incompleta, tiene 3 hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Elsy se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos del pan llevar, inicio su negocio vendiendo abarrotes en su casa, hace dos años y medio vende ropa en el mercado de Bellavista.
El primer crédito de 300 soles que recibirà de su Banco comunal Bellavista  II, lo invertirá en la compra ropa (pantalones polares, buzos).
Elsy tiene como sueño tener su tienda de ropa  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. Elsy Elizabeth G. A. is 28 years old and lives in the Esperanza district of the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Peru.

She did not complete her primary studies, and she has 3 children who depend on her financially.

Elsy sells clothing and provisions for a living. She started out by selling provisions from home. Two-and-a-half years ago, she began selling clothing at the Bellavista Market.

This is her first 300.00 PEN loan from the Bellavista II Microfinance Institute, and she will use it to purchase apparel (sweatpants and track suits).

Elsy dreams of having her own clothing store so that she can grow as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweatpants and track suits

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru: Гулизор Факерова  1971 года рождения, замужем имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее образование. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2005 года.  Ее бизнес расцветал с года от год. Раньше торговала  только один вида продуктов. Теперь в  ее продаже имеется различные макароны, масло и многое другое. Благодаря поддержки КИВА увеличив свой капитал она расширила оборотные средства. От полученного дохода провела свадьбу выдала дочь замуж. Провела небольшой ремонт дома. Благодарна за поддержку Микроинвест и КИВА.
texts.en:
Gulizor F. was born in 1971, is married and has four children. She has secondary education. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2005. Her business has been flourishing with each year. She used to sell only one kind of product before. Now in her inventory there are different kinds of pasta, butter and many other items. Thanks to the support of Kiva she has increased her working capital and available cash. She used the received income to have a wedding for her daughter's marriage. Also she made a small repair at home. Gulizor is thankful for MicroInvest's and Kiva's support.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a shop business.

loans.name: Los Tres Amigos Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario los tres amigos son personas que ya tiempos se conocen y siempre han trabajado juntos y son residentes de la colonia la nueva caucara.
a continuacion se detalla lo que cada uno de ellos realiza para ganarse la vida:
 
el señor Omar Abel A. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la colonia la nueva Caucara San Lorenzo,  el viven en union libre con la señora Daysi Yamileth Avila,  dependen de ellos 04 hijos de los cuales todos estan en la escuela de la comunidad, el se dedica a la venta de chineria desde hace 06 años, negocio con el cual a podido sacar adelante a su familia necesita el prestamo para surtir un poco mas su negocio.
 
el señor Edilberto F. radica en la aldea la Criba  a 2 kilometros de la carretera panamericana su casa es de adobe repellada color blanca, esta viven en union libre con la señora Lesbia Mendez tienen dos hijos, ella es ama de casa y el se dedica al negocio de la chineria desde hace 03 años,necesita el prestamo para surtir mas su negocio.

el sr. Nelson Yovany C. A. tiene 36 años de edad, el vive en union libre con la señora 
Norma Yesenia Mendoza, tienen dos hijos, ella es ama de casa y el se dedica al negocio de venta de chinerias desde hace 07 años, sus ventas las relizan en la frontera del Amatillo, el necesita el prestamo para comprar mas mercaderia.

cabe mensionar que la venta de chineria es venta de productos de vidrio.
texts.en:
The members of the solidarity group “Los Tres Amigos” have always known each other and have worked together. They live in the Nueva Caucara development.

Below are the details of how they earn their living:

Sr. Omar Abel A. is 33 years old and lives in San Lorenzo, which is part of the Nueva Caucara development. He is in a common law marriage with Sra. Daysi Yamileth Avila. They have 4 dependent children, all of whom attend school in the community. For the past 6 years, he has been selling china so that his family can get ahead. He needs a loan so that he can buy more merchandise and generate a little more business.

Sr. Edilberto F. lives in the neighborhood of La Criba, which is 2 kilometers from the Pan American Highway. His lives in a white adobe house with his common law wife, Sra. Lesbia Mendez, and their two children. She works as a housewife and he has been selling china for the past 3 years. He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for his business.

Sr. Nelson Yovany C. A. is 36 years old. He and his common law wife, Sra. Norma Yesenia Mendoza, have two children. She works as a housewife and he has been selling china for the past 7 years. His sales are generated along the border in Amatillo. He will use his loan to buy more merchandise. It should be mentioned that these gentlemen also sell glassware in addition to china.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase glasses, plates, cups, bowls and vases

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina tiene 61 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes son casados e independientes. Por tal motivo, vela por su pareja y por el bienestar de su hogar. Hace 20 años se dedicó a la venta de comida en la puerta de su casa, pero los malestares de su edad le impidieron seguir trabajando en dicha actividad y ahora se viene dedicándose a la venta  de cosméticos, actividad que le está resultando beneficiosa debido al apoyo que recibe de sus hijas, quienes le ayudan en los pedidos de cosméticos a través de amigas y familiares. De la misma forma, Evangelina visita a diversos clientes que le hacen pedidos mensuales y ofrece a otras personas esperando conseguir nuevos clientes. Es así que trata de establecer amistades en los diversos espacios sociales que visita, ya que su deseo de seguir vendiendo e incrementar sus ingresos es una  prioridad para ella. Por otro lado, tiene el anhelo de reinstalar su espacio de venta de comida, pues una de las actividades que le encanta realizar y espera pronto retomar. Este es el 9no préstamo que tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA, lo anteriores créditos fueron otorgados igualmente dentro de banco comunal, el cual conforma hace 5 años, donde junto a sus compañeras trabajar organizadamente con la finalidad del progreso del grupo. Los 3500 que ahora solicita serán de gran utilidad, ya que espera tener el capital necesario para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza, además de reinstalar su espacio de venta de comida en la puerta de su casa.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería e inversión en su negocio de comida

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Don’t lose hope is the outlook in life of Nathaniel E.. He is commonly called “Nathan” in their village at Barangay Sto. Domingo Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. After finishing his vocational course, he married Shirley De Leon and they are blessed with two children. They wanted their children to be successful in their chosen field someday.
	Despite the economic crisis that is happening in the country, this couple is doing their best to uplift their poor living situation. They help each other to earn income for their survival and for the future of their children. They cultivate their farm for two cropping seasons by planting rice and vegetables. Furthermore, Nathaniel uses his tricycle to earn additional income daily for their immediate necessities. Due to financial difficulty, Nathan wanted to request for financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 to purchase the needed agricultural supplies for the maintenance of their crops in the field. He hopes that his harvest will become plenty and earn a higher income with the continuous support of KIVA.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Idertsog

texts.en: Idertsog is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Idertsog began his business in 2001 by selling a variety of consumer goods imported from China. This business started with a working capital of 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD). As his sales increased, so did his need for selling space. Therefore, in 2005, he bought a shipping container in which to sell his products and a truck to transport his products. Now his working capital is approximately 6,000,000 tugrug (~4200 USD). This business is the only source of earnings for him and his family, and he is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug (~2800 USD) loan so that he may purchase more supplies and products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies and products for his business

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda C. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del sur. She is 28 years old. Esmeralda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Esmeralda owns & operates a specialized vegetable retail store, selling vegetables in the local community. Esmeralda has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esmeralda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esmeralda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client is 21 years old and unmarried. He makes traditional Iraqi sweets. He has been engaged in this activity for the last four years. He has two assistants helping him around the shop. With this loan he hopes to buy more ingredients for making sweets and hire another assistant. The client has a good reputation in the city and has lots of customers.

loans.use: purchasing ingredients: nuts, flour, oil and seeds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old and married, with five children between 16 and 25 years of age.  All of her children attend school. Rose also takes care of additional family members.

She owns a two-room house where she stays with seven people.  Her family has access to electricity and piped water.

Rose has a restaurant, where she works seven days a week, with an average of 25 customers a day.  She buys the food for the restaurant from Kalerwe Market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala.  She incurs additional transport costs traveling to and from the market.

Her major business challenges include thieves and the rainy season. Rose's monthly expenses include rent for her business and residence, school fees and medication.  She has been in this business for 30 years.  She has been a member of MCDT for four years. This is her twelfth loan working with the same group mates. Rose joined MCDT because it was near her home and also to increase her capital. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a hotel.

loans.use: To buy food such as bananas, potatoes, sweet potatoes

loans.name: Magda Luz

texts.es: Magda Reátegui es una persona perseverante y creativa, vive en distrito D. calleria región D. Ucayali, tiene 46 años y es madre D. cinco hijos, uno D. ellos es menor D. edad; ella se dedica a la confección y decoración D. vestidos, trabaja junto a su mamá, y cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que es electricista. Integra el Banco Comunal  “Las Divinas” desD. hace seis años, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 300 soles que le permitió invertir en la compra y venta D. gaseosas. Ahora necesita un crédito D. 2300 soles que será invertido en productos para la decoración D. trajes típicos. La meta D. Magda es tener un local donD. pueda exhibir estos vestuarios, ya que ella los venD. y alquila.
texts.en:
Magda Reátegui is a very determined and creative woman. She lives in the Calleria district in the Ucayali region. She is 46 years old and has five children (one is still underage). She works with her mom sewing and decorating dresses. She counts with the support of her husband who is an electrician. She has been a member of the communal bank “Las Divinas” for six years. The first loan she received was of 300 soles and it allowed her to invest in the purchase and resale of soft drinks. She now needs a loan of 2300 soles, which will be invested in products to decorate traditional clothing. Magda’s goal is to have a store where she can exhibit this clothing in order to rent and sell it.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products to decorate traditional clothing.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel vive con su esposa en la calle luis Lara de la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que el realiza es la de transporte libre ya que tiene un auto con el cual trabaja todos los días para mantener a su familia, la esposa ayuda en el hogar vendiendo verdura en el mercado. El crédito que solicitan es para cubrir los costos de  reparación y mantenimiento de la movilidad

Es cliente antiguo y paga muy bien, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Daniel lives with his wife on Luis Lara Street, in the San Pedro zone of the city of La Paz. His business is taxi service; he has his own vehicle and works every day to support his family. His wife helps with expenses by selling vegetables in the market.

This loan is needed to cover the costs of repair and maintenance for the taxi. Daniel has been a client of the lending institution for a long time and has always paid promptly. For this reason, he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance of taxi

loans.name: Salome Mbatha

texts.en: Salome is married and has three children.  She describes herself as hardworking, active and jovial.  For the last five years, Salome has been making and selling dresses, skirts and trousers to regular customers and walk-ins.  She has three employees and her business is located at Gikomba market in Nairobi.  This is the largest and busiest open air market in Kenya. Her biggest business challenge is a lack of loyal and reliable customers.  She will use her loan of KES 50,000 to buy more materials for making dresses.

loans.use: to buy material for making dresses

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria  Es la presidenta del Banco de Emprendimiento San Isidro, actulamente vive en la ciudad de Santa Cruz por la zona del plan 3000, cuenta con casa propia, vive con su esposo el Sr. Cecilio, La Sra. Victoria se dedica a la venta de abarrotes aproximadamente desde hace 2 años, es una persona que le gusta trabajar en grupo; es una de las fundadoras de este banco de empredimiento, el monto que solicita es para la compra de mercaderia para su puesto de venta de abarrotes.						

La Sra. Laurita es una de las integrantes del Banco de Emprendimiento San Isidro es muy trabajadora que a pesar de ser joven es muy dedicada al trabajo y al estudio. Esta integrante se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con EMPRENDER, vive en la casa de sus padres, se dedica a la venta de comidas por la mañana hasta las 13:00pm. y a las 14:00pm. va camino a clases de la universidad. el monto que esta solcitando es para el aumento de capital de trabajo, quiere ampliar su pension.        
                                                                                               La Sra. Elsa es la jefe de grupo de uno de los grupos dentro del Banco de Emprendimiento San Isidro, la Sra. Elsa de igual manera que la primera se encuentra en su segundo ciclo es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica a la venta de jugos de frutas hace aproximadamente unos 10 años, lo cual trabaja con esta actividad, ella vive en el barrio San Isidro de la zona del plan 3000, vive en casa alquilada junto a sus cuatro hijos. el monto que esta solicitando actualmente es para la compra de licuadoras y aumento de capital en su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria is the president of the San Isidro Community Bank. She lives in the city of Santa Cruz in the Plan 3000 zone. She has her own house, and she lives with her husband, Cecilio. Victoria has been selling groceries for approximately two years. She is a person who likes to work in a group. She is one of the founders of this communal bank. The money she is requesting is to buy merchandise for her food selling stand. Laurita is one of the members of the San Isidro Community Bank. She is a very hard-worker. In spite of being young, she is very devoted to her work and her education. This member is in her second cycle of working with Emprender. She lives in her parents’ house. She sells food in the morning until 1:00 p.m. At 2:00 p.m. she heads towards her classes at the university. The money she is requesting is to increase her work capital. She wants to increase her service of making daily meals. Elsa is the head of one of the groups within the San Isidro Communal Bank. Elsa, like the first person, is in her second cycle. She is a very hard-working person. She has been selling fruit juices for approximately ten years. She lives in the Plan 3000 zone in the San Isidro neighborhood. She lives in a rented house with her four children. The money she is currently requesting is to buy blenders and increase the capital in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Ihuriro Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: M. Joweria is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children aged 2 - 17. She also takes care of her parents. Joweria has been selling produce for nine years, which enables her to make  a weekly profit of 120,000 UGX even though the business is affected by low capital and price fluctuations. She is grateful that the loans help her so much in her business and in its market location.  Joweria hopes for further expansion of her business in order to educate her children, build a good house for her family and own a business car to help with the transportation of  goods in the future. She is such a friendly and hard working lady and needs a loan to help with buying more produce for resale.

loans.use: buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Precious Women Group

texts.en:
Oldlady N. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Precious Women. She is 38 years old and is married with three children aged 2 to 8 years, with educational levels of 1st through 4th grade. She also cares for two siblings.

Oldlady and her family live and work in the Marshall, Elwa, community in Monrovia, Liberia. She was never able to continue her education through 1st grade due to lack of financial support from her parents. In the photo, she is the one holding the sign.

Oldlady’s business is the sales of raw fufu (cassava flour) and charcoal. She buys her goods wholesale from rural Liberia and sells to residents of Marshall in Elwa. She has been running this business for more than ten years and hopes to own a big shop in the near future. Oldlady started by selling with a little fund that was given to her by her husband but has now raised more funds for her family through her business.

Oldlady has a good management system and does not credit her customers. She also has a good manner of approach to her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan to purchase more fufu and charcoal to sell in order to improve her business.

Oldlady dreams of building a house for herself and her family.


About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more fufu and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lucia Anabel

texts.es:
la sra. Lucia Anabel P. L. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la Colonia Bella Orizonte, el Triunfo Choluteca, Lucia se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva como ser camisas, camisetas, blusas, toallas, pantalones, jeans, calsonetas, ropa de niños, ropa interior para dama y caballero, calsetines etc. 
tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion, en estos momentos Lucia necesita el credito para comprar ropa y zapatos escolares ya que el periodo de clases comenzo y muchos padres necesitan comprar los uniformes y el calzado para sus hijos y ella no tiene el capital suficiente para comprar dichos productos.
texts.en:
Lucia Anabel P. L. is 37 years old and lives in the Bella Orizonte area of Triunfo in the Choluteca region. Lucia sells new clothing, including shirts, t-shirts, blouses, towels, pants, jeans, shorts, children's clothes, underwear, and socks. Lucia runs her business from her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing and shoes, as the new school year is beginning and many parents need to buy uniforms and school shoes for their children and she does not have enough capital to buy the required merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and school shoes

loans.name: Lindah Auma

texts.en:
Lindah Auma M. is a modest single mother of 53 years. She separated from her husband and was left with the responsibility of taking care of their four children aged 11, 8, 7 and 4 years. The first born is in 7th grade of primary school while the last born is in kindergarten.

Lindah operates a clothing business in Migosi Estate, a populous residential area in Kisumu City. She has been in this business for the last eleven years and draws most of her clients from the nearby settlements and other market shoppers.

Lindah is taking her second loan from KADET after repaying well her first loan. It is due to her good credit history that she has been given another loan. She hopes to use the money from the loan to purchase more clothing stock as well as to purchase a new sewing machine since she intends to diversify into dressmaking.

Lindah hopes to expand her business and become a leading supplier of clothing so as to increase her clientele. Being a single mother, she also plans to educate her children to the highest level of education so as to improve their living standard.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and more clothes to sell

loans.name: George Mwaura

texts.en:
George is 23 years old and single. He rears pigs and sells them to butcheries in the Kinoo Trading Center.  This is his primary business and he has been doing this for the last two years.  George is also a part-time construction worker to raise extra income.

He found out about KADET through some business friends who were members. This is his first loan with KADET.  With this loan, George plans to buy more piglets to raise and sell.

loans.use: Buy piglets.

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en:
Khoder is a 39-year-old married man and father of three children. Three years ago, he decided to open a grocery store in his town in the Bekaa. He offers food products, home cleaning products, breads, cereals, drinks, canned food, bread, candies and other products to his clients. 

Today, for the third time, Khoder is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to expand his stock, and increase his sales, and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Claudia Marisela

texts.es: La Sra Claudia Marisela es madre soltera de 3 niños y le ha costado mucho trabajo sacarlos adelante sola, desde hace 3 años se dedica a preparar platillos de comida para vender y ahora tiene una muy buena clientela, le gustaria invertí un poco en la compra de mas mercancía para tener un surtido mas variado de platillos.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudia Marisela is a single mother with three children. She has worked very hard to provide for her children. For the last three years Sra. Claudia Marisela has been preparing and selling food and has built up a solid clientele base. She plans on using her loan to invest in new ingredients for her business to offer a more diverse menu.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for preparing meals

loans.name: Wanda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Wanda de los Ángeles tiene 24 años. Es una joven muy emprendedora, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace mas de 5 años que tiene esta actividad, pues no es el primer financiamiento que ella ha solicitado, ya que con ellos ha logrado mejorar su negocio.  Siempre está pensando en ampliar sus metas, pues es una mujer joven y que ha sabido mantener su negocio, con el paso del tiempo ha tenido la experiencia necesaria. El financiamiento es para la compra de perfumes, sabanas, toallas, cremas perfumes, tratamientos pues ya se acerca el día de la Madre pues ya tiene pedidos. Sueña con construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Wanda de los Ángeles is 24 years old. She is an enterprising young woman who has been selling general merchandise for more than five years. This is not the first time she has requested a loan, so she has been able to utilize the financing in order to improve her business. Wanda is always thinking about expanding her goals. Even though she is a young woman, she has been able to maintain her business and gain necessary experience over time.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, bed linens, towels, crèmes, perfumes, and treatments so that she can fulfill her orders for Mother’s Day. Wanda dreams of building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Deisy F.   es una señora de 58 años de edad la cual vive con su hijo y en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Desde muy joven doña Deysi y su familia se ha dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito aprovechando tanto la carne como la producción de leche.  Comenta que es muy buen negocio ya que la demanda es bastante grande alta en la comunidad

Ella considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y espera seguir haciéndolo.

Actualmente doña Deysi  desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢641.000 (seiscientos cuarenta y  un cinco mil colones), para comprar 3 novillas y así  poder incrementar la producción. Ella sabe que contar con un mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Pero esta seguro saldrá adelante

Doña Deysi es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Deisy F., 58, lives with her son in a community called Hernández located in Los Chiles, Alajuela province. This community is noted for being a mountainous region with vast expanses; it is quite humid and lies along the highway near our country’s northern border. Its main commercial activities are cattle-raising and farming, especially of basic grains, tubers and oranges. From a very young age, Deysi and her family has raised double-purpose cattle taking advantage of both the meat and the milk production. She tells us that it’s a very good business because demand is quite high in the community. She deems that she and her family have managed to gradually improve their quality of life thanks to this project’s progress and hopes to continue doing so. Currently, Deysi needs a microloan of 641,000 colones to buy three heifers to increase production. She knows that having a larger number of cows is a big sacrifice that will demand more work but she’s sure to succeed. Deysi is a member of the Unidos por un Desarrollo (United for Development) communal bank, one of EDESA’s 100 organizations in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes it will help her improve her personal and economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For double-purpose cattle.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene un taller de Mecánica en la ciudad de El Alto de La Paz..
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión (Compra herramientas para su taller).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Javier has an auto repair shop in the city of El Alto of La Paz. His home is located in the Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz. The loan would be designated as investment capital (to purchase tools for his workshop). This is the second time he is requesting a loan through Impro, and his history qualifies him as a top client. That is to say, he fulfilled his past loan payments, which allowed him access to this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tools for his auto repair workshop.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel A. is from the village of Carikkikan. He is 58 years old. Manuel is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Manuel owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Manuel has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Manuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Manuel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Manuel is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Manuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married man and father of four children from Lebanon. He has owned a small sweets and candies shop in his town since 1995. Over the years, thanks to his business' income, he has been able to meet his children’s needs. He is well known in his town, where all the kids pass by his shop to buy his delicious products, and he receives them with a large smile. Today, he is requesting a $1000 loan to buy additional sweets and to offer a wider variety of products to his little clients, in order to increase his sales and therefore his income.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To buy additional sweets

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth B. is married and has four children. She has been through junior high school. Elizabeth sells smoked fish at Takoradi. Her husband is a chain saw operator.  Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
The livestock business is one that requires much effort for the simple reasons that it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. Nizami S., has dedicated himself, for already ten years, to cattle raising which supports his humble family who so rely on him. His monthly income is about 200-300 AZN. He is married and has four children.

Currently, Nizami has turned to  AqroInvest CUI for a loan of 900 AZN to purchase calves so that he can raise and one milking cow of a specific type: “Damaz”.

loans.use: To purchase one milking cow and one calf.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old married man living in Lebanon. He has been selling cars since 2007 after seeing the need for such business in his town. This type of business earns a good income for his family, for which he is the main income provider.

He works independently in his business: he purchase cars, does the needed maintenance on them and then he resell them. Today, he is requesting $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to add to his savings to purchase another car and the needed equipment to renovate it and sell it at a good profit.

loans.use: To purchase another car to renovate and sell

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma vive en alquiler con su madre e hijo en la zona de alto san pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 49 años de edad, no es casada pero tiene un hijo de 15 años al cual mantiene; la actividad que realiza es la venta de productos de belleza, como ser perfumes, desodorantes, joyas etc. con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que se acerca la época de navidad, y las ventas se incrementarán, pero necesita el producto para poder venderlo.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través  de Impro;  por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Irma lives in a rental unit with her mother and son in the Alto San Pedro sector of La Paz.  She is 49 years old, unmarried, but has a 15 year old son she supports.  She sells beauty products, like perfume, deodorant and costume jewelry, to support her family.

The requested loan is to increase capital because the Christmas season is approaching and sales will increase and she needs to have stock on hand to sell.

This is the first time she’s asked for a loan via Impro.  Her social characteristics make her eligible for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of products for Christmas season sales.

loans.name: Olga Gricelda

texts.es:
Doña Olga de 40 años de edad, es comerciante de frutas y verduras, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel donde vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 22 y 23 años de edad, el negocio lo atiende en una zona donde transitan muchas personas desde hace dos años.
Ella solicita un préstamo pues quiere invertirle aumentando la cantidad de productos que ofrece a los clientes y la única manera de realizar esta inversión es a través de un préstamo pues no cuenta con los recursos económicos para llevarlo a cabo. Dicho préstamo ayudara a que doña Olga cuente con variedad de frutas y verduras frescas para comercializarlas y mediante esto pueda recibir mayores ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Ella quiere desarrollarse y convertirse en una mayorista en ventas de verduras para cambiar el estilo y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Olga is 40 years old and she is a fruit and vegetable merchant. She lives in the city of San Miguel where she resides together with her husband and their two daughters, aged 22 and 23 years of age. She has managed her business in a well-traveled region for the past 2 years. 

She requests a loan to invest with the purchase of more products to offer her clients. The only way to make this investment is with the help of a loan. She doesn't have the financial resources to do it on her own. This loan will help Olga acquire a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables to resell. She will see an improvement in her income and be able provide for the needs of her family. 

She wants to develop as a business owner and become a wholesaler of vegetables. She will be able to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Chacupe Alto, una zona  agrícola del distrito de La Victoria, se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que está conformado por una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte), el brinda este servicio en la zona donde vive y con los ingresos que percibe solventa sus gastos personales. Adicionalmente ayuda a sus padres trabajando en la agricultura, plantando hortalizas.

Actualmente el desea adquirir semillas de culantro para instalar una plantación de este arbusto en un terreno de cultivo que pertenece a su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Cesar es un joven bastante trabajador y emprendedor. El tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y hacer progresar a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien amable y tranquilo.Com
texts.en:
Cesar is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the village of Chacupe Alto, an agricultural area that is in the District of La Victoria. This community is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Cesar offers to transport cargo and passengers using a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle and an attached cabin). He provides this service in the area where he lives and uses the income to cover his personal expenses. In addition, he helps his parents with the farm work by planting vegetables.

At the moment, Cesar wants to buy cilantro seeds so that he can begin planting this herb on his family’s land. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN to help accomplish his goal.

Cesar is a hardworking and enterprising young man. He has great desire to succeed and make progress for his family. The people who know him consider him to be someone who is friendly and peaceful.

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting cilantro

loans.name: Aurora Elizabeth

texts.es:
Aurora de 31 años, ella elabora bisutería con materia prima básica. Vive con sus tres hijos en una zona urbana llamada suburbio de Guayaquil y caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes. 

Ella aprendió hacer aretes, cadenas, pulseras con utensilios que compra en una distribuidora de artículos y accesorios. Ha tenido una buena acogida con la bisutería que ella hace ya que es muy innovadora y hace nuevos modelos de revistas. Trabaja desde las mañana hasta la tarde recorriendo las cosas de su conocidos y vecinos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cadenas, aretes, accesorios como plásticos, metales para producir a un mayor volumen su bisutería. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender su bisutería y que sus hijos terminen los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Aurora, age 31, sells trinkets made of basic materials. She lives with her three children in an urban area called Suburbio de Guayaquil where most of the residents are merchants.

Aurora learned how to make earrings, necklaces, and bracelets with tools she purchased from a merchandise and accessories distributor. The trinkets she makes have been well-received since she is very innovative and creates new models found in magazines. Aurora works in the mornings and leaves in the afternoons to show her products to acquaintances and neighbors. With his loan she wants to buy chains, earrings, and accessories such as plastics and metals to produce a large volume of trinkets.

In the future, Aurora wants to have a store where she can sell her trinkets and see her children finish their studies successfully.

loans.use: Purchase chains, earrings, and accessories

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS MARGARITAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yovana; ella tiene 38 años D. edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la venta D. ropa, ella venD. ropa como pantalones, chompas, blusas y polos, la socia venD. en forma independiente llevando a diferentes tiendas que venden ropa y por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor. 

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta D. ropa, docencia, locutorio, restaurant y transporte.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Las Margaritas" [The Daisies] located in the district of Urubamba, provice of Urubamba and department of Cusco. 

The member is Yovana, 38 years of age, single and with two children. She sells clothing such as pants, sweaters, blouses and polo shirts. She sells independently, carrying her wares to various clothing stores, and by means of this business makes do for her children. The member is seeking a loan to purchase clothing wholesale. 

The other members work in clothing sales, teaching, a call center, restaurant and transportation. The member thanks those who form part of this dream by these means and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: To purchase clothes wholesale

loans.name: Daniel Jonathan

texts.es: Daniel Jonathan Gámez A. es padre de dos pequeños por quienes el sale adelante para ofrecerles un patrimonio y una mejor calidad de vida. El señor Daniel requiere de su apoyo para comprar material de construcción para realizar varias mejoras a su casa como lo es poner un portal en la parte de enfrente para darle una mejor vista a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Daniel Jonathan Gámez A. is the father of two young ones for whom he wants to provide a good future and better quality of life.

He needs help to buy building materials and supplies to make several home improvements, like an entryway on the front of the house so that the house will have a better appearance.

loans.use: To build an entryway.

loans.name: South

texts.en:
Mrs. South S. is a villager who lives in Phum Thum, Kandal province. She is a 40-year-old widow with two children who attend the local school. 

Mrs. South S. earns her living through selling fruit in the local market. Even with this business, she earns little income to support her family. In order to increase income to support and improve her family's condition, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more fruit to sell. She hopes that her family will improve with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Santos Arcadio

texts.es:
el señor Santos Arcadio A. tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos que dependen de el, su esposa le ayuda con la pulperia cuando el sale a hacer las compras, viven en la aldea Agua Zarca de San Lorenzo.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mercaderia y surtir su pulperia, nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio le esta generando ganancias. 
su deseo en este año es que su negocio sea mas grande y que su familia este siempre bien de salud.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de estudios y alimentacion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Arcadio A. is 48 years old.  He is married and has four kids who depend on him.  His wife helps him with his general store when he has to leave to purchase things.  The family lives in Agua Zarca de San Lorenzo.


He will use the loan to buy merchandise and grow his general store.  He told us he is very happy that is business is generating revenue.  His dreams for this year are that his business grows much bigger and that his family stays healthy.  His family needs the revenue from the store to cover school costs and food for his children.

loans.use: Buying tomatoes, potatoes, bananas, onions, carrots, soups, creams, beans, rice, sugar, soap, eggs, drinks, pastas, butter, oil, churros, matches, and batteries to stock his store

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionisio A. de 39 años, natural de San Francisco, esta casado con María Pacheco de 40 años de edad, juntos tienen 04 hijos;  viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Carmen pampa anexo del Distrito de Ayna San Francisco. Dionisio es el sustento de su familia; desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar y ha ganarse el dinero con esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza es comprar los productos a los campesinos tales como: café, achiote, cacao y palillo; que son productos netamente de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac y Ene. Ya tiene más de 17 años en este negocio, y cuenta  con el apoyo de su esposa, quien se encarga de pesar los kilogramos de cada producto que vende. Asimismo posee un carro, herramienta que le ayuda a transportar a los diversas comunidades en busca de productos, una vez acumulado una buena cantidad de mercadería lo trasfieren a las empresas acopiadoras de gran renombre como: Cooperativa Agraria, Cacao Vrae, Machupichu; quienes le pagan un gran porcentaje por cada kilogramo de la carga entregada. Su negocio le es muy rentable, asimismo gana extras cuando tiene que entregar la mercadería a las empresas acopiadoras y por tal le premian con una buena cantidad de dinero anualmente. Los meses de enero, febrero y marzo, son épocas de lluvias y derrumbes en las carreteras, lo cual significa impedimento para que pueda transportar dichos productos. Los planes para el futuro es seguir trabajando con el mismo ahínco que le caracteriza para así  sacar adelante a los miembros de su familia. Este es su 15avo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos; sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, para así acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de los integrantes. Los tres mil nuevos soles que recibirá, lo invertirá como capital para comprar productos a los campesinos.
texts.en: Dionisio A. is 39 years old and originally from San Francisco. He is married with Maria Pacheco, 40 years old, and they have 4 children together. They live in their own home located in the community of Carmen Pampa, near the district of Ayna San Francisco. Dionisio is the sole supporter of his family. Since he was a boy his parents taught him the value of work and that money needs to be earned. His business involves purchasing harvest products from farmers, such as coffee, annatto seeds, cocoa, and guavas. These are products that are native to the forest region of Valle Rio Apurimac and Ene. He has 17 years in the business and he has is wife’s support. She takes care of weighing the products before the sale.  He owns a car and it is a tool which helps him travel to various communities in search of products. Once he has acquired a fair amount of product he transports them to the renowned wholesalers, including Cooperativa Agraria, Cacao Vrae, and Machupichu. They pay him a significant percentage per kilo of product.  His business is very profitable, and additionally, the wholesalers who purchase his merchandise award him with a good sum of money annually. The months of January, February, and March are rainy and roads wash away, impeding him from transporting his gods. His plans for the future are to keep working in the same business in order to support the members of his family. This is his 15th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he has been responsible with his previous loans. He knows he needs to make his payments on time in order to be able to access loans in the future.  He is a very well liked member of this communal bank. The three thousand nuevos soles he requested will be invested in the purchase of harvest products from producers.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products.

loans.name: Sope Aladj Barra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE ALADJ BARRA est créé depuis le 27 juin 2007, au jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de SINOU KHALY qui l'abrit. Il est constitué de 19 femmes qui sont toutes du même village. Elles se sont regroupées par affinité et par voisinage.

Madame DABA S. au milieu du groupe en pagne raillé de couleurs multiples, dont son médaillon est mis en dessous est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.

Elle fait un commerce d'habits. Elle vend dans le village des robes de dames et vêtements pour enfants et bébés. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de trois ans. 

Son nouveau lui permettra de mieux développer son activité en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement en achetant plus de tissus pour la confection des robes et vêtements pour enfants et bébés

Avec les bénéfices que génère son activité elle parvient à acheter du riz et payer souvent des frais médicaux pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The business group SOPE ALADJ BARRA was created on June 27 2007, the day of the inauguration of the Village Bank of SINOU KHALY that houses it.   It consists of 19 women who are all from the same village.  They are grouped by affinity and neighborhood.

Mrs. DABA S., in the middle of the group wearing the multicolored outfit, with her medallion placed below, is the manager of the group.  She is 33 years old, married, and mother of 3 children.

She is in the clothing business. In the village, she sells women’s dresses and clothing for infants and children.  She has been in this business for more than three years.

Her new loan will enable her to expand her business and increase her level of merchandise by buying more fabric for making dresses and clothing for babies and children.

With the profits generated by her business, she manages to buy rice and frequently pay her children’s medical expenses.

loans.use: Expand and promote her small business

loans.name: Ledys Omaria

texts.es: Desde hace un tiempo Ledys Omaria se dedica a la confección y es a través de este trabajo que ha podido mantener el sustento de su familia, es por esto que ella necesita comprar mas máquinas para poder ofrecerle a susu clientes mayor capacidad de producción y de esta manera la calidad de vida de ella y su familia mejorará notablemente,
texts.en: For some time Ledys Omaria has worked making clothing, and it is through this work that she has been able to provide for her family. She needs to purchase more sewing machines so that she can increase the production capacity she offers her clients. This way she can improve her quality of life and her family will make significant strides towards a better life.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing machines

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en: Aurea is a 28-year-old married woman who supports her family by making nipa roofs and growing vegetables.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her nipa roof making and vegetable farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Aurea is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase raw materials for making nipa roofs.   This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Aurea aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to make nipa roofs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a "despulpadora" machine, for removing the outside of the coffee berries.

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Ana Marisol A. R. de 38 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras. Este negocio lo inicio desde muy joven empezó con el negocio para ganarse el pan de cada día.
Ella tiene dos hijos de 15 y 18 años los cuales le ayudan a vender después de clase y su meta es seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Ana Marisol A. R. is 38 years old.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who works selling fruits and vegetables.  She started this business when she was young to earn her daily bread.

She has two children who are 18 and 15 years old who help her after school.  Her goal is to continue prospering.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
Basilio V. F. es vecino de la Ostional en Guanacaste, el se ha dededicado toda su vida a la siembra de granos básicos.
Desde hace varios meses no ha podido dormir con tranquilidad ya que el techo de su casa se encuentra en  muy mal estado. Sus ganancias apenas le alcanzan para su diario vivir y para mantener su familia, es por eso que el necesita un préstamo de ₡300 000 (trescientos mil colones) para la compra de  Zinc para el techo y otros materiales necesarios.
Don Basilio   espera mejor su calidad de vida para seguir produciendo para su familia.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito  Apoyo Comunal Ostional,  una de las 110 Empresa socias de EDESA en  Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Basilio V. F. is a neighbor of Ostional, located in Guanacaste. He has dedicated his entire life to growing basic grains.

For several months now, he has not been able to sleep peacefully, as the roof of his house is in very poor condition. His earnings are barely enough to cover his daily expenses and support his family. This is why he needs a loan of 300,000 Costa Rican Colones (CRC) to buy zinc sheets for the roof and other necessary materials.

Basilio hopes to improve his quality of life in order to continue producing for his family.

He is a member of Empresa de Crédito Apoyo Comunal Ostional, one of EDESA’s 110 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets.

loans.name: Beily

texts.es:
La Sra. Beily pertenece al Banco Comunal “Pachacutec II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 27 años  y es madre de un niño. 

Ella se  inició como negociante con la venta de plátanos.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00.  Hace tres  años, motivada por una vecina, decide iniciar su negocio de venta de bebidas  gaseosas y agua mineral, poco a poco fue aumentando su clientela a quienes los atiende con la amabilidad que le caracteriza.  Ella cuenta con el apoyo de  sus padres. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1700.00, comprará cajas y paquetes de bebidas gaseosas de diferentes  marcas, tamaños y sabores para surtir su negocio y continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Beily sueña con tener una cevichería (restaurant - venta de comidas a base de pesacados y mariscos).  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en: Beily is a member of the communal lender “Pachacutec II” of Tarapoto, San Martín, Peru. She is 27, married and has one son. Beily started a business selling plantains, and received a small credit of S/ 300.00.  Three years ago, encouraged by a friend and her parents, she decided to begin selling soft drinks and bottled water.  Her clientele grew steadily as she is very helpful and amiable with her customers.  With this loan of S/ 1700.00, she plans to buy a greater stock of various sizes and flavors of soft drinks to provide a better variety of products for her customers.  Beily dreams one day of opening a restaurant specializing in fish and sea food.  She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for its support and for the opportunities that loans have provided to women such as herself.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Luisa le esta haciendo falta el portón al frente de su casa y no esta segura para su familia. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder pagarle a la persona que se encargara de elaborar y colocar el portón. 
Doña Luisa es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad que están estudiando, desea realizar la mejora ya que cuando ella sale a trabajar su hijos están seguros y protegidos cuando ella no este en casa. 
Con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fabrica como empleada de producción pagara el crédito. Ya que con la pensión alimenticia que recibe para sus hijos será para los gastos familiares y escolares.
texts.en:
Luisa’s house is missing a front gate so it is not secure for her family.  She is asking for a loan to pay the person who will make and install the gate.

Luisa is a single mother and has two children in her care who are in school.  She wants to make these improvements so that when she goes out to work her children will be safe and protected when she’s not home.

She will repay the loan with her salary that she earns working in a factory since she can use the child support she gets for her children to cover family and school expenses.

loans.use: to install a front gate.

loans.name: Delvina

texts.en:
Delvina is married with one child.  Delvina is 38 years old and lives in Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Delvina sells canned goods and other daily needs such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years.  Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase goods and other products.

Delvina has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  Delvina hopes to make her store bigger in the future.

loans.use: To purchase goods and other products like canned goods, soap, and other daily supplies.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel operates an electronic shops selling mobile phones and does repair.

He has been operating this business for the last five years with a monthly income of KES 5000. He was introduced to KADET by KADET staff.

This is his first loan of KES.40,000 which he plans to use to buy more stock, i.e., batteries and plugs. He hopes to make profit and re-invest into the business.

He is a hard-working man who struggles to achieve more.

loans.use: to buy more stock, i.e., batteries and plugs.

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es:
Milagro, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres y dos hermanos, ella se dedica al procesamiento y comercio de lácteos, lleva 4 años en este negocio el cual aprendió de su madre, su forma de trabajar es primeramente comprando la leche a ganaderos vecinos, ella se encarga de procesarla y vender los productos en su vivienda.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para comprarse leche en mayor cantidad, pues desea aumentar la producción de cuajada, quesos frescos, con esta ayuda del préstamo se hará realidad el proyecto de mejorar sus ventas y ganancias en el negocio.
Su objetivo es continuar creciendo con el negocio, ayudar a sus padres y poder en un futuro construir su propia casa y formar su familia.
texts.en:
Milagro is 25 years old and single.  She lives with her parents and her two brothers, and she works in processing and selling dairy products.  She has been in this business, which she learned from her mother, for four years.  The way she works is to first buy milk from neighboring cattle, she is responsible for processing it and sells the products from her home.

Currently she needs a loan to buy a greater quantity of milk, because she wants to increase her production of curd and fresh cheeses.  With the help of this loan she will be able to achieve her project of improving sales and profits in her business.

Her goal is to continue to grow the business, to help her parents and in the future, to build her own home and start a family.

loans.use: to buy milk so she can process it and sell dairy products.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Raw Fish Group

texts.en:
Regiana is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Regiana is 35 years old and was born in Kenema city. She is married to a tailor and the couple has two children. One of the children is in secondary school and one is in college. Regiana sells fresh fish and has been doing business for 22 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Regiana and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Regiana will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to buy cartons of fresh fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh fish

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Tha was born in 1960. She lives with her husband and two children. She and her husband are farmers. They not only grow rice but also, she raises pigs and sells vegetables in the market. Her family has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). Since 2006, she has joined in SEDA and always repaid loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resale.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima, a divorced mother of two boys and three girls, owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mwanalima has operated a food vending business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the business challenges of seasonality and competition from other food vendors in the area, and dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, Mwanalima wants to purchase sacks of cassavas, coconuts and utensils to be used in the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cassavas, coconuts and utensils to be used in the business.

loans.name: Evelia Francisca

texts.es: Evelia, de 40 años de edad, es originaria de León, esta casada, madre de 4 hijos todos ellos están estudiando el mayor de sus hijos estudia su cuarto año en la universidad el estudia matemáticas, de oficio comerciante, tiene una pulpería donde vende frutas, verduras, gaseosas y granos básicos, su nivel académico es básico solo termino el 4 grado de primaria. Su primer negocio fue un comideria lo tuvo por 8 años, luego puso su pulpería que tiene 2 años de tenerla. Requiere el préstamo para compra de frutas, verduras, y granos básicos. Pues quiere surtir su pulpería de productos que le demandan sus clientes, hacerla mas popular para atraer clientela. En sus planes esta vender carne, pollo, embutidos que son productos que aun no vende .Su meta próxima es sacar adelante a sus hijos, pagarle sus estudios universitarios y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Evelia, 40, is from León.  She’s married and the mother of four children who are all in school.  Her oldest child is in the fourth year of university studying Mathematics.  She’s a merchant.  She has a grocery store where she sells fruit, vegetables, soft-drinks and basic grains.  Her academic level is basic, she only completed fourth grade of elementary school.  Her first business was an eatery; she had it for 8 years.  Then she opened a grocery store that she’s had for two years now.  

She needs the loan to buy fruit, vegetables and basic grains because she wants to stock her store with the products her customers request to make it more popular and attract customers.  In her plans is meat, chicken and cured meat sales:  all products she still does not sell.  Her next goal is to move her children forward, to pay their university studies and to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables and basic grains.

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en:
Ochirbat is 31 years old, married, and has two children.  They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.. He is a taxi driver who tries to work hard. He started his business in 2007 and has been able to buy a small plot of land in his living district with his earnings. His taxi business is the main source of income for his family. 

Orchirbat's car is very old and dangerous to use. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts to renovate his taxi.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi renovation.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru:
Фирдавс  20 лет уже занимается продажей промышленных товаров (радиоаппаратура).
Приобретением другой прибыли в семье ему помогает отец. Он сварщик в месяц зарабатывает от 700 до 810 сомони. Фирдавс женат имеет 3 детей, также с ним проживают его родители. Фирдавс честный, трудолюбивый человек в месяц он получает от 1800 до 1900 сомони. Он хочет разнообразить ассортимент товара и тем самым расширить бизнес и для этого  хочет получить займ. Фирдавс заранее благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Firdavs has been involved in selling industrial products (radio equipment) for 20 years.  His father helps him to obtain additional profits for the family.  He is a welder and earns from 700 to 810 somoni per month.  Firdavs is married and has three children, and his parents live with him as well.  Firdavs is an honest and hard-working person and earns from 1800 to 1900 somoni per month.  He wants to expand the assortment of his merchandise and thus, expand his business, and wants to obtain a loan for this purpose.  Firdavs thanks you for the support.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a father of 7 adult children. He is aged 61 and has been in farming for the last 15 years producing and selling carrots, cabbage, potatoes, and milk all of which are sold at the local market. He operates a retail shop for additional income.

Elijah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase both a water tank and water pipes for an irrigation system. He says the loan will earn him income that will help improve his family's living standards. He adds that his focus is to purchase more land to expand his farming business. However, he is lamenting on the high cost of feeds.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank and water pipes for an irrigation system

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgé(e) de 55 ans. Elle est veuve avec 02 enfants en charge qui vont tous à l’école. 
Le premier à 22 ans et le dernier a 15 ans.  
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse de céréales, tubercules et des charbons de bois depuis 2010. Elle vend dans une boutique.  Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la mévente.
Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales, des tubercules et des charbons de bois. Elle veut réinvestir plus dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait ajouter d’autres activités complémentaires. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit améliorer les conditions de vie da sa famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 55-year-old woman. She is a widow with two children to support. Both children go to school. The first-born is 22 years old, and the last is 15. Ablavi has been working as a retailer of grains, tubers, and charcoal since 2010. She makes her sales in a shop. At the moment, her main difficulty is a drop in sales. 

Ablavi has requested her first loan with WAGES to buy grain, tubers, and charcoal. She wants to reinvest more into her business. In the next few years, she would like to add complementary businesses. Ablavi says that, with the profits, she plans on improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grains, tubers, and sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 53 años es una mujer líder. Ella vive en compañía de Walter, su esposo desde hace 28 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Mabel y José a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Chilca. Es tesorera de su asociación, pues siempre gusto de administrar el dinero. Gracias a ello ahora tiene una ferretería, equipada y surtida. Según cuenta le va muy bien en su negocio; pues abre sus puertas todos lis días in descanso. Pero como ella es una mujer trabajadora, no solo se dedica a ello. También vende comida los domingos, en un espacio de su casa. También su esposo se dedica al alquiler de maquinarias pesadas a instituciones del estado y constructoras privadas las cuales le brindan un pago mensual, con ello paga los estudios universitarios de sus hijos:; a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. Ahora quieren ampliar su negocio de venta de cerveza al por mayor, pues hace poco incursionaron en ese negocio y quieren expandirlo, porque tiene muchas demanda. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este es el vigésimoquinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Yolanda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de agregados como: arena gruesa, fina y hormigón para su negocio.
texts.en:
53-year-old Yolanda is a leader.  She lives with Walter, her husband of 28 years.  The couple have two children, Mabel and José, who they care for in their own home, which is located in the city of Chilca.  Yolanda is the treasurer of her community bank as she has always enjoyed managing money.  Thanks to this, she now has a well-equipped and stocked hardware store.  She tells us that her business is doing very well as she opens its doors every day of the week without a rest.  However, as she is a hard-working woman, this isn't her only business.  She also sells food on Sundays, from a space in her home.  In addition, her husband hires out heavy machinery to state institutions and private builders and receives monthly payment for this.  They use this money to pay for their children's university education as they would like to provide them with a good education.  Now they would like to expand their business selling beer wholesale as they recently started out in this new business and would like to expand it as there is high demand.

Yolanda is a member of the IDME community bank and this is her 25th loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time.  She enjoys belonging to her community bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Yolanda will invest the money she has requested in buying aggregates such as coarse sand, fine sand and concrete for her business.

loans.use: to buy coarse sand, fine sand and concrete

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up a 16-year-old daughter who studies at school. In order to earn money to live, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. By selling some part of the harvest and reselling livestock after fattening, the family earns money to meet their daily needs. With money received from the loan, Gulmira wants to purchase livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she plans to start repairing their house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kathy Gioconda

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo (Portoviejo) se reúne el Banco Comunal San José De Sucre, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes naturales y hermosos, por su gastronomía típica del lugar y por su gente trabajadora y honesta dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Katty, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 16, 14 y 6 años, la mayor estudia en universidad y los menores en  colegio y  escuela. El marido es maestro en un colegio de la localidad. 

Ella  además de ser una gran ama de casa se dedica al comercio, tiene  un negocio de venta de carteras y productos Sayson (productos de belleza, perfumería y bisutería). Trabaja todos los días y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también su hija le ayuda en las ventas en el lugar donde estudia, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva en este negocio por más de un año y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y carteras. Está en el Banco Comunal cuatro ciclos y  le gusta  por la ayuda que le han dado con los créditos.
 
Ella está repitiendo el crédito y es para comprar más productos y aprovechar la temporada de navidad que se vende bastante, los créditos a ella le sirven de mucho ya que muchas veces no ha tenido capital para seguir y los créditos siempre que llegan le sirven para continuar en su negocio, esto ayuda también en su situación familiar ya que con lo que ha ganado a podido poco a poco ir arreglando su hogar y  a darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
