The 24th of May village is where the San José community bank meets. This area is known for its natural and beautiful scenery, for its traditional gastronomy, and for its hard-working and honest residents that primarily dedicate themselves to farming and raising animals.
 
This is where Katty lives.  She is 38 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has 4 children ages 17, 16, 14 and 6.  The eldest studies at the university and the younger children are in school.  Her husband is a teacher at the local school. 

In addition to being a great homemaker she also works in commerce.  She has a business selling wallets and Sayson products (beauty products, perfumes, and costume jewelry).  She works everyday doing door to door sales. Also, her daughter helps with sales where she goes to school. She delivers her products on credit and charges every 15 days.  She has done this business for more than a year and it is going quite well. 

This loan is going to help her to buy perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams and wallets. She has been in the community bank through four cycles and she likes the help that the loans have given her.
 
She is requesting another loan to buy more products and take advantage of the holiday season when she sells quite well. The loans have helped her very much since often she has not had the capital and the loans have helped her to continue in her business. 

The loan helps her also in her family situation because with her earnings she has been gradually fixing up her home, and she can provide a better education for her children. 

Her goal is to continue advancing her business.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, cosmetics, creams, costume jewelry and wallets.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen tiene 53 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora sus ganas de salir adelante le han proporcionado el alimento diario a su hogar. El motivo del crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de calzado, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, sabanas, entre otros productos la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le están solicitando una variedad de utilidades, pues desde muy joven ha tenido que trabajar para mantener a su familia.
texts.en: María Del Carmen is 53 years old. Her business is selling general merchandise. She is a very enterprising woman, and her desire to get ahead has allowed her to provide the daily bread for her household. The aim of the loan she is requesting is to buy shoes, perfumes, creams, treatments, and sheets, among other products. Most of her customers are always asking her for a variety of useful products. Since she was very young, she has had to work to support her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfumes, creams, treatments, sheets, and other products.

loans.name: Lina Eulalia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lina, ella tiene  49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cinco hijos todos ellos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes a comprar sus productos. Trabaja todos los días,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra en dos partes. Su mercadería  la compra en Manta o en   Guayaquil cuando puede. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal 3 años y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener buena salud y que su esposo y sus hijos siempre tengan buena pesca.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Mar” communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful San Mateo spa in San Mateo, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are well visited year round by national and foreign tourists.  Most of the residents of this area are fishermen and work on other tasks on the sea.

Here we meet Lina.  She’s 49 years old, married and has five adult children.  Her husband is a fisherman.

She sells clothing of all types, door to door, in order to earn some income on her own and help with the household expenses.  She also sells from her home, where customers go to buy from her.  She works every day and sells on credit, collecting in two parts.  She buys her merchandise in Manta or Guayaquil as she’s able.  She’s been doing this for three years and things are going well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and she likes it because she was able to start her business with her first loan.

Her dreams are for good health and for her husband and sons to have good catches (fish).

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia Maria Elena se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de sombrillas y banquitos,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perfumes,lapiz labiales,cremas entre otros productos de belleza,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos. La socia solicita el credito para comprar sombrillas y banquitos y tambien apara comprar productos de belleza como cremas,perfumes y lapiz labiales al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Maria Elena sells umbrellas and folding stools. She also sells beauty products, such as perfumes, lipsticks, creams and other items. By means of this business, she is raising her children. 

Her dream is to have her own shop where she can sell her products. She is applying for the loan in order to buy umbrellas and folding stools, and also to buy beauty products, such as creams, perfumes, and lipsticks at wholesale. 

She is happy about the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy umbrellas and folding stools, as well as beauty products such as creams, perfumes, and lipsticks at wholesale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: La señora Angelina tiene 52 años y tiene dos hijos por los que trabaja fuertemente con su esposo. Se dedica a la producción y venta de arepas, actividad que hace en su casa desde el momento en que su esposo se quedó sin empleo y necesitaban una fuente de dinero para poder sostener con los gastos del hogar. Actualmente la señora Angelina ha visto como han crecido sus ventas, por lo que necesita remodelar su cocina para poder producir los pedidos que le hacen, además, de que se encuentra en un sitio donde puede haber contaminantes para su producto. Angelina sueña con que su negocio crezca de manera que pueda abrir un punto de venta y no lo tenga que producir desde su casa, y que le mejore sus ingresos con lo que pueda brindarles a sus hijos la educación que necesitan.
texts.en:
Angelina, 52, has two children that she works hard for with her husband.  She makes arepas [traditional corn griddle cake] to sell, an activity she currently does at home since her husband lost his job and they needed a source of income to cover household expenses.

Angelina has noticed how her sales have increased so she needs to remodel her kitchen so that she can fill the orders she gets.  Besides, it’s currently situated in a position where contaminants could affect her products.

Angelina dreams with her business’ growth to such an extent that she can open a sales point and not have to produce at home and that her income improves so that she can provide her children with the education they need.

loans.use: to build a new kitchen.

loans.name: Carmen Trinidad

texts.es: Carmen Trinidad es una emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de leña y frijoles en la localidad donde habita. Carmen trinidad tiene 59 años de edad este negocio nace de la necesidad de generar ingreso, ella tiene hijos mayores que ya no están con ella pero le ayudan económicamente. Carmen Trinidad está solicitando crédito para comprar capital trabajo como leña y frijoles.
texts.en: Carmen Trinidad is a businesswoman who sells firewood and beans in the town where she lives.  Carmen Trinidad is 59 years old, and her business was born out of the need to generate income.  She has grown children who are not still with her, but they help her financially.  Carmen Trinidad is requesting a loan to use as working capital, so that she can buy firewood and beans.

loans.use: to buy firewood and beans

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 14 years to 20 years. She describes herself as a strong, optimistic and courageous woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruit. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of permanent business premises to operate her business from. 

Margaret will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase chicken, tomatoes and vegetables for her green grocery. Her business goal is to improve her business  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a plot of land for her family and build a house. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, tomatoes and vegetables for her greengrocery.

loans.name: Éternel Est Berger Group

texts.fr: ÉTERNEL EST BERGER est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Houndji Julie(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 52 ans. Houndji Julie est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Pierre. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et quatre à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Houndji Julie et son mari. Pour cette raison, Houndji Julie vend des conserves, des pâtes alimentaires et des savons depuis une trentaine d'année. Parallèlement à son activité, Houndji Julie vend également des savons ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Houndji Julie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Houndji Julie sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe ÉTERNEL EST BERGER, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des pâtes alimentaires, des conserves et des savons.

loans.name: Salomon

texts.fr: Salomon âgé de 58 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école mais a appris la couture, activité qu'il exerce depuis trente ans à son domicile. Salomon est marié à une marchande du nom de Patience et est père de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et a sa charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Salomon vend également des bois de chauffage et des boissons de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Salomon achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Salomon pour une cinquième fois sollicite, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des fournitures de couture et des bois de chauffage.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr:
Florentine est une paysanne dynamique de 33 ans. Elle vit avec son mari et ses 4 enfants à la campagne. Elle exerce toute sorte de culture et d’élevage, en plus de cela, elle tient un petit commerce à son domicile depuis 5 ans.
Florentine a déjà pris plusieurs prêts auparavant dont les bénéfices servaient à renforcer l’élevage et à la scolarisation des enfants. Ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter une vache laitière ainsi que les légumes à vendre dans son petit commerce.
Son rêve est d’avoir un grand élevage de vaches laitières, ce qui permettra à offrir un bel avenir aux enfants.
texts.en: Florentine is an energetic 33-year old farmer. She lives with her husband and four children in the countryside. She grows many types of produce and raises livestock. In addition, she has been running a small store out of her home for five years. Florentine already obtained several prior loans and was able to bolster her livestock business and pay for her children's schooling. This new loan will allow her to buy a dairy cow as well as vegetables to resell in her small store. Her dream is to have a large dairy farm, which would allow her to secure her children's future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Şükran

texts.en:
Şükran is married and a mother of two.  At home she is knitting, embroiding scarfs, selling them and making money.  She is using her third loan. With the help of the loans she bought bulks of threads and scarfs.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Şükran hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Evde örgü örüyor ve yazma oyalıyor ve yaptığı işleri satarak para kazanıyor.  3. Kredisini kullana Şükran Hanım kredileri ile toptan yün ve yazma aldı.

loans.use: to buy thread and scarves

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Ordonez is 33-years old and she lives in Merida, Yucatan. She is mother to a five-year old girl. She was still in school when her daughter was born and so she was unable to finish her studies. Her situation as a single Mom forced her to look for a way to earn some money to provide for her daughter. For this reason she started to sell clothing in the market, although at first she started selling to neighbours and family. It\'s just over five years now since Elizabeth started her business, with the welfare of her daughter as her motivation.

To increase her sales, she requires a loan of $250 dollars which will be put towards the purchase of clothing wholesale, a loan which will be repaid within three months. Please help Elizabeth and her baby girl - they will thank you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth O. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la localidad de Mérida, Yucatán. Es madre de una niña de 5 años. Ella se encontraba realizando sus estudios cuando nació su hija, esto impidió que pudiera continuar sus estudios, pues su situación de madre soltera le obligaba a buscar una actividad para percibir ingresos y proveer de lo necesario a su hija. Por ello ella decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa en los tianguis, aunque primero comenzó entre vecinos y familiares. Ya son poco más de cinco años de que Elizabeth emprendió su proyecto, movida por el bienestar de su pequeña.

Para poder incrementar las ventas, ella requiere un préstamo de $ 250.00 dólares, mismo que será destinado para la compra de ropa en mayoreo y cubierto en un plazo de 3 meses. Ayuda a Elizabeth y su pequeña, ellas te lo agrdecederan

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa has 6 years of experience in this business.
He has transported  grass with a car, which is rented by him.
The first time he borrowed $600 and bought 4 wheels.
The second time he borrowed $800 and repaired the car. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy this car.
Isa is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region , settled in  Fizuli region, Kayidish village. He is married and has a child.

loans.use: To buy a car which he now rents.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma has a business of selling household products. She works from her home and sells products door-to-door. She started her business with $150 she saved from her previous job as a domestic worker.

At first, she would only offer her products to her neighbors. Slowly, she ventured into new markets. She is now fairly popular in other areas that are not near her home. She is requesting the loan so that she may increase her inventory and offer her clients new products.

Irma has one son who is in school, whom she supports fully. She and her family live in house made of wood. Her neighbors confirm that Irma and her family are positive influences in the community.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Libia has been running her beauty salon for 2 years. Before becoming involved in this type of work, she was a seamstress who knitted bags and purses. After finding a job as an assistant in a beauty salon, she stopped her work as a seamstress. Today she runs her own beauty salon, which she took over from a sister-in-law who moved to the US. The business is a supplementary source of income in her household of 2 children. Her husband is a taxi driver.

She received a loan several months ago which she used to buy a manicurist's table and a foot massager for pedicures. These tools helped her provide improved services to the clients. She also began selling cosmetics and other products. She will use a second loan to buy a glass case to display these products to her clients.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics and other complimentary products for her store, as well as a glass display case for her products

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is the mother of two children and a widow. At twenty-eight years of age, she started her business five years ago, after she lost her husband.  She is engaged in the selling of African print materials and plastic sandals.  Her previous loan from SMT increased her stock but, being the sole breadwinner, she needs still more capital to expand her business in order to generate more income from it.  She is requesting a loan of US$ 200.

loans.use: Expand her working capital to get more profits from her business

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula is 60 and a widow who pulls together to keep her family of two sons going. However, they decided to forgo their studies and work to support the three of themselves together. Paula runs a hamburger stand in the evenings and sells tacos in the mornings. Her older son has a fruit stand. This is how they make money to live.

However, the business is not suited to sell fruits. They also need to make food. For these reasons, Paula is seeking a loan of $300 that will be repaid with her sons' help over the course of 4 months. The loan will be used to buy display cases or stands to place the fruit they sell as well as benches for their customers for a moment's rest. With your help, Paula and her sons will be able to move ahead and recover from their terrible loss of their father and husband who always watches over them.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Paula a sus 60 años quedó viuda con la responsabilidad de sacar a sus dos hijos adelante, sin embargo ellos decidieron dejar de estudiar y ponerse a trabajar para poder salir adelante los tres juntos. La señora tiene un puesto de hamburguesas por las noches y en las mañanas vende tacos de harina y su hijo el mayor tiene un puesto de frutas. Y así es como sacan dinero para poder mantener los gastos del hogar.

Sin embargo, el negocio no está adecuado para tener las frutas y lo necesario para hacer las comidas, es por eso que Paula está solicitando un crédito de US $300 que está dispuesta a pagarlo con la ayuda de sus hijos en un plazo de 4 meses y con ese dinero Paula y sus hijos podrán comprar vitrinas para poder poner la fruta que venden y bancos para que la gente que va a comprar tenga un lugar dónde sentarse. Con tu ayuda Paula y sus hijos podrán salir adelante y recuperarse de la terrible pérdida del Padre y Esposo que siempre veló por ellos.

loans.use: to buy display stands and benches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Salon renovation and purchase of beauty products.

loans.name: Ntawo A (V) Group

texts.en:
Edith is married with six children. She grows fruits and vegetables for sale. With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for the children.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to rent more land for cultivation.

loans.name: Celita

texts.en:
Celita, a forty year old woman and mother of seven children, sells an assortment of perfumes, deodorants, hand and body lotion, and men's and women’s clothing, in the Mata San Juan community of Santo Domingo. She operates her business predominantly in her house, but also she visits people in the neighborhood to sell her products.

This entrepreneur plans to use her loan to add new products to her inventory. She will buy new brands of perfumes and deodorants to attract new customers and increase her income. Celita’s business is the main source of income of the family.

loans.use: To purchase goods to restock a small business.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
I am Irshad K. from Chichawatni, a small town in Pakistan. I live in a rented house here in Chichawatni with my seven children: six boys and one girl. I make artificial flower bouquets, which my son sells at various markets in the city.

There are four other women in my loan group. All of these women live near me and I know them very well. Asiah B. is borrowing to buy wood. Jameela B. needs her share of loan for her husband’s auto workshop. Anila B. is borrowing for her family’s snack stall. Haneefa B. makes and sells mats.

This is a group loan and the funds will be distributed among the group members. Each member will invest her loan in her own or in her family's business.

loans.use: Expand flower-making business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is fifty years old and a mother of four children. She is married and has two grandchildren. She prepares and sells local dishes, such as fufu, rice balls, banku, rice, and ampesie, in the family house for the nine years.

Elizabeth wants to use her loan to buy soft drinks and foods like plantain, fresh yams, bags of rice, and vegetables, to cook for school children and her dear customers in Ajumako.

She is a member of the group called Tree of Life. Members of the group exert peer pressure as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Elizabeth is dishing out food.

loans.use: To buy more foods like cassava, plantain, cocoyam, fresh yams, and bags of rice.

loans.name: Emma Aurora

texts.es:
Emma belongs to the “Mujeres Talentosas” (Talented Women) community bank, located in market No. 2 of the Calleria district, in Ucayali. She is 49 years old, has 2 children and is separated. With the first loan of S/. 300 received from Manuela Ramos, Emma decided to invest it for the small sale of regional fruits and vegetables.

Now she has a sales stand in market No. 2 in our city, she gets up very early to go to her sales stand, because her clients start going early to buy her products, in the evenings she stays home with her children.

With this loan of S/. 2,000, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy regional fruits like: papaya, orange, tangerine, bread fruit, corn, coriander, bananas, etc.

Emma feels great now that she has her own capital to work with and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Mercado N° 2, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años, es madre de 2 hijos, es separada. Emma con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de frutas y verduras regionales.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado N° 2 de nuestra ciudad, se levanta muy temprano para ir a su puesto, ya que sus caseros acuden desde tempranas horas a comprar sus productos, en las tardes se dedica a su hogar y sus hijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará frutas regionales, como: papaya, naranja, mandarina, pan de árbol, choclo, culantro, plátanos, etc.

Emma se siente muy bien, ahora tiene su propio capital con el cual puede trabajar mas tranquila y puede sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her fruits and vegetables sales stand.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa is an active and enterprising woman. Despite her limited economic resources, she provides her two beloved children with their schooling, who have converted into the principle motivation for her to persevere in her business. She does various activities like selling American clothing, vegetable, quinua juice, and currently hot chocolate as an ambulatory vendor. For his part, her hardworking husband Alberto provides cellular services to the town of Juliaqueña by his means of transportation, his tricycle. This diligent mother counts on your indispensable support that will permit her to invest in her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Tomasa, es una mujer activa y emprendedora, pese a sus bajos recursos económicos viene brindándoles sus respectivos estudios a sus dos queridos hijos, quienes se convirtieron en el principal motor que la impulsa a perseverar en sus negocios.Se dedica a innumerables actividades tales como: la venta de ropa americana, verduras, jugo de quinua y actualmente venta de chocolate caliente en forma ambulatoria, por su parte su laborioso esposo Alberto brinda servicios de movilidad a la población Juliaqueña en su herramienta de transporte, su triciclo.Esta diligente madre desea contar con tu apoyo, indispensable ayuda que le permitirá invertir en su pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Investment of capital to improve the products she offers

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis L. lives in the neighbourhood La Fuente in the city of Managua. He has worked as a business administrator for 9 years, and this job has allowed him to support his family and raise his kids, one of which now lives away from home.

Luis' wife is in sales, and helps him with the household costs. Luis wants to improve the living conditions of their home, and he would like a loan to buy construction materials to build a wall for their house as this will give them more security and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Don Luis L. habita en el barrio La Fuente, de la ciudad de Managua. Don Luis L. trabaja como administrador de empresas, desde hace 9 años, trabajo que le ha permitido sustentar a su familia y poder formar a uno de sus hijos que ya es independiente a él. La esposa de Luis trabaja como comerciante y lo apoya en los gastos del hogar. Don Luis desea mejorar su casa de habitación, por lo que solicita un crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en su vivienda y así poder darles mejor condición de vida y también seguridad a su familia.

loans.use: To build a wall for family security/Construcción de muro para asegurar a su familia

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina baji is the wife of Muhammad Aslam, who operates a scrap business. She lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan, where she owns a four-room house. Rubina baji is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter, all of whom are in school. More specifically, her oldest son is in 10th standard; her next oldest is in 9th standard; her next oldest son is in 7th standard; and her youngest son and only daughter are in kindergarten.

Rubina baji is a housewife, and she notes that she prefers to do work around the house. Meanwhile, Rubina baji’s husband has been in the scrap business for the last 18 years. Notably, Rubina baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan in order to buy more scrap (e.g., empty medicine bottles, plastic bottles, etc.) to expand her husband's business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her husband's scrap business by purchasing additional scrap

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación Sur, tiene 32 años, es casada,  su esposo es odontólogo y trabaja en una clínica, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 15 años de edad que están cursando la primaria, Victoria es maestra de primaria tiene cuatro años de trabajar en un instituto, anteriormente trabajaba dando clases en un CDI, ella todavía está estudiando la licenciatura en pedagogía, desea llegar a realizarse como persona y como mujer tanto a nivel personal como profesional. Es por eso que está invirtiendo en la mejora de su vivienda, para darle una mejor vida y más comodidad a su familia. Con la solicitud del préstamo comprará materiales de construcción para hacer un muro en la parte delantera de su vivienda y darle más seguridad. Ya que en el día sus dos hijos se encuentran solos y desea protegerlos de la delincuencia que hay en el barrio.
texts.en:
Vicgtoria lives in the Villa Reconciliacion Sur neighborhood, she is 32 years old and she is married. Her husband is a dentist and he is employed at a clinic. They have two children who are 13 and 15-years old who are in elementary school. Victoria is a elementary school teacher, she has been employed at the same Institute for four years. Previously she was teaching at a CDI school. She is still studying Pedagogy. She wants to be fulfill as a woman and as a human being at the personal level and as well as the professionally.

For this reason she is investing to improve her house to be able to provide a better life and comfort to her family. With the loan she will buy construction materials to build o a wall in the front part of her house in order to be more safe, since during the day her two children are are alone and she wants to protect them from the crime present in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall in the front of her house.

loans.name: M'tenda

texts.fr:
Née le 30 mai 1968 à Dapaong dans la préfecture de Tône au nord du Togo, dame N. M’tenda est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Son mari qui vit actuellement en France ne lui apporte pas de l’aide régulièrement donc elle est obligée de se battre beaucoup pour pouvoir payer les frais de scolarité de ses deux enfants.
Elle a pour activité la vente du haricot et du maïs dans le marché d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle a commencé par exercer ce commerce de céréales depuis 1993 et est très expérimentée.
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 15 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de mil et 2 sacs de sorgho. Ainsi avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Born on May 30, 1968 in Dapaong, in Tône Prefecture in the north of Togo, Ms. M'tenda N. is married and the mother of two. Her husband, who currently lives in France, doesn't send assistance on a regular basis, so she must struggle a great deal to be able to pay the school fees for her two children. Her business involves selling beans and corn in the Agoè marketplace in Lomé. She began trading in grains in 1993 and is highly experienced. This initial loan that she is requesting will enable her to buy 15 sacks of corn, 3 sacks of millet, and 2 sacks of sorghum. With this new stock, she will thus be able to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain (corn, sorghum, millet)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Navy K. is a villager in Preak Roka village in Kandal Province. She is 27 years old and the mother of child who is attending the local school. She is a tailor and her husband, Mr. Om Sokdoen, is a farmer who owns a plot of land for cultivating rice. In addition, he is a motorbike driver. With their current income, they barely make ends meet. Thus, Mrs. Navy K. requests a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and improve their standard of living with this loan. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a 39 year old business woman. She is married with two kids who are currently in school. She has been a seamstress for seven years. She sews all forms of female clothes with various kinds of styles that suit the tastes of her customers like kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes, etc. She also sells food stuffs to support her family with additional income. With the loan, she wants to buy more supplies for sewing like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to double her savings to provide her children with quality educations. She is a member of the community group called “Nnown” (meaning, song) Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Marta Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Marta Tomasa H. A. tiene 51 años de edad, pertenece al Grupo Solidario Azucenas de Villa Hermosa y vive en el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió hasta tercer año de primaria, pero no continuó estudiando debido a que sus padres tenían la  creencia, que si las niñas aprendían a leer y escribir serviría para escribir cartas de amor a los varones. Se casó a los 24 años y tuvo 8 hijos de los cuales viven 6, cuatro varones y dos mujeres, dependen de ella 5. Enviudó a la edad de 48 años.
Su negocio consiste en cria y venta de animales pequeños como patos, cuyes, gallinas y también vende quesillo que le traen de la sierra.
El primer crédito fue de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invirtió en comida para animales y compra de animales.
Con este crédito de S/. 300, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertirá en animales y pedido de quesillo.
Marta sueña con ver profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta Tomasa H. A. is 51 years old and belongs to the Azucenas de Villa Hermosa community group. She lives in the Huanchaco district of Trujillo province in La Libertad department. Marta attended school through third grade, but quit school because her parents believed that if young girls learnt to read and write, they would write love letters to boys. Marta married when she was 24 years old and has eight children, six of whom are still living—four boys and two girls. Five of them are her dependents. She became a widow at age 48. Marta breeds and sells small animals like ducks, guinea pigs and chickens. She also sells cheese, which is delivered to her from the mountains. She successfully paid back her first loan of $100 (300 Peruvian nuevos soles) in four payments. She invested that money in the purchase of animals and animal feed. She will invest this loan of $100, which will likewise be repaid in four payments, in animals and cheese. Marta dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of animals and cheese

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia P. is 32 years old. She is divorced and has one child. She is divorced because her husband used to beat her.  Her son is 14 years old, and he is now in the first year in the junior high school. 

She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skim powdered milk and biscuits in her neighborhood at Apatrapa, a suburb of Kumasi. She lives in a typical Ghanaian home where there are lots of occupants. Such houses are called compound houses and there is no privacy.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and more to increase her inventory. She hopes to grow her savings to support her son in school. She believes with her five years of experience she would be able to make good use of the loan.
 
Afia belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwenpa’ which means "good mind". She hopes to receive GH500 to stock her inventory. This would enable her to save more in taking care of the household.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, etc.

loans.name: Alberto Alonso

texts.es: El Sr., Alberto es un hombre  bien trabajador, pues tiene dos trabajo es taxista y soldador desde hace veinte años,  el cual con ahorros compro las herramientas, y el taxi por medio de financiamiento, tiene 48 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación, su esposa es ama de casa y con dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad que cursan la secundaria. Con este crédito es el séptimo que quiere para dar mantenimiento a su vehiculo para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con estos créditos que Afodenic ha otorgado han sido de muchos beneficios para su vida personal, como en su trabajo para salir adelante con los negocios. Sus metas es comprar otra unidad de taxi, y poder dar estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Alberto is a hard working man. He has worked as a taxi driver and a welder for 20 years, using his savings to buy hardware and to help finance his taxi. He is 48 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliación. His wife is a house wife and his 15 and 17 year-old children are in high school. This loan, his seventh, will be used for maintenance on his vehicle in order to provide better service to his customers. The loans that he has received from Afodenic have benefited him personally as well as helped his business to grow. His goal is to purchase another taxi, and to educate his daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Deborah Delzell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Chhao

texts.en:
L. is 49 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She has four children: One is married and lives separately, two are local construction workers, and the last one is attending school. L. is a widow. She sells Khmer noodles to the commune.

She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. She earns a good profit from her business because she is good at cooking Khmer noodle cuisine. She uses her old traditional equipment to make Khmer noodles, but it's broken very often. So L. is applying for a loan of $100 to buy new traditional equipment to make Khmer noodles for her business. She dreams of a big house and a degree for her child.

loans.use: To buy new traditional equipment to make Khmer noodles

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a widow who has five children. When she was asked her age, she smiled and said around 60 years. “When we where born they never recorded it,” she says.

Rachel sells provisions and drinks in her house. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. Rachel thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Olubisi

texts.en: Olubisi O. is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She produces and sells orange drinks. The demand for her orange drinks is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase one deep freezer. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase one deep freezer

loans.name: Aluka Riekotho Agness Group

texts.en: Mrs. R. Agness is widowed, aged 35 years, and has 4 kids - 2 boys and 2 girls – who are all in school. She also has 3 additional dependants. She has been selling silver fish (known as Omena) and samosas for over 15 years. R. Agness will use the loan to purchase more silver fish, wheat flour and peas for making samosas. Her dream is to educate her children and to construct a house and increase her farm productivity.

loans.use: To purchase more silver fish (omena), wheat flour and peas for making samosas.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: marie F. est une jeune femme née en 1969 à thies ;elle est célibataire et habite chez ses parents au quartier diakhao;elle est enseignante de profession mais souffre d'une maladie des articulations qui nécessite des soins intensifs ;c'est donc pour se faire soigner qu'elle a ouvert un compte et a demandé ce pret.
texts.en:
Marie F. is a young woman who was born in 1969 in Thies. She is unmarried and lives at her parent’s place in the Diakhao district. She is a teacher by profession but suffers from an illness of the joints that requires intensive treatment. So, to care for herself, she opened an account and asked for a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
To make a living, Chita O.'s husband works as a fisherman. Every morning, Chita has to go to the seashore to help her husband weigh the caught fish and sell them immediately to their regular fish buyer. She is 41 years old and has two school-age children. They are from the town of Opol, Misamis Oriental.

In 2009, Chita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve their living conditions. Chita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishnet and other aids for her husband's fishing activity. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve their house, planning to rent it to supplement the family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishnet and other aids for fishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fix up his premises

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar is 26 years old. She is single and has three children who are all in school. She trades in maize in the local market of Sefwi, a town in the western region of Ghana. She takes stock from the surrounding villages and supply to her customers. 

Her major difficulty has to with funds to support the business. She requests for a loan to enable her to buy maize in bulk to grow her business and scale up sales. With her four years experience in trade, she hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education and to give them a better future and improved career opportunities.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of maize.

loans.name: Melecia

texts.en:
Melecia is from the busy town of Angono, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is determined to remove her family from the darkness brought by poverty. She is widowed and has two children to take care of.
With her desire to earn an income through a business, in 1999 she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Her loans were used as capital for her Sari-sari store (General Store). She is one of the outstanding members of ASHI . As her business is properly managed, it brings her enough income to sustain the needs of her family.
She is now excited to receive her loan of 25,000 pesos as additional capital for her Store. Specifically, the amount will be used to pay for cases of soft drinks, beverages, liquors, canned goods, and groceries. She is hopeful that she can earn more and save for the future of her children, and be able to send them to school until they finish college and find jobs. She also aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for cases of soft drinks, beverages, liquors, canned goods, and groceries for her store

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly P. runs a food stall selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 40 years old, married and has seven school-age children. They are from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. Merly has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Merly is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional foods to sell

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 43 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 3 hijos y estudio primaria incompleta, vive en el sector Urani Marca Kollo. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles  para la compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1300.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de papas, chuño, ocas, quinua, etc. Para venderlo en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan las reuniones,  y las charlas.

loans.use: Para la compra de papas, chuño, ocas, quinua, etc.

loans.name: Oidov

texts.en:
Oidov is a 25-year-old young lady who lives with her husband and two children. Her two children are both still very young and they both go to kindergarden. The family lives in their own ger (nomadic housing tent) in Arkhangai province, Mongolia.

Oidov has had her own business selling meat and meat products since 2002. Her working capital was 20,000 tugrug (~15 USD) at first, but now it exceeds 120,000 tugrug (~90 USD). Her husband helps in generating their famliy income by selling firewood.

Oidov’s ultimate goal for now is to increase her meat sales and to have her own work place in which to sell her products. She says: "I work hard to better my children's lives. All the money I earn will be spent on my children’s education."

Oidov is requesting a 200,000 tugrug to purchase more meat and meat products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more meat and meat products to sell

loans.name: Les

texts.en: K. is an older woman, 59 years old, and is the widowed mother of one son. Her son is newly married with a child. K. currently lives with her son, daughter-in-low, and grandchild, in Phnom Penh. K. depends on the income comes from her son’s business; he is construction foreman who employees to provide his service. To make additional income for family, K. hopes to run a suitable business but she lacks capital to begin the process. Thus, she would like a loan for capital to buy chicken in bulk from rural people and then retails them at the market. K. was not available for photographing, so her son, daughter-in-low, and grandchild are shown instead.

loans.use: To buy chicken in bulk from rural people to retail them at the market

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouman est constitué de huit femmes (4 veuves et 4 mariées)  vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 61 ans,  4 enfants  et habitant  le quartier Djaka (Kirango) de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali : Ségou). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage, de voisinage et font presque la même activité génératrice de revenus qui tourne autour du poisson sous toutes ses formes. 
Ce groupe est également organisé en  coopérative de transformatrices de poissons initiée par l’ANPE (Agence Nationale pour L’Emploi). Elles ont reçu des formations portant sur les différentes méthodes de transformation et de conservation dans les mesures d’hygiène retenues par le  BIT (Bureau International du Travail). Elles ont bénéficié de  deux fours modernes et des séchoirs.
Après  4 prêts solidaires tous bien remboursés, ce groupe est à son 5ème  prêt qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 80 paniers de poisson et 100 barres de glace. Elles s’approvisionnent  en poissons frais sur place au bord du fleuve Niger, elles les trient d’abord, une bonne partie de ce poisson est séchée. Le poisson frais se vend sur place, à Ségou ville (marché château), à Bamako,  Koutiala et Sikasso. Le poisson séché est surtout vendu à Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango et à Ségou et une partie est conservée jusqu’à la décrue où elles gagnent plus d’argent.  Le poisson fumé est essentiellement vendu à Ségou. Les ventes se font généralement au comptant  et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 80.000 FCFA qui servira à augmenter le volume de leurs activités, à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux (habillements, savon, pétrole) et à participer aux évènements sociaux (baptême, mariage, circoncision et décès). 
Elles ont pour ambition une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouman group is made up of eight women (4 are widows and 4 are married). They live in large traditional families and they average 61 years of age and 4 children. They live in the Djaka (Kirango) district of Markala (the 4th administrative region of Mali: Segou). They know each other through family, marriage, and through neighbours. They carry out the same business to generate revenues, all surrounding fish and in all forms.

The group was organized through a fish processing cooperative started out by Anpe (National Employment Angecy). They have all received training on various hygiene techniques provided by BIT (International Work Bureau). They are have two modern ovens and dryers to their disposal.

After having successfully repaid 4 past loans, the group is requesting their 5th loan which is to be used to purchase 80 baskets of fish and 100 blocks of ice. They purchase fresh fish along the Niger River, sort them, and keep a good portion of them to be dried. The fresh fish is sold at Segou (in the Chateau market), Bamako, Koutiala, and Sikasso. The dried fish is mostly sold in Dougabougou, Siribala, Niono, Shango and Segou, though they keep a portion to sell in the fall when they can earn more money. Smoked fish is mostly sold in Segou. Sales are generally completed in cash and credit to a clientele made up of men and women.

They hope in producing a monthly revenue of 80 FCFA which will help increase the volume of their sales, and to satisfy the needs of their family (including clothing, soaps, and petroleum). They will also be able to participate in social events (baptisms, weddings, circumcisions, and funerals).

They dream of buying a residential home for themselves.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en:
T. Narzullo is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. Narzullo is a market vendor. He has been selling fruit for 9 years. For these years Narzullo has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruit so that it keeps its marketable condition and does not lose taste and useful properties. He sells fruit such as: apple, pear and pomegranate in the local market center. Narzullo buys vegetables and fruit from the local farmers. In the market, he is known among people because of the attractive prices and his friendly characteristics. This allows Narzullo’s business to generate stable and considerable income for his family. Due to the season, Narzullo’s now wants to purchase apples and bags for saving them. He will sell them later when the price will increase. Narzullo thanks everyone for supporting him. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of fruits for sale.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.en:
In 2008, thanks to the current General Director of Comité Renacer, Ms. Laura R., this women’s committee was formed.  She took the initiative, and went to the local credit counselor to find out how the Women's Entrepreneurship program worked.  She gathered 21 women and they have been working together ever since. 

The average loan per member is 685,000 Gs., used for different activities such as selling food, selling dry goods, selling goods for the pantry (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy, bakery, etc.), selling clothes, selling cosmetics, photocopies, blankets and quilts, plants and gardening supplies.  The women of the committee are all working together, helping each other to reach their common goals. 

It's a very supportive group, and they have worked hard to make sure they all repay their loans on time.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dios Proveera 1,2,3,5 Group

texts.en:

L.forL. L.yourL. L.supportL..

loans.use: Rice, pants, underwear and deodorant

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy and sell clothing and school supplies

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es:
El banco comunal Loma de la Cruz esta formado por un grupo de mujeres que buscan un mejor futuro para sus familias, y con el trabajo diario lo están consiguiendo poco a poco sintiéndose orgullosas por sus logros, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta es una ciudad que guarda los encantos de su centro histórico y también su combinación de tres culturas ricas en simbolismos, tradición y arte: Cañari, Inca y Española.

La Srta. Ana P. es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz, vive por el sector de Miraflores, tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres ayudando un poco en los gastos de la casa, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ana trabaja en un cyber café siendo su horario de  8 y 30 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. labora en este local 11 meses y le va bien, también labora en la venta de productos para el cuidado de la mujer como son los productos de Yanbal, retomando su negocio hace 3 meses ya que antes vendía los productos a sus amigas del colegio, nos comenta que le va bien por lo que sus clientas le pagan puntal, y también para este nuevo año se a propuesto la meta de retomar sus estudios, tiene se lleva bien con todas sus compañeras de la banca comunal, se encuentra 2 años realizando los prestamos en la fundación y le han ayudado para comprar los productos de Yanbal y para pagar los arriendos de su casa, y fue su mamá que le incentivo a que forme parte del bankito, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza lo va a invertir en la compra de productos Yanbal, como son perfumes, cadenas, maquillajes, etc., su meta es de llegar a ser doctora.
texts.en:
The Loma de Cruz communal bank is made up of a group women who seek a better future for their families. Through their daily work, they are reaching this goal and little by little feeling proud of their accomplishments. They live in the city of Cuenca which is a city noted for its charming historic downtown as well as its combination of three cultures rich in symbolism, tradition and art: Cañari, Inca and Spanish. Communal bank member Ana P., 20, lives in the Miraflores section of the city. She is single and lives with her parents, helping them meet household expenses; they do not own their home, they lease. Ana works in an Internet café from 8:30am until 7pm; she has worked there for 11 months and has done well. She also sells women's beauty products of the Yanbal brand. She began this work again 3 months ago; she had previously sold these products to her school friends. She tells us that she does well because her customers pay on time. Her goal for this new year is to start her studies again. She gets along well with all the other members of the communal bank. She has been managing her loans with the institution for 2 years now and they have helped her to buy Yanbal products and to help with the family rent payment. She was encouraged to join the communal bank by her mother. The new loan will be used to buy Yanbal products such as: perfumes, chains, make-up, etc. Her goal is to become a physician.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the same brand cosmetics like perfumes, make-up and costume jewelry

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 40 años, vive muy feliz en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Santos (45) y sus 2 hijos; Leslie (15) y Jorman (12).
Cada día brinda sus servicios de limpieza en diferentes casas de su localidad; pero desde hace 6 meses encontró un trabajo que le gusta mucho y que puede realizar en sus momentos libres.
Ella elabora todo tipo de accesorios para mujer de diversos modelos, como aretes, collares y pulseras con diferentes tipos de pedrería. Estos materiales los compra, al por mayor, y luego los selecciona con la ayuda de sus hijos, lo que le permite avanzar más rápido. 
En este negocio trabaja en sociedad con una amiga que se encarga de vender la mercadería terminada. Ambas actividades le brindas las ganancias necesarias, que junto con lo ganado por su esposo, les permite solventar los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. 
Para el futuro, Carmen quiere empezar a vender sus accesorios independientemente, ya que calcula que así obtendría mayores ganancias.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser responsable en cada cuota, ya que tiene en mente acceder a otros créditos. Carmen tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de más cantidad de material para seguir elaborando sus accesorios y así empezar a independizarse.
texts.en:
Carmen, 40, lives happily in her own home with her husband, Santos (45), and her two children, Leslie (15) and Jorman (12). She works daily as a cleaning lady in various homes in the area but six months ago she found an occupation that she likes a lot and that she can do in her spare time. She makes all kinds of accessories for women like: earrings, necklaces and bracelets. She makes them with various kinds of stones which she buys at wholesale. Her children then help her sort them, which allows her to move ahead faster. She works in partnership with a friend, who's job it is to go out and sell the completed pieces. Both her jobs produce needed profits which, together with her husband's earnings, pay for household expenses and education costs of the children. For the future, Carmen would like to start to sell her accessories independently because she figures her profits would be higher that way. This is her first loan with MFP and she promisses to be punctual with her payments because she is already planning to request future loans. Carmen intends to use the funds to buy supplies to continue to make her accessories and to start to become independent.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: Busaana Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
O. John is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is a hardworking and friendly married man with seven children of his own. He also takes care of two orphans. John says that three of his children have left school and are working with him in his fishing business while the rest are still in school.

Although he was a security guard before the transformation, John has been in the fishing business since 2003 and employs three people with whom he shares the day’s catch. From his business, he is able to make 100,000/= in a good week but at times this reduces to 50,000/= during off seasons.

John would like to expand and start poultry farming, especially broilers, in addition to his business and he has already set up the shelter for them. This loan will help him with buying the day-old chicks.

loans.use: To buy day-old chicks for his new business

loans.name: Adji

texts.fr: Adji S. est une femme de 36 ans, elle est divorcée et vit sans enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de WANGO depuis le 26 juillet 2007 et y a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle est vendeuse de tissus et de parfums et ses bénéfices lui permettent d'assurer sa nourriture et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Adji S., age 36, is a divorcee and lives without children. She's been a member of the Village Bank WANGO since July 26, 2007, and already benefited from five loans. All loans were well managed and repaid on time. She resells fabrics and perfumes, and her profits enable her to buy food and provide for herself.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her investment capital

loans.name: Farida S.

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Farida Magalula from Mbarali. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 12.

Farida has been running a cafe business. Client’s business is a local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces.

Farida works at the business for 9 to 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and currently earns about 80 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more ingredients such as rice, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil in bulk for business.

In the future, Farida plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!


About SELFINA: 
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients such as rice, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil in bulk for business.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 30 years old, married and the father of two school age children.  He operates a motorcycle transport business in Naivasha and ferries people and goods around town.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He paid his first loan of Kshs 10,000 well, which he used to repair his motorbike.  He plans to buy a new motorbike with this second loan.  He will employ somebody to operate it for him.  This will significantly increase his daily income.

He loves the transportation business and plans to own a fleet of taxis and motorbikes.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a hardworking and faithful widowed lady with four children who are finished with school. She sells building materials, such as sand, bricks and ballast, to earn a living. She also earns extra income from renting her residential houses. She was employed in a meat canning company before she realized the need for more money because she is the breadwinner of the family. 

She saves her money with her group members from Faulu Kenya on a weekly basis, which enables the group members to access loans. 

She has requested a loan of kes 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy sand and ballast. She plans to buy a lorry to make transportation of building materials easier in the future.

loans.use: To buy sand and ballast.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs  to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, D. 47 años es una valerosa mujer, madre D. 9 hijos D. los cuales sólo vive con tres D. ellos y con su esposo Hermogenes D. 53 años, en su casa propia. Lo que más le gusta es atender a sus clientes, quienes ya conocen la calidad D. los chicharrones D. pollo y cerdo que prepara, ofreciéndolos todos los días, desD. las 5 D. la tarD. hasta las 10 D. la noche. Así han transcurrido 20 años dedicándose a esta actividad, ya que su trabajo consta caminar largos trayectos vendiendo comida. Su consigna diaria es tratar D. vender las 35 porciones que hace diario. Por otro lado su esposo, trabaja en el transporte público, utilizando una moto carro alquilado y D. las ganancias que recibe le ayuda para los gastos D. la casa. Sin embargo Santos tiene que esforzarse mucho para ayudar a su ultima hija que sufre D. retardo mental, es por ello que quiere ampliar su negocio, comprando un triciclo, para evitar cargar bandejas y aprovechar en vender otros productos como refrescos y postres, eso le dará mucha más ventaja en los ingresos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y es una D. las personas que trabaja con mucho entusiasmo dentro D. su grupo comunal, además confía en ellos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una carretilla que le ayuD. a reducir el peso que carga a diario.
texts.en:
Santos, 47, is a courageous woman, and mother of 9 children, 3 who live with her and her husband Hermogenes, 53, in their own home. What she likes the most is to look after her customers, who already know the quality of the chicken and pork crackling that she prepares, selling it every day, from 5 in the afternoon until ten in the evening. And so 20 years have passed while running this business, her work consisting of walking long distances selling food. Her daily task is to try to sell the 35 portions that she makes daily. On the other hand, her husband works in public transport, using a rented motorbike cart and the profits that he receives helps in the household expenses. Nevertheless Santos has to work hard to help her youngest daughter who is mentally disabled. This is the reason why she wants to expand her business, buying a three wheeled cart, to save herself from carrying trays and take advantage of selling other products like soft drinks and sweets, this will give her a lot more opportunity to earn income. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is one of the people who works with a lot of enthusiasm within her communal group, in addition she trusts them. With the requested loan, she will buy a cart which will help her reduce the weight that she carries daily.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cart to sell her plates of food.

loans.name: Hilda Eliethe

texts.es: Hilda Eliethe tiene 33 años, su actividad es la venta de comida y refresco. Hace más  de 3 años que tiene este negocio por lo que siempre ha sido una persona responsable que paga sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Además todos los días se alista temprano para  buscar el pan de cada día, algunas veces llueve y ella tiene que buscar el medio para la trasladarse a su negocio, pues tiene que llevar ciertas cosas de su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria. Sueña con seguir trabajando y obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda Eliethe is 33-years-old. She sells food and soft drinks. She's had this business for more than 3 years because she's a responsible person who always makes her payments in due time and proper form. Everyday she wakes up early for work and sometimes it rains and she has to look for transportation to her business while carrying things from home. She is asking for a loan to buy necessary merchandise. Her dream is to continue working and gain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eveling Carolina

texts.es: Eveling Carolina tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene esta actividad, pues inicio como una opción porque no tenía un trabajo y no ganaba un salario que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su hogar, también tiene 1 hijo menor de edad que mantener, por lo que las compras de sus productos tiene que hacerlos en los departamentos es aquí los comprar a un precio más accesible. Con el financiamiento comprara pinturas de labios, polvos, pinturas de uñas y perfumes. Sueña con mejorar su actividad económica y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Eveling Carolina is 28 years old. Her business is selling cosmetics. She has had her business for more than 3 years. It began as an option since she was out of work and not earning a wage that could defray her household expenses. She also has 1 dependent child to support, so she has to make her sales in people's apartments. This does allow her clients to make their purchases at more affordable prices. With the loan, she will buy lipsticks, face powders, nail polish and perfumes. She hopes to improve her business and to keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Elfego

texts.es:
El señor Elfego S. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo invertir en su negocio de comida, el cual atiende su esposa.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para invertir en el negocio de ropa que tiene ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá del negocio de ropa usada y nueva.
texts.en:
Elfego S. is grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan. With the loan he was able to invest in his food business, which his wife takes care of. He is requesting a loan again to invest in the clothing business that he has. It needs a greater variety of merchandise. He plans to pay the loan with the earnings he gets from his new and used clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Navy Y. is a group leader who is 25 years old, selected by six members whom all are made up a group loan in Pou Doh village in Takeo province. Each member will use portion of their loan for different purposes in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Navy Y. owns a general store in local village where she is able to earn some money to support her family while her husband, Mr. Chanthou Tiev, is a chicken middleman and he is also a farmer who owns one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. Now she has a problem because her husband’ field is infertile soil. So to improve production, Mrs. Navy Y. is applying for loan to buy fertilizer. She is a mother of a child who is three years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites B. is from the village of Barangay Abinganan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns and operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Marites is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Marites from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M., 61, and her husband Wilfredo, also 61, are working hard to cover their daily expenses. For the past 12 years Sarah has been running her own restaurant. Recently the price of gas for her stove has gone up, creating some difficulties, but Sarah has been able to manage her way through.

Sarah is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to help her purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant, including chicken, pork, and beef. The additional ingredients will allow her to keep cooking and generating income. She hopes that they will also allow her to attract more customers and eventually expand the business.

Sarah has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 2004 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.* She dreams of living a stable life and saving enough money to cover emergencies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Composed of 15 to 30 community partners, the fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Fatoumata Yéhia

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata Yéhia Y. est âgée de 46 ans et mère d’une fille. Elle réside avec son époux à Bougoula-Ville Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’est initiée aux activités d’achat et de vente de lait en poudre,  de moquettes,  de couvre-lits,  de cache-murs et autres divers articles, depuis plus de dix ans. Elle passe les commandes de ses marchandises à Gao (7ème région administrative du Mali) en provenance d’Algérie dans le Maghreb  qu’elle revend de façon ambulante dans les différentes structures professionnelles de la ville. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Elle vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Elle est à son deuxième prêt qui lui permettra d’acquérir, 13 cartons de laits en poudre, 10 moquettes de différentes dimensions, 4 couvre-lits, 6 paires de cache-murs, 5 carton de Couscous arabe, etc.                                                                                                       Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata Yehia Y. is 46 years old and mother to one daughter. She lives with her husband in the village of Bougoula in Sikasso, third administrative region in the Republic of Mali. For socio-economic reasons she was not able to attend school so she started a business, buying and selling powdered milk, thick wool fabrics, bed spreads, and drapes and various other articles. She has had this business for ten years. She fills her orders for merchandise in Gao (the seventh administrative region in Mali) but the merchandise comes from Maghreb, Algeria. She resells her merchandise door to door and to businesses in her village. Given the high quality of the products she sells she is always sought out by her clientele. She finalizes her sales in cash and on credit. With the goal of better satisfying her ever growing client base she approached the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso last year. This will be her second loan and it will be used to purchase 13 cartons of powdered milk, 10 pieces of wool fabric of different sizes, 4 bed spreads, 6 pairs of curtains, 5 cartons of couscous, etc. She foresees earning a monthly income of 200.000 francs, part of which will used towards the family's expenses, part to pay off the loan, and part will be reinvested into the business.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various merchandise.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been practicing mixed farming for six years in Kitale town, western Kenya. His mixed farm produces milk and maize which he sells to the local market; he has only one employee. He also earns income from his motorbike business. He faces the challenge of animal diseases which are too costly to treat.

Patrick is 25 years old. He is married and has no children.

Patrick has requested this loan of 61,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family since he will be able to provide enough milk for domestic consumption.

In five years time, Patrick hopes to have acquired five more dairy cows and be a major supplier of milk to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Creciendo Hacia El Futuro 3 Group

texts.es:
