Petronila es una de los miembros del Grupo Creciendo hacia el futuro , ellos son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, educacion,  etc; en la ciudad de San Pedro de Macoris, una ciudad famosa por sus jugadores de pelota y por la industria azucarera, su economía actual depende de la Zona franca, la industria del cemento y otras actividades menores como el turismo.  Está asociada  de Esperanza es madre de dos hijos y comenzó con nosotros porque tenía el sueño de tener una pequeña escuela en su comunidad, el cual inicio con su primer prestamo y actualmente llega 4 años y esta recibiendo su decimo prestamo, en cada uno ha realizado sus pagos satisfactoriamente y ha realizado buenas inversiones. Por medio de su negocio (Una escuela) da un buen aporte a su comunidad, ya que ofrece una buena educacion privada a un costo mensual bajo.

Petronila está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de utiles escolares para niños y productos para la cafeteria de la escuela. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para invertir en su negocio, comprando abanicos, hacer mas promociones, aunque actualmente tiene menos estudiantes por los problemas economicos de sus padres, su gran reto es poder pagarle a sus empleados, ya que en este periodo la escuela tendra menos ingresos. Su sueño ahora es poder tener mas alumnos, una mejor escuela, con mas profesores y al lograr esto podra apoyar a esas familias mas necesitadas, al menos desea apoyarle en su educacion.
texts.en:
Petronila is one of the members of the group Creciendo hacia el Futuro (Growing toward the Future). They are micro-business people who work in the sale of clothing, natural products, shoes, etc., and in education in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for its ball players and for its sugar industry. Its present economy depends on the free-trade zone, the cement industry, and other lesser activities such as tourism. This member of Esperanza International is the mother of two children and began working with Esperanza International because she had the dream of having a little school in her community. She began the school with her first loan. Now it is four years later and she is receiving her tenth loan. For each loan she has made her payments in a satisfactory manner and she has made good investments. Through her business (the school) she makes a good contribution to the community, since she offers a good private education at a low monthly cost.

Petronila is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of children's school supplies and products for the school cafeteria. She will use her earnings to invest in her business, buying fans and doing more advertising, although now she has fewer students because of the economic problems of their parents. Her greatest challenge is being able to pay her employees, since at this time the school has less income. Her dream is to have more students and a better school with more teachers, and when she achieves this she will be able to help the most needy families -- at the least, she wants to help them in their education.

loans.use: Buy school supplies and products for the cafeteria.

loans.name: Rosa Neli

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 19 años y reside junto a su esposo en el caserío Quemazón del distrito de Mórrope, una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la crianza y venta de cerdos y animales menores, ella cría los animales en algunos corrales acondicionados cerca a su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Con estos ingresos ella se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Rosa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de alimento balanceado y aves de corral de modo que su nivel de ventas se pueda ampliar durante los siguientes meses en los cuales su demanda aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven bastante empeñosa y con ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder consolidar su joven familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Rosa is 19 years old and lives with her husband in the hamlet of Quemazon, in the Morrope District, in the rural area that is in the province of Lambayeque that is located about an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past two years she has been raising and selling pigs and other small animals. She raises these animals in conditioned corrals near her home. When they have reached a certain level of development she sells them to brokers that always visit the area where she lives. She uses these earning to help support her family.
Rosa would like to grow her business by buying food for the animals and birds that can be raised in the corral. In this way she can increase her earnings during these next months when there is an increase in demand. This is why she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 new soles
She is an earnest, young person with the desire to move ahead. Her main goal is to continue growing her business in order to support her young family. People that know her consider her a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: She will buy food for the animals and birds that can be raised in a corral.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly G. is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store.  She lives in Poblacion, Basay, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1994 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $237. 

Nelly is now borrowing 29,500 PHP so that she can purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nelly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Francisca; tiene 58 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 10 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de loseria, ella vende platos, tazas y ollas, la socia tiene una pequeña tienda de loseria en la provincia de Izcuchaca, la socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de loseria.

 La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SR DE COYLLORITTY CACHIMAYO" communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cachimayo District which belongs to Anta Province in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Francisca is 58 years old and married with 10 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her pottery business where she sells dishes, cups and bowls.  She has a small pottery shop that is open from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  She would like to use the loan to buy pottery products and expand her business.

The member is grateful for the loan and is committed paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy pottery products.

loans.name: Italo Gabriel

texts.es:
Italo de 42 años, tiene una pequeña papelería en su casa y vende morocho (postre). Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Guasmo caracterizada porque la mayoria de las personas son comerciantes informales. 

Con unos ahorros él comenzó a comprar papelería para tener su propio negocio. Readecuo su casa en la parte delantera y ubico su papelería. Poco a poco durante estos años la ha surtido. También vende morochos ya que su papa vendía y le enseño para que no se pierda esta actividad en la familia. Con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes, cuadernos, plumas para su papelería. 

En el futuro quiere que su papelería se a una de las más grandes y continuar con las ventas de morocho.
texts.en:
Italo is 42 years old and has a small school/office supplies store based from his home and sells morocho dessert.  He lives in an urban area called Guasmo characterized by the fact that most people are traders.

With some savings he started to buy office supplies for his business.  He adjusted his house at the front and set up his product.  Slowly through the years he has stocked it.  He sells morochos dessert because his dad used to sell them and showed him how to make them so that this activity stays alive in the family.  With the loan he wants to buy toys, notebooks, pens for his supplies store.

In the future he wants his store to be one of the biggest ones and to continue with the morocho dessert sales.

loans.use: Toys, notebooks and pens

loans.name: Olegario

texts.es:
El señor Olegario G. H. ha nacido el 6 de marzo de 1971, es de la comunidad de Sankayani Bajo de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba.

El señor Olegario se dedica a la agricultura, vive en el sector más elevada de la Provincia, la producción que realiza es estacional que produce una vez al año,  siembra papa, haba, oca y cereales. Los trabajos lo realizan toda la familia en algunos casos con ayuda de sus vecinos de lugar como aine, mink’a según sus costumbres de lugar.

Las condiciones en las que viven son muy modestas, tienen una casa de barro con techos de paja que están construidas sin ninguna planificación de la vivienda  las corrales de sus animales están alrededor de la casa, ahi viven toda la familia con sus hijos y su esposa.
El crédito que solicito es para comprar terreno agrícola, ya que no tiene suficiente terreno para sembrar más grande, y no abastece en ese sentido el señor va ampliar su producción para mejorar las condiciones de vive en su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Olegario G. H. was born on 6 March 1971. He is from the community of Sankayani Bajo in Tiraque Province in the Department of Cochabamba.

Señor Olegario is a farmer. He lives in the highest sector of the province. His production is seasonal, producing one crop a year. He plants potatoes, faba beans, oca (an edible root) and cereals. His entire family works, sometimes with help from neighbors like the aine and mink’a (indigenous groups in the area), according to the customs of the region.

The conditions in which they live are very modest. They have a mud house with a straw roof that is constructed without any planning for a dwelling. The enclosure for their animals surrounds the house. The entire family lives there.

The loan that Señor Olegario has applied for is to purchase agricultural land since he doesn’t have enough land to plant more. In this way he is going to enlarge his production in order to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: Purchase of agricultiural land.

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Twelve members are forming this village bank loan.  They are located in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. The members of this village loan selected Mrs. Sun K., a 37-year-old married woman, as the village bank president. The members hope to increase their income to improve their family by using these loans.  

Mrs. Sun K. and her husband, Mr. Chorn Khorn, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow rice and corn.  They face a problem in not having money to do this farming.  In order to grow rice and corn, Mrs. Sun K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate rice and corn. 

This couple has five children:  four are students who also support their parents' farming, while the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate rice and corn

loans.name: Nueva Amistad Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “NUEVA AMISTAD” es un grupo de 8  mujeres que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud,  serán parte del centro focal de Panamericana, ellas están iniciando su primer ciclo.

Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. Entre ellos tenemos:    carnicería, venta de condimentos, sastrería, venta de pescado, tienda de barrio, tejidos a máquina, venta de dulces en un anaquel, venta de papas fritas.

Para su organización, la B. C. Nueva Amistad cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Elena, una tesorera, la señora  Jovita y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Rita.
 
La Tesorera, la señora  Jovita está casada, tiene 5 hijos varones y 1 hija mujer.    El negocio de la señora  Jovita se encuentra en  la Feria de Lagunas, consiste en la venta de chuño remojado (papa deshidratada que nuevamente es hidratada para ser utilizada), trigo cocido, mote cocido, ají molido.  Este negocio fue creado por iniciativa propia hace tres años cuando la señora Jovita se dio cuenta que hacía falta este tipo de productos en la Feria (listos para ser utilizados en la cocina), los días de venta recibe la ayuda de su hijita.     El préstamo solicitado fue por Bs.800.- y será destinado para la compra de chuño,trigo, maíz y ají seco.

La señora tesorera nunca había sido socia de Pro Mujer, esta es su primera experiencia,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le atrae de la institución, ella responde “el ahorro”.
texts.en:
The cooperative bank “NUEVA AMISTAD” (“New Friendship”) is a group of 8 women who decided to join together for a loan and training.  They will be part of the focal center of Panamericana, and are starting their first cycle.

Each one of the members has their own business involving a service, production or commerce.  Among them we have:  butcher, condiment sales, tailor, seafood sales, neighborhood general store, knitwear, candy and French fries sales.  

The organization has a management board comprised of a president, Ms. Elena, a treasurer, Ms. Jovita, and a secretary, Ms. Rita.

The Treasurer, Ms. Jovita, is married and has 5 sons and a daughter.  Her business is located at the Lagunas Market, and consists of selling chuño remojado (dehydrated potatoes, re-hydrated for use), boiled wheat, stewed maize, and ground peppers.  She started this business on her own three years ago, after taking notice that these types of items were missing at the market (ready for use in the kitchen).  On the days she sells, she gets help from her daughter.

The loan portion she requested is 800 Bolivianos, and will be used to buy dehydrated potatoes, wheat, corn and dry peppers.  This is her first time working with Pro Mujer and, when asked what attracts her most to the institution, she replies “the savings”.

loans.use: To purchase dehydrated potatoes, corn, peppers and wheat.

loans.name: Arturo Enrique

texts.es: El Sr. Arturo Enrique G. P. él es trabajador activo de la empresa de Enacal Carazo desempeñándose como Supervisor Comercial tiene  dos  años  de trabajar para esta institución tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ha  mejorado su condición de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Arturo Enrique Gonzalez Perez is an active employee of the Enacal Carazo company and he works as a commercial supervisor. He has two years working in this company and he has a school-aged son. He has had two previous loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each one was used to purchase construction materials, including sand, cement, rocks, gravel, construction blocks, etc., to expand and improve his home. The loans from Ceprodel have been a great help because they have improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with three children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but no running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past ten years, Mwanasiti has operated a retail shop, selling goods at the market to her neighbors and community members. Her major business challenge is seasonality. 

Mwanasiti decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of wheat flour, sugar, rice and beans to sell. In the future, Mwanasiti hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice, and beans

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
La señora S. es profesora en este municipio desde hace 25 años en el nivel de primaria este crédito será utilizado para terminar de construir una tapia en su casa para tener mayor seguridad en su vivienda ya que no se encuentra cerrada si no que tiene alrededor de la casa alambres de puas 
Es el tercer crédito que solicita en ceprodel los dos anteriores han sido siempre para mejorar su casa 
Ella es madre soltera con una hija a su cargo que cuando se va para su trabajo la niña queda al cuido de la madre de la Sra. Nelly
Los créditos con ceprodel le han sido de mucha utilidad ya que su vivienda le ha hechos varios cambios con lo que se siente agradecida con la institución
texts.en:
Sra. S. has been an elementary school teacher in this town for 25 years. She will use this loan to finish the construction of a wall outside of her home so that she will have added security. Her property is not closed off, but surrounded by barbed wire.

This is the third loan she has requested from CEPRODEL. Her two previous loans were also used for home improvements.

Sra. Nelly is a single mother of a daughter who is a dependent. When Nelly leaves for work, her daughter is looked after by her grandmother.

The loans from CEPRODEL have been very useful because her home has undergone several changes, so Nelly expresses her appreciation.

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish the construction of a security wall

loans.name: Creciendo En Fe 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Eusebia’s family is composed of her spouse and three children, only one f them still lives at home. She tells us that she’s always been a hard-working woman and has always sought to have various businesses. She has  even run this vegetables and fruit stall for around 18 years, selling mostly vegetables and tropical fruits. This new loan will be invested to buy bags of peas and beans, vegetables and fruits, etc.

Eusebia is one of the group called 'Creciendo en Fe' 2 & 3, composed of nine businesswomen and one man, located  in the agricultural city of Hato Mayor. Her challenge is to work harder to give her children what they need, and her most favorite activity is to generate income.  She wants to have the opportunity to improve her business and see it grow into a successful one, with great income and sustainable enough to support her family.

loans.use: to buy peas, vegetables, plantains, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Manuela

texts.es:
Rosa nació en la ciudad D. Apurímac y tiene 63 años D. edad, ella es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene tres hijos, ella se dedica la elaboración D. artesanía ósea hace tejidos con lana D. alpaca o oveja dependiendo del gusto del cliente. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Rosa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo lana, aretes y otras cosas más. 

Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” D. la Asociación Arariwa D. la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the city of Apurímac and is 63 years old.  She’s married and has three children.  She’s an artisan, that is, she makes Alpaca or sheep’s wool weavings depending on the customer’s wishes.  She’s been in this line of work for 25 years now and she does very well.

On this occasion Rosa needs a loan to buy more supplies like wool, earrings and other things.

Rosa is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank in the city of Cusco.

loans.use: to buy supplies like wool, earrings and others.

loans.name: Liliana Maritza

texts.es: La señora Liliana tiene 44 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos D. 22 y 9 años D. edad, ella tiene una moto taxi que compro con los ahorros que ella tenia producto D. su trabajo como obrera D. campo, la moto taxi es manejada por su esposo solo por las tardes por en las mañanas trabaja en fundo como obrero D. campo, generándole otro ingreso su sueño en el futuro es poder comprar una unidad D. transporte(auto) para mejorar sus ingresos y poder darle tranquilidad a su familia, el dinero será invertido en hacerle unas mejoras a su moto taxi, darle  mantenimiento cambio D. llantas para su buena imagen y buen funcionamiento y los clientes quieran utilizar sus servicios, Liliana esta muy agradecida por la confianza que se le esta brindando
texts.en: Liliana is 44 yeas old, married, and has two children ages 22 and 9.  She has a motorcycle taxi that she bought with savings from her job as a farm laborer.  The moto taxi is driven by her husband only in the afternoons because in the mornings he works on a ranch as a laborer, earning additional income.  Her dream for the future is to be able to purchase a car to increase her earnings and bring peace of mind to her family.  The money from the loan will be used for maintenance on the moto taxi, changing the tires so the taxi looks good and functions well and customers will want to use her services.  Liliana is very thankful for the trust you are placing in her.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her motorcycle taxi, changing the tires and painting it.

loans.name: Juana Isabel

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo vía a Manta se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal San Pedro, es este lugar su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Juana, tiene 42 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tuvo dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive en su casa con su esposa y sus dos hijos que son lo más bello para nuestra amiga.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. También se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal y Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija le ayudan en su tienda cuando ella tiene que salir a realizar sus ventas de los productos Avon y Yanbal, estos los vende puerta a puerta y en su local también.  Tiene tres años con su tienda y la ido incrementando poco a poco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y productos de Avon y Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The San Pedro communal bank meets every two weeks in the outskirts of Portoviejo, on the road to Manta.  The local people are farmers and raise livestock.

Here we meet Juana.  She is 42 years old, separated, and has two adult children.  One of them lives in her home, along with his wife and two children who are the loveliest children to her.

She runs a small grocery store from her home, where she sells all types of products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, etc.  She also sells Yanbal and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women).  She works daily from 6:00 am to 8:00 pm and sometimes later.  Her daughter helps her in her store while she sells her Avon and Yanbal products, which she sells door to door and in her store.  She has had her store for three years and it has been growing little by little. 

She will use the money from this loan to buy more inventory with which to stock her store; things like rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, sausages, and Avon and Yanbal products.  She has been part of the communal bank since the beginning and she likes that she has made more friends in the group.

Her goals are to move ahead with her business and grow her store.

loans.use: to buy inventory to stock her store

loans.name: Martha Luz

texts.es:
La Sra. Martha Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sembrando Futuro” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene 29 años y 02 hijos, uno de ellos cursa educación primaria y el otro secundaria, quienes son su estimulo constante.

Su afición por los negocios y por iniciativa propia, decide dedicarse a la venta de jugos y refrigerios en el año 2007.
Actualmente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de distintas líneas de belleza igualmente presta el servicio de recargas virtuales de teléfonos celulares y los sábados y domingo vende comida tipo menú, actividades que le permiten aportar económicamente a su hogar y mantener a sus hijos.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,900.00, comprará cosméticos como perfumes, lápiz labiales, esmaltes, talcos, cremas de diferentes marcas, asimismo incrementará su saldo para dar un mayor servicio de  recargas virtuales, con otra parte del dinero comprará insumos para la preparación de los diferentes platos de comida que ofrece a su clientela y así ellos se sientan satisfechos con todos los productos que ofrece.  

La Sra. Martha se considera una mujer luchadora es por eso que tiene como sueño contar con un local propio y grande para la venta de sus productos.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse como empresarias.
texts.en:
Martha Luz belongs to the “Sembrando Futuro” [Planting the Future] communal bank in Tarapoto district, in the province and department of San Martín. She is single, 29 years old, and has 2 children. One of them is in primary school and the other is in middle school. They are her constant motivation.

Due to her fondness for business and her sense of initiative, she decided in 2007 to sell juices and refreshments. She currently sells cosmetics from different beauty product companies. She also sells minutes for cellular phones and on Saturdays and Sundays she sells food from a set menu. These various activities allow her to contribute economically to the household and provide for her children. 

With this loan of PEN 1,900.00 she will buy cosmetics such as perfumes, lipsticks, nail polishes, talcum powders, and different brands of lotions.  She will also increase her amount of cell phone minutes to sell. With another portion of the money she will buy ingredients for the variety of food she offers to her customers, so they will feel satisfied with the all the products she offers.

Martha considers herself to be a very hardworking woman and her dream is to have her own large store where she can sell her products. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women like herself to have opportunities to grow as businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, lipsticks, nail polishes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif is 43 years old. He is married and has two children. For almost 6 years, Arif has been working as a market vendor. He sells plates and dishes of the oriental style as well as some detergent items such as shampoo and washing powder. These kinds of goods are in popular demand among the population. They are widely used for girls' dowries and also for family celebrations. 

His love for his children is the biggest reason for Arif to make an effort to provide what they need. Now Arif is planning to increase the range of goods he sells and to purchase more goods to expand his inventory. With this purpose in mind, he requests a loan of 1,000 AZN. 

The well-being of Arif’s family and his business is in your hands. Arif and his family are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: purchase new inventory to expand the business

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is 26 years old and lives in the West Point area. She’s single with one child aged 8 years old. Her child lives at home and attends school. For the past two years, she has been involved in the sale of fresh fish. During the rainy season, there are fewer sales. What she likes about this business is that it helps her to feed her child and feel proud of sending him to school. Clara has requested this loan to purchase more cartons of fish. In the future, she plans to have her own cold storage and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is married and has seven children. She is 65 years old and lives in Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Martina runs a sari-sari (variety) story where she sells canned goods and other daily needs such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, etc., to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work.

Martina has been a member of PMPC for four years. She has requested a loan for 2,000 PHP to purchase products to resell. 

In the future, Martina hopes to make her sari-sari store bigger.

loans.use: to purchase goods to resell at her store.

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía estudia el segundo grado de la secundaria en las escuela para adultos, y tiene un total de  dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la  venta de tamales, tiene veinte años vendiendo tamales y tiene buenos clientes, los tamales que mas vende son los de puerco, es una señora muy trabajadora, los domingos lava ropa ajena.
En las mañanas vende atole de arroz con leche, empezó a vender atole desde hace tres meses, le va muy bien en la venta de atole y sus hijos le ayudan llevándole el atole donde comúnmente vende. 
Sus clientes les recomiendan que venda comida en las tardes ya que la señora Rosalía tiene buen sazón.
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para hacer guisados ya que hace dos años vendía comida y  desea comenzar a vender otra vez, desea comprar jitomate, sal, carne, chiles, aceite, etc.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosalia is in her second year of taking high school classes at a school for adults. She has two children and manages a business selling tamales. Rosalia has been selling tamales for 20 years and has good customers. The tamales that she sells the most contain pork. She is a hardworking woman and on Sundays she does laundry for other people.

In the mornings, she sells rice porridge with milk. She began selling porridge three months ago and has done very well with her sales. Her children help carry the porridge to wherever she sells. Her customers recommended that she sell food in the afternoons since her dishes have great flavor.

Rosalia is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for making stews that she used to sell two years ago. Now she wants to start selling them again. Rosalia wants to buy tomatoes, salt, meat, chili peppers, oil, and other ingredients. She thanks Fundación Realidad for the support it has provided so that she can move forward and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making stews.

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 39 years old, married and has three children.

Bassem has been the owner of a workshop for blacksmithing and welding since 2001. He has a good experience and a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to buy a small truck and repair tools. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To buy a small truck and repair tools.

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали проживает в районе Яван. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он имеет средне - специальное образование. Он мастер, занимается строительными работами по найму. Кроме того Муродали занимается животноводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en:
Murodali lives in the Yavan region. He is 39 years old. He is married with three children. His wife is a homemaker. He has vocational training. 
He is foreman and works in construction for hire. Besides this, Murodali practices animal husbandry. He raises calves for future sale. He has been doing this work for 10 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Rosa Patricia

texts.es:
Rosa casada, su esposo albañil, sus hijos estudiantes. Su proyecto establecer su venta de frutas. Trabaja para una empresa privada desde hace un tiempo. Con el apoyo de su esposo anda ido mejorando poco a poco su vivienda faltándole mayor inversión en la casa ya que requiere mejoras las paredes y poner el piso. Utilizara el préstamo que solicitad para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piso entre otros materiales. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo en el desarrollo de mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is married.  Her husband is a bricklayer, and her children go to school.

Her project is establishing her fruit sales.  She has worked for a private company for some time.  With her husband’s support she has little by little been improving her house.  Greater investment in the house is needed because the walls need improvements, and the floor needs to be put down.

She will use the requested loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, and flooring, among other things.

She is grateful for the loan for the support in developing a better standard of living.

loans.use: to put down a floor.

loans.name: Frashiah

texts.en:
Frashiah, a business-lady who sells new and second-hand household goods such as mattresses and beds, has operated her business for over ten years, employing two people to assist her. She also farms to earn additional income.

Frashiah's membership in Faulu Kenya has taught her business management skills that have enabled her to improve her enterprise, and she hopes to expand her business premises within five years. She is now requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy more second-hand furniture.

loans.use: to buy second-hand furniture.

loans.name: Armelinda

texts.en:
Armelinda is 54 years old and married with 9 children.

Armelinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Armelinda has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Armelinda aspires to build and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her store

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a resident of Nkubu in Central Kenya.  He is married and has 2 children, aged 12 and 6.  He is 51 years old.  

Francis has been in farming for 11 years, producing and selling potatoes, cabbages and milk to the local market.  He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero grazing unit for his dairy cows and sheep.  He says this will help him secure feeds for his animals and increase his income with better feeding. He adds that his focus is to buy more land to expand his farming business and educate his children.  He laments the high costs of farm inputs and common animal diseases.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Wilson Manuel

texts.es:
A sus 54 años de edad Wilson es un luchador que trabaja diariamente vendiendo legumbres por las calles del municipio de Caucasia en el departamento de Antioquia. Es padre de 5 hijos y su mayor sueño ha sido brindarles un mejor futuro.

Actualmente Wilson quiere comprar legumbres, frutas y verduras al por mayor para surtir el negocio y generar mas ingresos, pero no cuenta con el capital de inversión necesario para hacer dichas compras, por lo que solicita un préstamo como capital de trabajo, así mejorarán las ventas gracias a la variedad y las utilidades serán mejores gracias a la cantidad. Posteriormente Wilson pretende generar un empleo, buscando una ayuda para que su negocio progrese y brindarle apoyo otra persona que se encuentren en una difícil situación económica.
texts.en:
Wilson is a hard-working 54-year-old man who works every day selling vegetables on the streets of the Caucasia municipality, Antioquia department. He has five children and his greatest dream is to offer them a better future.

Now, Wilson wants to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale in order to stock his business and generate more income. However, he does not have the necessary capital to make this purchase. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for working capital. This way he will improve his sales, thanks to the greater variety and quantities he will offer. Wilson plans to create a position in his business by hiring someone to help him. This will help his business to grow and help another person out of a difficult economic situation.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale in order to stock his business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras J. II” del, distrito J., provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.

La señora se dedica a la venta de artesanía como tejidos en estacas, agujas, ponchos, llicllas, fajas, frazadas y los vende en las ferias de la zona. Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 200.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará lanas de diferentes colores para sus tejidos, el kilo lo compra en S/. 40.00 nuevo soles en Juliaca.  Su esposo trabaja como músico.

La señora desea tener más capital para mejorar su negocio y tener más ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es el ahorro, la ganancia y la facilidad con la que otorgan un préstamo.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the communal bank "Aymaras J. II" in the J. District, province of Chucuito, in the department of Puno.  She is 28 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary level education.

She sells crafts such as woven textiles, needles, ponchos, illicllas (skirts), girdles, and blankets which she sells at the trade fairs in her area.  Her initial loan of 200 PEN was invested in her business.

She plans to use the new 500 PEN loan to buy different colored yarn for her woven products.  She buys a kilo for 40 PEN in Juliaca.  Her husband works as a musician.

Beatriz wants more capital to improve her business and increase earnings.  What she enjoys most about the communal bank is learning how to save and make a profit, as well as the ease with which loans are granted.

loans.use: To buy different colored yarn.

loans.name: Itabaza/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Chantal fait partie du groupe Itabaza. Elle a 30 ans et elle est mariée avec 1 enfant de 5 ans, dont son enfant est scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3  ans de primaire.

Chantal est cultivatrice de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des poissons pour les revendre. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de fournir la grande quantité aux clients.  Dans les prochaines années, Chantal voudrait être le fournisseur des poissons dans la région. Avec les profits, Chantal prévoit d’éduquer et soigner son enfant.
texts.en:
Chantal is part of the Itabaza group. She is 30 years old and is married with a 5-year-old child who attends school. She has completed three years of primary school.

Chantal is a rice farmer. This is her first loan cycle with ACB. She will use her credit loan to buy fish for resale.

Her strategy for growing her business is to provide customers with large quantities.

In coming years, Chantal would like to become the fish supplier for the region. With the profits, Chantal plans to educate and care for her child.

loans.use: buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Sari Wangi Ternak Group

texts.en:
This group was formed by the stakeholder in the village. They are interested in the pig breeder loan from MUK. The Sari Wangi Ternak group has 10 women members. The members of the group are farmers. They work on their land or on other people's land and get a fee from that. To improve their income, beside that from their husbands, they want to run this business at home.

Ni Luh, head of the Sari Wangi Ternak, has two children. The first child is still in elementary school and the second is still a toddler. Her husband works as a chili and corn farmer. Ni Luh allready has pigs, but to improve her business, she needs a loan to buy more pigs. She will use the loan to purchase three pigs and use the rest for food. She maintains the pigs for fattening. Ni Luh hope the business can run smoothly, avoid diseases and earn a profit.

loans.use: To purchase three pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Dekonte

texts.en:
Dekonte is 52 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is a widow and has four children between the ages of 18 and 27. Two are in school and live at home, while the two oldest are living on their own. 

For the past eighteen years she has been operating a tailoring shop in her community. She has a lot of customers and she makes a lot of profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth for her business.  She plans to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Editha is married with two children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general store) business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Editha  as been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.

In 2010, Editha joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to sell.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina cuenta con 37 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos y esta en espera de otro sus hijos están estudiando Kenia estudia la prepa, cristal estudia 6° de primaria y norbelio esta en 3° de preescolar, su esposo se llama norbelio es campesino.

Ella es comerciante tiene una tienda de abarrotes ya tiene dos años con su tienda, Delfina invertirá su préstamo en la compra de productos de abarrotes como son: detergente, refrescos, agua, leche, etc. Pues doña delfina dice que le esta hechando todas las ganas para que su negocio crezca mas ya que lo quiere incrementar mas.
texts.en:
Delfina is 37 years old, married, has three children and is expecting another one.  Her children are attending school.  Kenia is in high school, Cristal is in 6th grade and Norbelio is in 3rd year of Preschool.  Her husband’s name is Norbelio and he’s a farmer.

She is a merchant.  She’s had a grocery store for two years and she will use her loan to buy grocery items like detergent, soft-drinks, water, milk, etc. because Delfina says that she’s putting her all into it so that the business grows more because she wants to expand it.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Edison Arley

texts.es: Edison Arley es un joven de 19 años que quiere emprender el negocio que ha heredado su familia por largas generaciones. Edison se dedica al cuidado de abejas y la extracción de su miel para la venta, actividad que le enseñó su padre cuando apenas tenía 8 años y que ha desarrollado desde entonces, hasta el día de hoy cuando decide ampliar el apiario que le regalo su padre. Edison sueña con tener un gran negocio de mieles donde sea reconocido por su excelente calidad, además de poder pagar los gastos de sus padres y que mejoren su calidad de vida. Sin embargo, por las fuertes lluvias, las flores no han crecido lo suficiente para poder abastecer de alimento las abejas, por lo que se les debe complementar con azúcar, por esto, Edison requiere de la compra de alimento para sus abejas y los recursos para ampliar el apiario actual.
texts.en: Edison Arley is a young 19-year-old who wants to keep running the business that his family has passed down for generations. Edison is a beekeeper and extracts their honey for sale. His father taught him this business when he was barely 8 years old and he has worked on the business since then. He now wants to expand the collection of beehives that his father gave him. Edison dreams of having a large honey business and of being known for the high quality of his honey, along with being able to cover his parents' costs and improve their quality of life. However, because of the strong rains, the flowers have not grown enough to keep the bees fed; for this reason, Edison has to supplement their diet with sugar. In order to do this, Edison needs to buy food for his bees, as well as tools to expand his current collection of beehives.

loans.use: to feed the bees in his beehives and to expand his current collection of beehives.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix, de 57 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, donde tiene su propia casa, construido a base de material rustico. Félix asegura que el producto de cacao se ha convertido en los últimos años en un gran negocio, no solo para él, sino para el resto de los campesinos, desde luego que está sacando el máximo provecho a sus plantaciones. Cada año va tomando presencia en su localidad, de esta manera trata de mejorar en cuanto a la calidad de su producto. En épocas de cosecha y deshierbo de malezas necesita el apoyo de los jornaleros, con la finalidad de obtener mayor rendimiento en su faena laboral. Su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y su rutina diaria es desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta horas de la tarde. Con el transcurso del tiempo piensa en comprar semillas de café  para luego sembrarlas  y con el tiempo obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el crédito número 08 con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además siente que llegará lo mas lejos posible con su banco comunal, ya que todos están conformen por el buen manejo de su grupo.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles, comprará semillas de cacao para seguir sembrando ya que cuenta con 01 hectrea de terreno sin cultivar.
texts.en:
Felix is 57, and lives in the community of Manitea Alta, where he has his own house, constructed from basic materials. Felix says that growing cacao  has become a great business in the last few years, not only for him, but for the rest of the farmers, and indeed, he is getting the maximum benefit from his plantations. Each year, it is gradually making its presence felt in his area, so he tries to improve the quality of his product. 

At harvest and weeding time, he needs the help of day laborers, in order to get greater yield from his work. He carries out his sales at the local collection centers, and his daily routine goes from the very early hours of the morning, until the evening hours. 

Over time, he is thinking about buying coffee seeds for planting, in order to eventually earn better income.

This is his eighth loan with MFP, so he promises to continue making his scheduled payments. In addition, he feels he will go as far as possible with his communal bank, as everyone is satisfied with how well the group is managed. 

With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy cacao seeds to keep planting, as he has one hectare of land not cultivated.

loans.use: To buy cacao seeds.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village of the Songkom Thmey district of Presh Vihea province, Horn is aged 47 years and a mother of four children. For the last several years, Horn has been working as a rice farmer to support her family. To supplement the income, she also raises pigs. The current business earns her about 50,000KHR per day. 
Horn is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to seek for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy solar panel for lightning her house. She hopes this loan will enabled her to have enough supplies for using in her family.

loans.use: to buy solar panel for lightning her house

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Tbeng Meanchey District

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is an ambitious smallholder farmer and looks to a future when she is the leading supplier of milk in her area. She's working 10 to 12 hours a day to fulfill her dream. Nancy lives with her husband and says that they only want to have more children when they are sure that they can raise them without worrying about where their next meal will come from or that the children would be forced to leave school because they can't provide for them. Nancy owns a small plot of inherited land on which she has been practicing mixed farming for more than five years. She grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. The income she makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet her family's expenses. She needs to improve her income level, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Nancy passionately loves dairy farming and, as she likes to put it, “dairy farming is close to my heart.” She plans to buy not just an ordinary cow but a quality breed of cow that will produce between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and will also go towards the education of her children. She will also benefit from cow manure, which will be used to increase the fertility level of her farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan she will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change her life and improve her living conditions.
Nancy needs a little help so that she can improve her milk selling business and can accomplish her dreams, loan now.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Maria Felix. I am a merchant with a business selling new clothing which is located in the center of my city and is named Mi Pequeña Esperanza. I have been operating this business for several years and it has allowed me to improve the standard of living for my children, especially important considering that I am a single mother. I now need to increase the inventory of my business given that sales have grown this season.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Hola mi nombre es Maria Felix, soy comerciente cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad llamdo Mi Pequeña Esperanza, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me ha permitido sacar adelante a mis hijos, tomando en cuenta que soy madre soltera, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que en esta epoca el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: To puchase pants for boys, men and womoen; fine skirts, mens shirts, childrens t-shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Alovsat

texts.en:
Alovsat started his own small business 3 years ago. This is his only source of income.
He wants his children to be able to finish school and to have their incomes from work help his family.He needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 calves.
This 50-year-old man is a father of 4 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Bala Behmenli village.

loans.use: To buy 5 calves

loans.name: Ebalu

texts.en: "I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safe guard my capital to ensure the continuity of my business." All these are words of Mrs. F. Ebalu, a female entrepreneur married with five (5) children. She is requesting $500 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food ingredients for food

loans.name: Jany Marilin

texts.en: Jany studied to be an obstetrician but before finishing her degree she realized that that would not be the job for her and found a job selling tickets for an airline, AeroContinente.  When AeroContinente folded she got a job at a local travel agency which she loved because she got to meet new and interesting people daily. However, the travel agency often did not pay her on time and nine years ago she decided to quit and open her own travel agency with her sister. They have since incorporated another owner and are very successful, in large part because of Jany´s love for the business and her experience and connections within the industry. She and her partners would like to expand in two manners- they want to purchase another computer to be able to serve more clients at once (they currently only have one computer) and they also eventually want to open another branch of their office, this time in Cusco, the tourist hub of Peru and only 6 hours by bus from Juliaca.

loans.use: Expand travel agency business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Livestock Trading

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve her grocery business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M. is 38 years old, married and has three children with her husband Justini: Anna, 15, Helena, 13 and Paulo, 7. Since 2002, Sarah has run a business selling charcoal. These small pieces of black, dry earth are important to Sarah and her customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still do their cooking in small coal pots in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal pieces) and add paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene to light the flame. The fire requires constant fanning, which makes cooking a hot, laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford. This is good news for Sarah, who requires a loan of $875 to add to her stock of mkaa and continue meeting customer demand.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not credit-worthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase charcoal stock in bulk.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Miss Esther O. is a tailor by profession. She is single, 27 years old, and she lives in Benin City. She has been a LAPO member for 2 years, and she needs the loan amount of $375 to enable her to buy more tailoring materials.  She started the business 3 years ago.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Boihon

texts.en:
N. Boihon is 32 years old. He is married with two children.

Boihon bakes the national bread which is called “lepeshka”. He has been in this business for 12 years already. His bakery is located in his house. As a rule Boihon bakes about 420 “lepeshkas” per day and sells them the same day. The “lepeshka” of Boihon are very popular in his neighborhood and his stable business generates the main income for the family.

Now Boihon is planning to open another bakery, and he also needs to increase the working capital in order to purchase the input materials like flour, salt and coal. For this purpose he requests 600.00 US dollars for the term of 10 months. With the generated income Boihon plans to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchasing materials like, flour, salt and coal and opening another "lepeshka" bakery.

loans.name: Rafiat

texts.en:
Rafiat L. is married with 3 children. She is 32 years old. She is from Oyo State and resides in Edo State, Nigeria.

Rafiat sells clothes and baby things for a living. She has been in business for four years. She needs a loan in the amount of $300 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Victoria's Group

texts.es:
Maria, Ninfa and Maruja have been members of the Santa Rita Communal Bank for 10, 8 and 4 years, respectively.

Maria is 42 years old, married, and has 6 children. She sells fruit from her bicycle cart each day; her husband is a locksmith.

Ninfa is 40 years old, married, and has 8 children, 6 of whom live with her. Ninfa sells traditional Peruvian food in a traditional market and on a bicycle cart. She also travels to regional markets to sell fruit, and brings back cereals and tubers to sell in the city of Ayacucho.

Maruja is 42 years old and married with 4 children. Maruja travels to markets where she buys fruit, young animals, cheeses, and other items, which she sells in the Plaza Grau market. Maruja also raises guinea pigs at home.

Maria, Ninfa and Maruja need loans of 600, 800 and 800 soles, respectively, which they will spend on grapes, bananas, apples, oranges, rice, oil, pasta, potatoes, guinea pigs, wheat, barley and iron.

Maria, Ninfa and Maruja's dreams are for their children to become working professionals, to build a house, and to own a store, land, and a new business.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Maria, Ninfa y Maruja pertenecen al Banco Comunal Santa Rita hace 10, 8, 4 años respectivamente.

Maria es casada, tiene 42 años y 6 hijos, Maria venD. frutas ambulatoriamente en un triciclo, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además su esposo tiene un taller D. cerrajería.

Por otro lado Ninfa es casada, tiene 40 años y 8 hijos D. los cuales 6 viven con ella, Ninfa venD. comida típica en la feria D. platos típicos y ambulantemente en un triciclo. Además Ninfa viaja a las ferias D. la región donD. venD. frutas y D. las feria trae tubérculos y cereales que venD. en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Mientras que Maruja es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Maruja viaja a las ferias donD. compra cereales, animales menores, quesos, productos que venD. en el mercado Playa Grau. Además Maruja D. dedica a la crianza D. cuy en su casa.

Maria, Ninfa y Maruja necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 800 soles, 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. uva, plátano, manzana, naranja, arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, papa, cuy, trigo, cebada y fierros.

Los sueños D. Maria, Ninfa y Maruja son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener una tienda, un terreno, construir su casa y tener un nuevo negocio.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, vegetables, grains and guinea pigs

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es:
Zulema has a talent for making pastries and cakes, and is helped by her new molds used in the preparation of sweets and various desserts. She leaves at dawn to prepare them in the “bread workshop” in the home of one of her relatives, before leaving to sell them in the streets. She remembers learning this occupation from her beloved father. She would like to improve and put her bakery equipment to use in order to soon have a permanent shop to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Zulema tiene el talento para elaborar pasteles y tortas, ayudada por los novedosos moldes que utiliza para la preparación de dulces y variados postres. Sale de madrugada para poder prepararlos en el taller panadero de uno de sus familiares para después recorrer las calles. Ella recuerda que aprendió esta ocupación de su amado padre. Desea mejorar e implementar sus artículos de repostería para pronto poner un espacio de venta permanente.

loans.use: Installation of a bakery

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Victor, is an older man and with his wife they are fully dedicated to farming and cattle raising. The cattle raising helps them during difficult agricultural production periods. They are known by their neighbors for their great work capacity, and are appreciated because of their great heart and commitment to the neediest. To continue working and helping the needy they need to increase their production and purchase one more cow to make and sell cheese in the city. This will improve their income and resolve without difficulty their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Victor, es un señor de avanzada edad y junto a su esposa están plenamente dedicados a la agricultura y a la crianza de vacas que le ayudan en los tiempos difíciles en su producción agrícola. Y por su gran capacidad de trabajo son muy reconocidos por sus vecinos que aprecian a esta pareja de agricultores, además por su gran corazón y compromiso con los más necesitados. Ahora para seguir trabajando y de la misma manera seguir ayudando necesitan incrementar su producción y comprarse una vaquita más para elaborar quesos y venderlos en la ciudad. De esta manera podrán mejorar sus ingresos económicos y así solventarán sin dificultad los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase compost and fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Sarmila K. has one son, who is studying in primary school. Her husband Mr. Santosh K. works in his own grocery store. 
Sarmila K. already owns one cow and she has been selling milk in her area. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued for human nutrition.
Sarmila K. lives in a growing neighborhood, and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing.
She carries her milk containers and sells door to door daily in the morning and in the evening.  Because of the rising demand for milk, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production.  Sarmila K. plans to purchase a jersey cow, which produces more milk than normal cows. So she is asking for a Rs25,000 (US$375) loan to buy a young, milk-giving cow.

loans.use: To buy another milk-giving cow

loans.name: Rahat

texts.en:
Rahat baji is the wife of A. M., and she lives in the city of Riwind, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her oldest son sells milk; her other sons are in school (5th and 3rd standards, respectively); her oldest daughter works in a cotton Mill; and her younger daughter is in 7th standard.

Rahat baji makes embroidered dresses and generally does a lot of work around her house. Notably, Rahat baji successfully repaid three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Currently, she is applying for another loan in order to buy a buffalo to expand her son's milk business.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo in order to expand and improve her son's milk-selling business

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
This is the second time Mrs Say S. asks for a loan to improve her living conditions and business activity. She and her husband, Mr Morn Meth, are farmers in Angk village in Kandal Province. In their plantation, they have an obstacle because they do not have enough money to cultivate rice. In order to deal with this, Mrs Say S. is asking for a loan to buy rice seeds to grow rice. She would use the rest of the loan to buy fuel, fertilizers and pesticides.

Mrs Say S. is 35 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is farmer. Two others are attending school while the youngest is too young to work or study because that child is only five.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fuel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Gnima

texts.fr: Gnima C., 62 ans, mariée avec 05 enfants et 02 petits fils en charge est membre du banc villageois de Yamatogne depuis 5 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter des  boubous en tissu teinté à Dakar et revendre à Ziguinchor. Elle veut renforcer son commerce. <b> Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance. <b/>
texts.en:
Gnima C., age 62, is married with five children and two grandchildren in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Yamatogne for five and a half years. Her work consists of buying dyed boubous (long, flowing traditional garments) in Dakar and reselling them in Ziguinchor. She wants to bolster her business. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell clothing

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sorn Aier was born in 1960 and lives in Prey Meas village in Takeo Province. She is 48 years old and the mother of six children: two of whom are employed in a garment factory, two of whom attend the local school, and two of whom are too young to work or study. She and her husband, Mr. Huch Phal, are farmers. They own a plot of land on which they cultivate both rice and cassavas. Recently, however, their crops have been poor because of problems with infertile soil.

As a result, Mrs. Sorn Aier decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to help improve their soil and make their crops more productive. They would also like to purchase a cow for breeding to increase their overall business production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for their soil and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Jose Darvin

texts.es: El Señor José B. de 23 años de edad,  Soltero de oficios Tejedor, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares,  habita conjuntamente con sus padres, cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, desde su niñez laboro como empleado, en donde fue adquiriendo conocimiento, la cual poco después emprendió su taller ya que con ello a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje ChiB. del Cantón Juchanep del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima y activo para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Teniendo como visión que su taller de fabricación de cortes típicos crezca y que sea un distribuidor mayorista de textiles en el departamento de Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Señor José B. is 23 years-old and a single professional weaver in the "Making of Typical Clothing for Women". He relies on a workshop with 2 Looms. He lives with his parents. They have two employees for the same activity. In his childhood he worked as an employee, where he was acquiring knowledge. Shortly after he undertook his workshop since with it he has been able to move his family ahead. He is a very well known person, with Residence in the Paraje ChiB. del Cantón Juchanep of the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. He has come to the Asdir Association to request a loan for the purchase of materials and assets for said craft to facilitate and be able to meet the demand of his clientele and thus to be able to give better living conditions to his family. He has a vision of growing his typical clothing workshop production and becoming a wholesale distributor of textiles in the department of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials for making typical Guatemalan clothing

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mr. Run V. is 28 years old and is married to Oun Shey Touch, age 24. Both live in Siem Reap Province where they own and run a store to sell items including various kinds of drinks like beer and some kinds of foods that their customers eat at their location. They can earn a profit of approximately $16 a day, and have been in business since 2005. The couple take care of one young child. V. hopes to expand the business to fill his customers' requirements and to earn more income to help meet his family's needs. V. would like to request a loan to purchase additional ranges of drinks for re-sale. (V.'s wife is pictured, because he was not available at that day)

loans.use: To purchase additional ranges of drinks for re-sale.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha B. Espinosa, tiene la edad de 38 años habita en el barrio la Francia N 2 ubicado en municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo una hija de 9 años; la señora desde hace diez años de dedica a la agricultura, con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado establecer una manzana de piña, lo cual en estos momentos no tiene los recursos para poder aplicar los insumos necesarios. Es por eso que con esta solicitud de préstamo va comprar fertilizantes para que sea una buena producción y poder venderla a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha B. Espinosa is 38 years old and lives in the neighborhood Francia N 2, located in the town of Ticuantepe, with her husband, who supports her with the household expenses. They take care of their nine-year-old daughter. For ten years, Mrs. Martha works on agriculture. With her own effort, she has succeeded in establishing plots of pineapples. At this time, she doesn’t have the resources to apply the necessary supplies for her crops. As a result, with this loan, she will buy fertilizers so that she can produce more and will be able to sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her production

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La Sra. Dominga es una mujer que ha trabajado desde muy joven a sus 38 años de edad, ha logrado poder salir adelante con su familia, y con ayuda de sus padre pudo culminar su carrera, pues a un  no se ha casado y ni tiene bebe, sus metas por el momento es poder sacar una maestría en Biología, para mejorar su nivel académico, y en lo personal poder tener su propia familia. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción y poder terminar de hacer su cuarto, y poder gozar de sus mejoras que gracias al apoyo que Afodenic le ha otorgado esta haciendo sus sueños realidad de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Domingo is a woman who has worked since she was very young. Now 38 years old, she has managed to move ahead with her family, and with help from her father she has been able to complete her education. Since she has not yet married and does not have children, her goals for the moment are to get a master's degree in biology, in order to improve her academic level, and in her personal life be able to have her own family. This credit application is to buy construction materials, to be able to finish building her room, and to enjoy the improvements thanks to the support Afodenic has granted, making her dreams of having her own home a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material to build a room

loans.name: Mann

texts.en:
Mann S., 35, has sold vegetables in the Siem Reap market since 1999. She is able to make around $5 every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a farmer and also raises ducks. On average, he makes about $3 each day. This couple has four children, two of whom are in school while two are too young to attend.

Mann S. would like to ask for a loan so that she can purchase fertilizers to expand her husband’s cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Uchena

texts.en: Uchena runs a restaurant and also sells drinks. She is is 36 years old, married and has children. Uchena is applying for a loan to buy more drinks and foodstuff to cook and to sell. She thanks you for your generous support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and foodstuff to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fumilola

texts.en: Fumilola O. is 43 years old and married with 2 children. She sells drinks. She has two deep freezers and a fridge that she uses to keep her drinks cool for her customers. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000  to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Meira Awachango Jane Group

texts.en: Mrs. Jane A. is a married woman, aged 39 years. She has 5 kids (2 boys and 3 girls) all going to school. She has been selling palm oil and local brew for over 18 years. She is going to use the loan to purchase yeast & millet flour for making the local brew to sell, a goat and palm oil. She is hard-working and her dream is to educate her children and to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase yeast & millet flour for making a local brew to sell, a goat, palm oil.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a las tareas de la agricultura, sembrando los productos oriundos de su zona como la papa y la oca, y paralelamente cría animales. Trabaja arduamente para que luego de varios meses pueda obtener el fruto de su trabajo, la recompensa de su ardua labor, por ello se levanta muy temprano para dejar la comida lista y preparar a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela. Cada día sale a pastear a sus animales, camino a sus lejanas tierras de cultivo donde revisa que sus plantaciones estén bien y regresa para guardar a sus animales en su establo. Después de varios meses de esta recargada rutina, Elena y su esposo irán a vender sus productos cosechados y sus animales engordados, con cuyas ganancias pueden sostener las necesidades de la familia. Este trabajo, por muchos años, ha sido el único sostén de su hogar, y para Elena esta labor seguirá siendo el motor económico de su casa. Este es su doceavo préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las integrantes más antiguas de su banco comunal y se siente contenta de haber permanecido tanto tiempo, siendo reconocida por ser responsable y colaboradora. El dinero que Elena está solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono y fertilizante para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elena is 44 years old and lives with her husband and children in a house they own. Elena and her husband have worked in agriculture for 20 years, planting the native products of their area like potatoes and oca. They also raise animals. She works hard, so that after several months she can obtain the fruits of her labor. Therefore, she gets up very early to prepare the food and to get her children ready for school. Everyday she feeds her animals and then goes to her plots of land, that are far away, where she looks over her plants to see how they are doing. She then returns to the stable to check on her animals. After several months of this busy routine, Elena and her husband sell what they have harvested and the animals they have fattened. They use what they earn to maintain their family. For many years this work has been the only source of income for the family. And for Elena, this work will continue to be the main source of income for the family. This is her twelfth loan with MFP. She is one of the oldest members of her communal bank and is happy to have been with them for so long being seen as responsible and easy to work with. The money Elena is requesting will be invested in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de abono y fertilizantes

loans.name: Nhung's Group

texts.en:
Nhung Hồng Chử was born in 1987. Her husband is a laborer and they have a child. They have a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND (~ $180 USD).

Every day, she sells fruit in the market. Nhung Hồng Chử is a member of a two-member borrower group. She wants to borrow 1.972,000 VND (~ $118 USD) to buy more fruit to sell.

The other borrower in her group, Lân Thị Đỗ, was born in 1950. She wants to borrow 2.204.000 VND (~ $132 USD) to buy bamboo to make brooms.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Mayi Kasozi  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Mayi is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 45 years old, married, with six children aged between 17 and 31 years. None of her children goes to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with four people. Mayi takes care of three additional family members. There is no electricity or piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Mayi operates a retail shop in Makerere market and so she incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for business, and feeding the family. Besides this retail shop, she sells charcoal. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Mayi has been with MCDT for over eight months and is servicing her second loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her shop. Mayi is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more products for resale

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is the mother of two children named Woody and Judy who have both finished their studies. She is a housewife and at the same time manages a village store in their house located in Barangay Manano Mallig, Isabela. She is married to a farmer named Felipe A., who is 56 years old. She is busy with her business and sometimes goes into the field to assist her husband.

They live happily and peacefully with their adopted child named Marry-Ann. She dreams of sending her adopted child to school since her real parents are deceased. She treats her like her real daughter, and she wants the best for her as a real mother does for her children.
