Saleh is a 37 years old IDP and father of 2 children. He is from the occupied Jabrayil region of Azerbaijan. He is the only breadwinner of his family. He is Homeless and staying in a worker\\\'s hostel in Sumqayit city. Saleh opened his business in 2000. He started selling a small variety of vegetables in front of his hostel. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, he could hardly earn enough money to meet family\\\'s food and important consemption needs.
In 2004 Saleh borrowed $500 from Normicro and expanded his business considerable reaching in income. He opened fruit counter in the central market of Sumgayit city.
Now, he want to borrow $800 loan to open a vegetable section of his counter and purchase digital scales, though this, improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: Purchase digital scales and expand his business

loans.name: Santos Mercedes

texts.en: My name is Santos Mercedes, and I work making piñatas and selling birthday party items. My clients keep coming back for the beautiful piñatas and good prices. Currently, I need to prepare for the Children’s Day celebrations by making piñatas beforehand and working to be able to sell them without any delays.

loans.use: Purchase of colorful paper, glue, wire, newspaper, etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: According to Mrs. Lucy O., she started this business 14 years ago, and her family has benefited from it greatly.  Although she is 54 years old, her business acumen paves the way for her.  She is requesting a loan of $650 for the growth of her business.

loans.use: To buy more plywood to sell.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
Muhabbat has been in business for a relatively short period of time, 2 years. She needed to start trading in the market because she did not have a permanent job or source of income. Muhabbat is 39 years old and married, her husband is in Russia earning money.

Muhabbat sells children’s clothing, her business is small but earns a profit. She travels to wholesale markets herself to purchase inventory. She recently got a loan from MLF MicroInvest and used it to expand her product line. Muhabbat plans to use the new loan to purchase school uniforms.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Мухаббат начала заниматься бизнесом сравнительно недавно. Ее стаж всего 2 года. Выйти на базар торговать она была вынуждена, так как постоянной работы и источника дохода для нее не было. Мухаббат 39 лет, она замужем, ее муж находится в России на заработках. Она продает детские вещи, бизнес небольшой, но позволяет получить прибыль. За товаром она ездит сама на оптовые рынки. В Микроинвест она получила займ недавно и потратила его на расширение ассортимента. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ и планирует закупить школьную форму.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms for sale

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio César is a 26 years old enthusiastic entrepreneur who comes from a modest family of the city of Cuzco. Don Julio César has been working since he was 16 and never had an opportunity to study because of lack of funding.

He is presently living in the city of Juliaca and is offering urban transportation. Originally he drove a small tricycle which he conditioned and improved to transport comfortably 3 individuals, nevertheless the income was insufficient to cover his personal expenses. After having worked very hard for some time, Julio César had saved enough money to buy a motorized vehicle which he also uses for transportation service. He is still working from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. seven days a week to increase his savings and be able to buy another motorized vehicle for rent in order to increase his income.

He is applying for a loan of $425 in order to buy spare parts and fix his vehicle which is his only source of income at the present. The loan will be repaid in 6 months. Your support will really benefit Julio César.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer

Julio César es un joven de 26 años de edad, emprendedor y con muchas ganas de prosperar en la vida, proviene de una familia muy humilde de un distrito de la ciudad de Cuzco, por sus bajos recursos económicos se puso a trabajar desde los 16 años y no tuvo la oportunidad de estudias, actualmente radica en la ciudad de Juliaca y en principio brindaba servicios de movilidad urbana en un pequeño triciclo el cuál acondicionó y mejoró con el deseo de transportar cómodamente a 3 personas. sin embargo el ingreso que obtenía aún era insuficiente para cubrir sus gastos personales.Poco tiempo después de esforzarse y trabajar muy arduamente hasta altas horas de la noche pudo ahorrar lo suficiente para comprar un vehículo motorizado en los que también presta servicios de movilidad. Julio ahora inicia su labor a las 6.00 de la mañanay la culmina a las 9.00 de la noche todos los días de la semana, con el fin de seguir ahorrando y poder comprar otra moto para ponerlo en alquiler y generar más ingresos económicos.Ahora él solicita un préstamo de 425 dólares que utilizará para refaccionar su única herramienta de trabajo y se compromete a devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses. Tu ayuda realmente le será muy beneficiosa

loans.use: Solicita el préstamo para  refaccionar su única herramienta de trabajo con el fin  de  ofrecer un mejor servicio  a la población

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Tâm became a member of TYM fund in 1999. Her first loan was only 50 USD which was invested in livestock. She had a small piece of land. Her family's living condition was quite difficult. Then an opportunity was presented to her. The "People Committee" of her village (UBND xã ) had implemented a program to encourage farming. They would exchange farm land for unexploited one. Ms Tâm and her husband decided to make an exchange for an acre of land for fish farming. She was one of the first to exploit farming. She had some successes and some failures but she did not get discouraged. She was determined to reach her goal. With dedication and determination, she had been able to turn her farming business into a profitable one. Today she owns 1 acre for fish farming, a paddle of 200 egg laying ducks, 150 chicks. She had also invested in pig raising, she has 3 sows and 3 herds of piglets. The production from her family's farm is quite impressive (2 tons of pork, 1 ton of fish, 200 egg laying ducks). On average, her family makes about 450 USD/ month. She's requesting a loan of 950 USD to invest more in her farming (buy chicken feed, mash and fishes).

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 1999, ban đầu chị Nguyễn Thị Tâm chỉ vay 50 USD đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ, cuộc sống gia đình cũng quẩn quanh vài sào ruộng nên còn gặp nhiều khó khăn. Cuộc sống gia đình chị chuyển sang bước ngoặt mới khi UBND xã có chủ trương dồn điền đổi thửa, chị quyết định bàn với chồng đổi hơn một mẫu ruộng đào ao thả cá. Lúc bấy giờ chị là một trong những người tiên phong trong việc mở trang trại. Qua nhiều lần thành công và thất bại, chị vẫn không nản và cùng gia đình kiên trì theo đuổi mục đích của mình. Quả thật trời không phụ công chị, sau nhiều lần thất bại thì công việc làm ăn cũng dần trở nên thuận lợi. Hiện nay chị có hơn 1 mẫu ao thả cá, vịt đẻ hơn 200 con, vịt con 150 con , và đặc biệt chị đầu tư xây dựng công trình phụ đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn với 3 lợn nái và 3 đàn lợn con . Thu nhập của gia đình vừa qua quả thật rất đáng kể (lợn hơn 2 tấn , cá hơn 1 tấn, và đàn vịt hơn 200 con vẫn cho thu nhập từ trứng hàng ngày). Tính bình quân thu nhập gia đình chị là 450 USD/tháng. Chị đang xin vay 950 USD để đầu tư thêm cho trang trại của mình.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed, mash for pigs, fishes

loans.name: Felicitas Janampa Quispe's Group

texts.es:
Wilfredo, Felicitas and Lurdivina are partners of the Banco Comunal Proyección. Wilfredo has one son and his business is providing filming and photography service at different events and family get togethers that hire him. He is also a reporter for television and the region’s newspaper. Meanwhile, Felicitas has five children and she sells typical food like chicharrón (crackling), chuño, which is dried potatoes, morcilla which is sausage prepared with pig’s blood, aromatic herbs and rice. Felicitas also works at the market selling breads, fruits, and animal curd which comes from the organs of sheep and pigs and is used to add flavor to cheese. She will also sell Christmas bread during the holidays. On the other side, Lurdivina has seven children and she sells fish at the local market. She also sells cheese and, at the holidays, Christmas bread. They need loans of 600 soles, 1,000 soles and 600 soles which will be invested in purchases of film, tape, chuño, potatoes, meat, Christmas bread, fish and cheese. Their dreams are to have bigger businesses, a good education for their children, their own house, and a car.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Wilfredo, Felicitas y Lurdivina son socios del Banco Comunal Proyección. Wilfredo tiene 1 hijo y su negocio es servicio de filmación y fotografías en diferentes eventos y compromisos familiares que lo contraten y también es reportero para la televisión y boletín informativo de la región. Mientras que Felicitas tiene 5 hijos y vende comida típica como chicharrón, chuño, que es papa deshidratada y, morcilla que es un embutido preparado con la sangre del cerdo, hierbas aromáticas y arroz. Felicitas también es feriante y lleva panes, frutas y cuajo de animal que proviene de la víscera del carnero y cerdo, el cual es utilizado para elaborar queso. Además, por campaña navideña venderá panetones. Por otro lado Lurdivina tiene 7 hijos y vende pescado en las ferias, también vende queso y por campaña navideña venderá panetones. Ellos necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles y 600 soles que serán invertidos en la compra de rollos, cintas, chuño, papa, carne, panetones, pescado y queso. Los sueños que tienen son tener un negocio mas grande, una buena educación para sus hijos, casa propia, un carro.

loans.use: They need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 600 soles which will be invested in the purchase of film, tape, chuño (dried potato), potatoes, meat, Christmas bread, fish and cheese.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati, age 35, is married with a 5-year-old child. She started a business of selling clothes and shoes in 2004. She works daily from 11am to 2pm. In a month, her sales bring her about $35 in profit after inventory costs of about $135.

Bahati would like a loan to buy more stock to sell. She belongs to the loan group, Umoja, which totals 40 members who ensure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing inventory

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en: T. Farhod is 34 years old and he is married and has 3 children. Mr. T. started his business from scratch 7 years ago. Now he has his own trade outlet in the flea bazaar  thanks to some  business development loans from MicroInvest. Mr. T. is engaged in selling beauty supplies;  (hair dye/tint, creams, shampoo, soaps, scents and etc). He has a large assortment and many repeat customers. Now Mr. T. requests the loan of 2500 STJ to grow his business and increase his inventory because he has stiff competition.

loans.use: the business and assortment wideness

loans.name: Mwanate

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 31 year old Mwanate A.. She is single with one child, age eight, and has one other dependent who lives with her because she is an orphan.

In 2007, Mwanate established a grocery store business. Working seven days a week for 13 to 16 hours a day and assisted by her children, she earns about $60.00 per month from this business. Mwanate now requires a loan to purchase additional stock in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $65.00. In the future, Mwanate also plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, oil, and water in bulk

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a member of Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, and is located at Av. Micaela Bastidas S/N, in the Calleria district of Ucayali. She is 23 years old and has one son. Her husband works measuring wood. Esther previously received a loan of $100 and invested it in a business selling brooms.

She still woks at this business, and gets up very early in the morning to prepare her brooms, which she manufactures at home, and also do keep up with her housework.

With this next loan of $450, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy broomsticks, fibres and blocks.

Esther is very happy, saying that the loans she receives from Manuela Ramos are a great help in enabling her to be more independent and care for her son better.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Esther pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, ubicado en la Av. Micaela Bastidas S/N, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 23 años es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo es cubicador (quien mide la madera). Esther con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de escobas.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio, se levanta muy temprano para confeccionar sus escobas ya que ella misma las elabora en su casa y lo alterna con las labores domesticas de su hogar.

Con este préstamo recibido de S/. 1,100, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará palos para escoba, fibras, tacos.

Esther se siente muy bien, dice que es una gran ayuda los prestamos que recibe de Manuela Ramos por que la hacen ser mas independiente y puede darle lo mejor a su hijo.

loans.use: To buy broomsticks, fibres and other goods for her business.

loans.name: Marquita

texts.es:
Marquita belongs to the Dalilas Communal Bank. Her business is located at Jr. Pomarosa Mz. E Lt. 4 in the Yarina Cocha District, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 31 years old and has 2 children. Her husband is a public employee, but his income is not enough to meet the family’s daily needs. It is for this reason that Marquita received her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos, which she decided to invest in a motorcycle taxi.

Marquita's motorcycle taxi has provided much satisfaction, and she is using the profits she has earned to repair her house; in the future she would also like to set up a business. She spends her mornings looking after her children, and in the afternoons, when she can, she plays her favorite sport, volleyball.

Marquita will use this loan of 700 Soles ($275) to invest in the maintenance of her motorcycle taxi. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Before she received her loan from Manuela Ramos, Marquita had not known about such loans and had therefore never taken one out. But because of the advice she received she can now manage her own income and get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Marquita pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Dalilas, ubicado en el Jr. Pomarosa Mz. E Lt. 4, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 31 años, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo es trabajador publico, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Marquita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la inicial para la compra de un motocarro.

En la actualidad su motocarro le ha dado muchas satisfacciones, con las ganancias obtenidas esta arreglando su casa, para mas adelante poner un negocio, por las mañanas se dedica a atender a sus hijos, y en las tardes cuando puede juega el deporte que mas le gusta voley.

Con este préstamo de S/. 700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocarro.

Marquita, antes de ingresar a Manuela Ramos, desconocía acerca de los préstamos por que nunca antes había sacado uno, pero con las charlas que recibió ahora puede administrar sus propios ingresos y salir adelante.

loans.use: Maintenance for her motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Apoua Tavita's Group

texts.en:
This is one of the largest groups from SaP.. This group was started in May 2008 when they heard about the microloan programme on the radio. The group members live together in one village and they have known each other well for a long time, which is one of the requirements for them to form a group. They work in different businesses but mostly on sewing and the Samoan specialty of elei printing of tapa cloth. They are not far away from a large market and they also have access to their own village market, where the villagers bring whatever they have for sale. The group members are honest women and they are happy to support themselves and their families.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of material, sewing machines, and related equipment.

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma Delia is married and has three children, ages 22, 18 and 16. Due to their financial need, being that her husband was unemployed and she had to help with the household expenses, she started selling chips and other fried snacks from her home. Since all her sisters-in-law do the same, they recommended this activity to her, and little by little, she has grown her business. She now has a bigger and better stocked snack bar.

She needs a loan of US $975, which she will repay in 6 months, to purchase merchandise and add the sale of several items that her customers have requested. With your help, Alma will continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma Delia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 18 y 16 años. Ante la falta de dinero, ya que su esposo no tenia trabajo y tenia que ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, en su casa empezó a vender tostaditas y fritos ya que todas sus cuñadas se dedican a la venta de eso, y ella se lo recomendaron, poco a poco ha crecido su negocio ahora tiene un snack mas grande y surtido.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y agregar la venta de algunos productos que sus clientes le están solicitando. Con tu ayuda Alma seguirá haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and add the sale of several items that her customers have requested.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 27 years old. She is married with three children aged 4, 8, and 9. She also takes care of one other person aged 19 years old. She has been selling chips since 2003. She works daily from 7AM to 8PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 (US Dollars) in sales.

Maryam hopes for a loan to buy more potatoes for her business selling chips.

loans.use: To improve her business by increasing her inventory

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en:
Mahfuza H. is 30 years old. She is the mother of two small children. Due to matters of fate, she ended up living alone and is bringing up her children by herself.

Mahfuza was in need of her own income source to cover her household expenses and some medical expenses for her children. It was then that a friend introduced her to the clothing business. This occurred 5 years ago, and to date she has obtained very good earnings.

Now Mahfuza requires capital to purchase school clothing for teenagers for re-sale being that she has very loyal customers who continue to buy from her ever since she started the business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 2000 Somoni (600 USD), which she will repay in 8 months. With your support, Mahfuza will be able to offer her children a higher quality of life.

loans.use: Purchasing new school clothing for teenagers to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.en: "Cristo Vive" is a large group of 35 people, 20 of which are hoping to take out a loan. For many of them this is their second loan, and a loan they hope to use to increase their business. The business range from clothing sales to salons. Miline is the chosen group representative due to her hard work and dedication. Miline is a hardworking mother of 5 very young children, the oldest being only 10 years old. She took her first loan and started a small business of selling chicken and other types of food. With this next loan she feels like she can increase her business greatly and start making money to support her family. Her dream is to have her own store someday, and be able to provide her family with comfortable life. On behalf of Miline, the group, and Esperanza International, thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Food Vendor

loans.name: Samera

texts.en: Samera was born in 1984. She was previously a war refugee, but now lives in Rašljeva, a village in Bosnia.  She is married and has a two-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a driver and she raises sheep; together they make about 1,300KM/month (about $860 USD. The Muslim holiday called Eid Al-Adha commemorates the story of Abraham. Muslims traditionally slaughter a lamb or sheep on this holiday and divide the meat for their family, friends, and the poor. Samera has raised sheep to be sacrificed on Eid ul-Adha, but she needs to pay an animal doctor to analyze the blood and health of the sheep before she can sell them to her neighbors. She requests a 1,000KM ($650 USD) loan from Women for Women, International, which she will use to pay the veterinarian for his services.

loans.use: To pay a veterinarian to check sheep before they can be sacrificed for the Muslim holiday Eid Al-Adha

loans.name: Marvin Andres

texts.es:
El Joven Marvin Sánchez C. tiene la edad de30 años, su estado civil es casado, tiene 2 hijas  su hija mayor Karen  tiene la edad de 6 años cursa recientemente el 1 grado de primaria y su hija menor génesis de 7 meses quien no estudia, su estado civil, su esposa labora en la venta de mercadería en general, sus deseos son de prosperar y mantener su negocio activo en sus propósitos esta el obtener su propia casa ya que actualmente donde reside es de mama y desea acondicionarla para que sus hijas tengan su casa propia y también proporcionarle a sus hijas un futuro de estudios.


El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio  es de 4 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general que consiste en la venta de pantalones, camisas, trajes para niños y trajes para dama, el inicia este negocio por cuenta propia y empieza colocando pequeñas cosas de venta como: colas, diademas y trajes para niños y mas tarde su esposa piensa en la idea de la venta de ropa y es así como inicia este negocio, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de sus productos en Managua .
texts.en:
Mr. Marvin Sánchez C. is a 30-year-old married father of two children. The eldest child, Karen, is 6 years old and in the first grade, while the youngest, Génesis, is 7 months old. His wife works selling general merchandise. He hopes that his business will be prosperous and active. Because he currently lives with his mother, he plans on obtaining his own house and wants to furbish it so that his daughters can have their own house. He also wants to provide his daughters with an education.

He has had this busines for 4 years. He sells merchandise such as pants, shirts, children’s outfits and women’s dresses. He started this business on his own account, initially selling small items like hair bands, headbands and children’s outfits. Later, his wife got the idea of selling clothing, which was how this business was formed. The loan will be used as work capital because he needs to purchase merchandise in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Mrs. Chea Kuy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of eleven people, is located in Chreaek Village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Chea K. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members to receive a loan. She is a farmer who earns her living cultivating rice on the 1.5-hectares she owns. Over time, her fields have become infertile, which has resulted in a smaller crop and income. She has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer for the fields to make her crop more productive. In addition, she will use part of the loan to buy more pesticides to kill insects. Her husband, Mr. Thong Theoun, is a fisherman. Mrs. Chea K. is 34 years old and the mother of three children, who all attend the local school.
 
This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nine members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer for her fields to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Hok's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hok P. is the leader of this four-member group; all the borrowers live in Siem Reap Commune of Siem Reap Province. P. is currently a fish seller; she sells the catch from her husband's fishing and sometimes buys from wholesalers to sell retail in Psa Kroam Market. She is married to Chan Thoeun, 39, who is a local fisherman. She is the mother of seven children, all of whom are single. Two of her children are employed as garment workers.

Fishing is Thoeun's main source to earn the money to support his family's expense adequately. Recently, Thoeun can't catch as many fish as before because his fishing implements have broken, so he had a discussion with his wife and decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing implements.

The other three borrowers are:

S., 45, sells Khmer noodles. She needs a loan to purchase rice seed for her husband to grow.

P., age 44, sells meatballs in the market. She is asking for a loan to buy nets and traps for her husband for fishing.

S., 43, is a grocery seller. She requests a loan to buy different varieties of groceries to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fishing implements

loans.name: Nercy

texts.es: Nercy tiene 38 años de edad, es casada hace 18 años, madre de 4 hijos que actuadamente viven con ella. Se dedica a cultivar sus cultivos de fruta apoyando a su esposo, pero el arte y la creatividad, es lo que sobra en Nercy, por ello le agrada más la confección de cushmas nativas, que son como especie de atuendos de una solo pieza, y complementa esta prenda con la elaboración de collares y pulseras a base de semillas nativas, los cuales, en épocas festivas, por día llega a vender de 20 a 30 soles. Y con lo que respecta a la confección de atuendos que alquila a los colegios y escuelas por cada uno cobra 8 soles, pero en ocasiones llega a negociar por cada atuendo hasta 25. A Nercy le gusta confeccionar todo tipo de prendas y vestidos, pero tampoco deja de realizar su trabajo como agricultora, cada 15 días realizan la cosecha de plátanos y los negocia en su chacra misma. Nercy es la tesorera de su banco comunal, encargada de recolectara los pagos que cada mes efectúan los integrantes, bajo la asesoría del asesor de crédito. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra de plátanos, para conservar su buena producción; y la otra  parte en para la compra se semillas y telas para la confección de atuendos y collares.
texts.en:
Nercy is 38 years old. She has been married for 18 years, and is mother to 4 children who currently live with her. She works cultivating fruit with her husband, but art and creativity are what she has in abundance. For this reason, what she enjoys most is making native "cushmas", a type of outfit made from a single piece of cloth. She complements this item of clothing with necklaces and bracelets made from native seeds, which, in festival periods, can be sold for 20 to 30 soles per day. She rents the outfits she makes to high schools and elementary schools for 8 soles each, though occasionally she can negotiate up to 25 soles for each one. Nercy likes making all types of clothing and dresses, but she does not neglect her agricultural work. Every 15 days she harvests bananas and sells them from her own subsistence farm. Nercy is the treasurer of her communal bank, in charge of collecting monthly payments from the members, under the supervision of the credit advisor. This is her second loan through MFP, and she has been punctual in her payments. The money that she is requesting is to purchase fertilizer for her banana farm to maintain its good production, and to purchase seeds and fabrics to make necklaces and outfits.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials for her work

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 49-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Khaled has been working as a taxi driver since 1992. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan.

Khaled is special in his work because he is good in timing. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to be independent. In the future, he plans on purchasing a bus in order to organize trips.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Kostya

texts.en:
Kostya is married. He offers taxi services to help people to get around the city as well as between cities. Prior to having his own business, Kostya was employed as a driver. Then he decided to be self-employed. Today Kostya has many repeated clients that use his services often.

His monthly profit is about 5,000 UAH per month. This is the only source of income for his family. Kostya would like to receive 8,000 UAH to fix his car. His business goal is to be able to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To fix the taxi

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 32 años, es madre de 3 hijos en edad escolar y vive junto a su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Desde hace 4 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos helados como; hielo, chupetes, gelatinas, gaseosas, etc. en un ambiente que mandó a construir en su casa. Carmen también recorre las calles de su ciudad vendiendo sus productos, ella se esfuerza en su trabajo por el bienestar de sus hijos, y es lo que la motiva a trabajar cada día. Hasta ahora, esta labor le es rentable porque todos sus productos se venden fácilmente y obtiene ganancias diariamente, por lo que se siente satisfecha. También nos comenta que la mayoría de sus clientes son los niños. Para el futuro, a Carmen le gustaría tener una bodega en su casa para vender sus productos helados y otros comestibles. Con MFP ya tiene 9 préstamos, su banco comunal se llama “Campo Verde” y le gusta trabajar ahí porque sus compañeros de grupo son responsables y puntuales en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de una congeladora, esta tiene un costo de 2500 soles, pero ella cubrirá lo que falta con un ahorro de 1000 soles que tiene gracias a su trabajo. Con esta máquina podrá producir más hielos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 32, and she has 3 school age children. She lives with her husband who transports passengers. For 4 years she has been selling chilled products like ice, popsicles, jell-o, soft drinks, etc. in the space she had built in her house. Carmen also travels the streets of her city selling her products. She works hard for the well being of her children, and that is what motivates her to work every day. The work has been profitable because her products sell easily. She receives daily earnings, which makes her feel satisfied. Most of her customers are children. In the future, Carmen would like to have a grocery store in her house to sell her products and other foods. She has had 9 loans with MFP. Her community bank is “Campo Verde”, and she likes to work there because the group members are responsible and on time with their payments. She will use the loan to buy a freezer that costs 2500 PEN. She will cover the part of the cost not covered by the loan with her savings of 1000 PEN (that she has thanks to her work). With this machine she will be able to produce more chilled products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Rito

texts.en: Rito F. is a 32-year-old watch repairman from Lopez Jaena, Mis. Occ.  He is married and has 2 children.  He operates a watch repair shop in the town center. He plans to use the loan from Paglaum to buy accessories and equipment for his watch repair shop. His regular customers are his friends, neighbors and passersby. He dreams of expanding his business someday to provide for his children's future.

loans.use: Equipment and accesories for watch repair shop

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Rosa D. se dedica a su actividad de venta de queso y aunque no tiene las perfectas condiciones para desarrollar su negocio por encontrarse a la intemperie, busca la manera en como mejorar su negocio para brindar una mejor imagen de su negocio.

La señora Rosa hoy en día requiere de un crédito para la compra del queso y es por esta razón que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra del queso y de esta forma abastecer su negocio que tanto requiere de pronta inversión para mejorar su condición.
texts.en:
In the Chichigalpa neighborhood of the city of Chinandega, Sra. Rosa Davila operates a business selling cheese. Although conditions for developing the business are not the best, operating as she does in the open air, she looks for ways to improve her business and make it more attractive to her potential customers.

Sra. Rosa needs a loan now so that she can purchase more cheese. That's why she's applied to Ceprodel for a loan which she will use to buy cheese for her business, an investment that she urgently needs in order to improve her condition.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for cheese business.

loans.name: Nasreen Muhammad Jamil Khan Group

texts.en:
My name is Nasreen, and I have resided in a mid-size city named Riwind, Pakistan, since past 14 years. I operate a sewing clothes business to share the financial burden of my husband. My husband runs a cotton-selling business; he buys cotton on wholesale and sells to different shops. He has been in this business for the past 5 years. I’m applying for a loan to buy cotton so that my husband continues with his cotton-selling business and earns good income from it.

I’m the group leader of five other women from my locality. Farida begum baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy burning stoves to sell. Sadia baji and Rubina baji each wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

This is a group loan, and the loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cotton to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is happily married with five children and she is 39 years old. Cecelia sells drinks and foodstuffs. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase drinks and foodstuffs

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Cette femme est une veuve qui a à sa charge ses 04 enfants, l’activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de bien subvenir aux charges de ses enfants est le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Son ancienneté de 8 ans dans ce commerce fait qu’elle en a une parfaite maîtrise de la gestion. Actuellement elle fait face à une rupture de stock et sollicite de wages un crédit pour se réapprovisionner et subvenir aux charges de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is a widow who takes care of her four children. The business she runs, and which allows her to meet the needs of her children, is the sale of basic food products. Her 8 years of experience in this business has given her an excellent command of the required management skills. Currently, she is facing a stock shortage, and is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to resupply herself and meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic food products for resale

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is a native of Carodona, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 59 years old and married to Edmeciano, who is also her business partner. She is a mother of three. All of her children have their own families already, but the perseverance for earning a living is still burning within her.

With her desire to have income, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2008. Her previous loan was used as capital for her secondary business in the resale of toys for kids. But just recently, she opted to change her business to fish selling. She is positive that her business will grow and will bring her enough proceeds to live on.

Now on her second loan, she proposes an amount of 10,000 pesos as starting capital for her proposed business of fish selling. The loan will be used to pay for 120 kilos of assorted fish. She is looking forward to having a space in the market someday and also to renovating her house into more spacious and more durable one.

loans.use: To pay for 120 kilos of assorted fish

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en: Hernan L. L. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro. He is 29 years old. Hernan is married and has two school-aged children. Hernan owns and operates a clothing business, providing new clothing services to local community members. He also engages in a sari-sari (variety) store. He is just starting this business. In 2009, Hernan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Mrs. Lim S., age 30, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living selling cooking supply from home. Since 2002, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. Beside her current work, she takes time to distill wine and uses the leftover of wine to feed some pigs behind her house. She is married with two children who are secondary students. Her husband sells firewood that he carves them from the forest.
In order to earn extra income, Lim S. will be using the loan to accumulate the quantity of cooking tool to sell.

loans.use: To accumulate the quantity of cooking tool to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a hardworking young entrepreneur. She is 26 years old and a married mother of two children. Agnes started her retail business in 2002. It has done well thanks to her first loan that helped her buy stock in bulk. She now requires 40,000 KES to enable her to purchase more supplies.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal H. makes a living raising pigs from her home and grows rice during the dry season. She is 42 years old and is married with three teenage children. Phal H. was not available during taking the photo, so her husband is shown instead. He assists her in the business.

Rice farming and pig raising are the main sources of income for Phal H. and her family; thus, she is requesting a loan to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, pig food, and a piglet for her daily routine activities.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer, pig food, and a piglet

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is thirty years old and the mother to 4 children. All her children are in school now. Edi has been selling grocery products for seven years in the market to support her family. She says business is doing well but she lacks the funds to purchase groceries in bulk. Being able to purchase in bulk is very advantageous because it helps to avoid price hikes and frequent travels to fill the demand. She therefore wants to use the loan to buy more products to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her increase her savings towards the welfare of her children.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a 31-year-old married mother of four children who all attend school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Margaret is a hairdresser by profession. She has a salon by the roadside in her community. She also trades in jewels. According to her, she has two apprentices. Margaret has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure artificial hair and other working materials to improve upon her services.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La  Sra. Rosario L. M.  tiene 38 años de edad, tiene un Molino para quebrar maiz, se levanta a las cuatro de la mañana para atender a sus clientes y trabaja hasta las cinco de la tarde todos los dias, tambien vende ropa americana como ser camisas faldas, pantalones sueteres, Rosario es muy conocida por sus vecinos ya que es muy social y amable lo cual le ha veneficiado a tener buenas ventas,  vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, el cuenta con su taller de soldadura y de esta forma pasan al cuidado de sus hijos, Rosario tiene un costo mensual de de $ 165.00 y obtiene ingresos de $ 480.00 generandole una ganacia de $ 315.00.
necesita el credito para comprar ropa interior como ser brasiere, bikines, calsetines y un fardo de ropa mixta ya que los clientes que van quebrar maiz le compran ropa, ahora la esta comprando por unidad en un mercado de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa. pero desea comprar un fardo de ropa para tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosario L. M. is 38. She has a mill to grind corn. She gets up at four in the morning to take care of her customers, and she works until five in the afternoon everyday. She also sells American clothes like shirts, skirts, pants and sweaters. Rosario is well known by her neighbors. She is very friendly and likeable, which has helped her to have good sales. She lives with her three children and her husband. He has a soldering shop. That way they take care of their children. Rosario’s monthly cost is $165.00. She takes in $480.00, generating $315.00 in earnings. She needs the loan to buy underwear like bras, bikinis, socks, and a bundle of mixed clothes. The customers who go to grind corn buy clothes. She is now buying by the unit in a market in the city of Tegucigalpa. But, she wants to buy a bundle of clothes to get greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothes in bundles

loans.name: Denny Cecilia

texts.es:
Denny Gómez de 27 años de edad, vive en la zona de la Perimetral en Guayaquil, tiene una casa de caña y solo tiene un servicio básico que es el agua, Denny comenzó su negocio para poderle ayudar a su esposa y pensó en ponerle una mini tienda.  

Denny trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00pm en su tienda tiene caramelos compra la funda a $ 1.50, comprar a $ 0.20 los papel higiénico c/u, compra pañales a $ 0.10, colas etc. Una de las mayores complicaciones que tiene en su negocio son los ladrones, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos familiares siendo obrero en construcciones tiene 3 hijos uno de 7 años, 3 años y 1 año el mayor estudia en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 50 fundas de caramelos, 100 pañales, 50 colas. En el futuro quiere arreglar su casa para construirla de cemento y poder así tener mas espacio para su negocio.
texts.en:
Denny Gómez is 27 years old. She lives in the area called "The Perimetral en Guayaquil." She has a house made of sugar cane reeds and only has basic services -- running water. Denny began her business to be able to help her husband, and she decided to have a mini store. Denny works from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. in her store. She has sweets and buys wrappers at $1.50, to buy toilet paper at $ 0.20 each one, she buys diapers at $ 0.10, colas, etc. One of the biggest challenges she has in her business is thievery. Her husband helps her with the family expenses as a construction worker. They have 3 children, 7 years old, 3 years and a one year' old. The eldest studies in a financial school. With the loan, she wants to buy 50 sweets wrappers, 100 diapers, and 50 colas. In the future she wants to rebuild her house of cement and be able make more space for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sweets, diapers and colas

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: El señor Ramiro Rodríguez es casado con la señora Ma. D. los Ángeles Castillo anteriormente solicitaron un crédito para la terminación D. un proyecto que tenia. Crédito que fue pagado siempre con puntualidad y están tramitando nuevamente nuestro apoyo para techar el frente D. su vivienda y así darle una mejor vista y mas protección al hogar. El labora para una empresa constructora como albañil donD. tiene 6 años D. antigüedad son una familia muy unida ya que cuentan también con el apoyo D. su hijo quien labora en una empresa D. colocación D. vidrios y ventanas.
texts.en:
Ramiro Rodríguez is married to Maria D. los Ángeles Castillo. They had a previous loan to finish a project they had. This loan was repaid on time. They are negotiating a new loan to install a roof on the front of their home so that it will be more attractive as well as proviD. better protection for the home. He has worked as a laborer for a construction company for six years. They are a very unified family which also counts on the support from a son who works for a glass and window installing company.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a roof on the front of the house.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo, vive en la  calle 2  de la zona villa exaltacion, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El es viudo vive con una de sus hijas la cual ya tiene su hogar propio.

Trabaja como chofer propietario de taxi particular. An las calles centricas de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la reparación de su vehiculo, en la parte de pintado y tapizado.
 
Es el noveno crédito con Impro, y el tercero via KIVA  la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito
texts.en:
Guillermo lives on the street 2, exaltacion villa in the city of El Alto. He is a widower and lives with his daughter which already has her own family.

He works as a taxi driver in the streets of La Paz city. The loan will be used to repair his vehicle with new paint and upholstery.

It is the ninth credit with Impro and the third with KIVA. The evaluation qualifies him for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair Taxi
